review_content:
0,33 bottle. Az üveg és címke klasszikus, a ser színe közepes arany, szűrt,  habja fehér, átlagos. Illata gyümölcs, főleg narancs, barack, nem túl intenzív. Az íz: IPA . Keserű, komlós, gyantás, sokáig érezhető. Ezt szeretem bennük. Inkább gyümölcsös apa beütés, de nem rossz, egy nagyon selymes jó kis IPA. Szénsav kevés így több az íz.  Kifejezetten jó. *** Újabb kóstolás - ezt Olaszországból kaptam : minden ugyanolyan. Jó, megbízható IPA. 
***
The glass and label are classic, the color of the ser is medium gold, filtered, the foam is white and medium. The aroma of fruit, especially orange, peach, not very intense. The taste: IPA. Bitter, hopy, resinous, long lasting. That's what I love about them. I prefer fruity dad punch, but not bad, a very silky good little IPA. Carbonic acid is low so it tastes more. Good

Amber, minimum foam, almost none

Sweet malt, barf, wet floor, pine, no hops at all.

Maybe the one I have gone bad.  Only thing left is sweet malt on the palate with medium hoppy sweet malt finish.

The aroma is very pleasand and give you many tropical fruits. The taste is ultra smooth and has bitter/ sour direction. Many fruits there. Grapefruits, Mango, Orange ect. The mouthfeel is great and the carbonation soft.
All in all, one of the most pleasable "IPA" I have drink. Really, very serious beer.
Pours a clear golden yellow with a medium white head. Some floral notes. The flavor was a citrus, hoppy flavor with a mildly bitter finish. I could drink this beer again.
Amberkleurig bier  met een gebroken witte schuimkraag. Tropische fruit Geuren en smaken. Ananas, grapefruit,  limoen en een vleugje caramel. Aangenaam bitter.

@ Röhälla 20210720. Can (330 ml) from Systembolaget.
Hoppy, fruity and caramely with grapefruit and pine, medium body with an oily texture.
The finish is bitter and fruity.

Elle fait partie des classiques concernant les IPA, et c'est mérité !
Robe blonde dorée, avec une très légère mousse. Bien sûr, on a le droit à des notes très fuitées, et surtout des agrumes qui apportent une belle amertume. Dans le style, c'est hyper efficace donc si vous aimez les IPA, vous pouvez y aller les yeux fermés !
Goudkleurig bier met een stevige witte schuimkraag met fijne structuur. Geuren van citrus en een fruitige smaak met bittere afdronk. Redelijk 'cleane' IPA.

Clear golden with a white head, moderate but with a good lacing and retention.
Aroma: Hops: Grapefruit, citrus, grass, passion fruit, orange. Malt: Hay, grains.
Mouth: Mostly bitter of course, Some fruity sweetness, but overall impression is dry. Watery. Medium body.

Robe orange dorée, limpide, moyennement effervescente
Senteurs mangue, melon, agrumes et pins.
Première gorgée rafraichissante très portée sur le pin et le houblon, la suite porte sur les agrumes, le miel, le citra et l'ananas.
Finale sèche sur des notes herbacées et de sève de pin.
Une IPA intéressante à un prix raisonnable, une bonne compagnie pour une classique de l'apéro sans se ruiner !
Par contre, rien à envier aux ténors du genre, elle ne concourra pas dans la cour des grandes ;)
0.33 flaske på El Paso i Kragerø. Mørk gul/gyllen. Masse kullsyre. Deilig Og veldig typisk India Pale Ale med god ettersmak og middels bitter..

355ml bottle from store, drinking it at home after a pizza on 10/06/2021 BB 03-03-2022 Pours a very nice crystal clear amber with some not too long lasting frothy off-white head on top, nice lacing. Good aroma of malt, quite resinous, pine, very hoppy, orange, grapefruit, tropical fruits.. Taste is sweet and malty at first, with nice caramel, pine, orange and grapefruit notes and a pretty strong and dry, bitter finish. Quite a resinous and bitter aftertaste that keeps on going with each sip but is kind of balanced by the starting malt and caramel sweetness. A bit lightly flavored at start though, before the hoppy bitterness kicks in and stays. Moderate body and a bit oily texture, medium carbonation. 6.2% abv and very drinkable, good and very hoppy west coast ipa if a bit aggressive in the finish. Quite a nice one!

Clear amber, big frothy head.
Big aroma of hops, pine, tropical fruit. Very good.
Taste is disappointing, same as aroma but weaker. Nice bitterness at the end. 
Watery palate.
OK.

Pours a structured  foam head on a crystal clear amber. Good carbonation. Aroma is light and malty. Balanced malt and hops taste with a very thick mouthfeel. Light citrus and coriander, and quite bitter aftertaste.
Alone at home. Goldblond colored beer with small white head and no carbonation visible. Hopped floral aroma. Full sparkling palate. Finish is bitter spiced dry

0,33 bottle. Az üveg és címke klasszikus, a ser színe közepes arany, szűrt, habja fehér, átlagos. Illata gyümölcs, főleg narancs, barack, nem túl intenzív. Az íz: IPA . Keserű, komlós, gyantás, sokáig érezhető. Ezt szeretem bennük. Inkább gyümölcsös apa…
Amber, minimum foam, almost none Sweet malt, barf, wet floor, pine, no hops at all.…

The aroma is very pleasand and give you many tropical fruits. The taste is ultra smooth and has bitter/ sour direction. Many fruits there. Grapefruits, Mango, Orange ect. The mouthfeel is great and the carbonation soft.…
Pours a clear golden yellow with a medium white head. Some floral notes. The flavor was a citrus, hoppy flavor with a mildly bitter finish. I could drink this beer again.
Amberkleurig bier  met een gebroken witte schuimkraag. Tropische fruit Geuren en smaken. Ananas, grapefruit,  limoen en een vleugje caramel. Aangenaam bitter.
@ Röhälla 20210720. Can (330 ml) from Systembolaget. Hoppy, fruity and caramely with grapefruit and pine, medium body with an oily texture.…

Elle fait partie des classiques concernant les IPA, et c'est mérité ! Robe blonde dorée, avec une très légère mousse. Bien sûr, on a le droit à des notes très fuitées, et surtout des agrumes qui apportent une belle amertume. Dans le style, c'est…
Goudkleurig bier met een stevige witte schuimkraag met fijne structuur. Geuren van citrus en een fruitige smaak met bittere afdronk. Redelijk 'cleane' IPA.

Clear golden with a white head, moderate but with a good lacing and retention. Aroma: Hops: Grapefruit, citrus, grass, passion fruit, orange. Malt: Hay, grains. Mouth: Mostly bitter of course, Some fruity sweetness, but overall impression is dry.…
Robe orange dorée, limpide, moyennement effervescente Senteurs mangue, melon, agrumes et pins. Première gorgée rafraichissante très portée sur le pin et le houblon, la suite porte sur…
0.33 flaske på El Paso i Kragerø. Mørk gul/gyllen. Masse kullsyre. Deilig Og veldig typisk India Pale Ale med god ettersmak og middels bitter..

355ml bottle from store, drinking it at home after a pizza on 10/06/2021 BB 03-03-2022 Pours a very nice crystal clear amber with some not too long lasting frothy off-white head on top, nice lacing. Good aroma of malt, quite resinous, pine, very hoppy, orange,…
Clear amber, big frothy head. Big aroma of hops, pine, tropical fruit. Very good. Taste is disappointing, same as aroma but weaker. Nice bitterness at the…

Pours a structured  foam head on a crystal clear amber. Good carbonation. Aroma is light and malty. Balanced malt and hops taste with a very thick mouthfeel. Light citrus and coriander, and quite bitter aftertaste.
Alone at home. Goldblond colored beer with small white head and no carbonation visible. Hopped floral aroma. Full sparkling palate. Finish is bitter spiced dry

355ml bottle brewed in Holland(!) at 6.2%. Clear golden-amber with a good-sized, fair-duration head. Brown bread malt and orange peel and floral zest on top of melon rind aroma. Moderate carbonation, decent body. Lightly floral finish, reminiscent of lilac and tangerine. Brown bread malt in the aftertaste alongside orange citrus twang. Real fleshy orange vibes here, with good grapefruit dryness. Very solid premium supermarket offering; even brewed under license this does give you a good idea of what cutting-edge USA craft IPA is like, albeit more of an idea than an outright example.

Easing out of lockdown, April 2021. Keg at Winston Hotel, Southampton. Quite drinkable, but tastes like a standard 5%  hoppy lager (which always tend to taste like a dry, thin hoppy 4% ale) rather than a 6.2% ale, let alone an American style IPA. Hmm. Anyway, refreshing and quite harmless. I wouldn't object to another, though I'd prefer a proper beer. [2.6] 

March 2017. 355ml brown bottle from some supermarket. Reasonably bold modern hops on a pale biscuit malt base. The usual thing. You either like this sorts of beers or you don’t. They’re not my favourite style. Not enough malt character, too dead, too bland, and too much hop character, too zingy and sharp. And no yeast character - that’s been filtered out. Doesn’t feel like a 6% beer, and certainly not a 6% ale. The malt base could be a lager it so lacks character. Thankfully there’s not too many hops so this is at least drinkable, but it’s otherwise quite dull. [2.4]

Thursday, April 15, 2021. Bottle, 33cL. 6.2%. Gift by Marielle. Merci :) A  shining amber clear beer with a medium white head ; short retention ; good lacing ! Light caramel, herb, hay, citrus. Light bitter, medium refreshing, weet note ; cristalline. Light to medium body, thin texture, average to soft gaseous, dry fruity refreshing finish. Overall, very good, great ! Pure, crystalline watery feeling ; no cereal-grainy character as in french craft IPAs (Popihn and so on...).
De un color dorado oscuro, con dos dedos de espuma de buena retención. Cuerpo y carbonatación media. Aroma a lúpulo y malta. En boca destacan matices herbáceos y lupulados. Final seco.

2 liters keg from home tap
bitter grapefruit and resinous aroma
light sweetish caramel soon overwhelmed from rude hoppy taste
over carbonated
it's supposed to be sessionable but difficult to drink
Nez agrumes. Amertume assez marquée mais ne prend pas le dessus. Mousse assez consistante.
Clear blond colour, white foam. Nose of tropical fruit, citrus, a bit grassy. Medium sweet, some bitterness. Ok.
Bière a forte odeur de fruit ,pour moi pêche litchi ,mais a forte amertume qui cache un peu le goût. légère agréable que je reprendrais avec plaisir

Old rating from 18-05-15 - 355ml bottle, pours amber with a white foamy head. Aromas & tastes of citrus, orange, grapefruit, pine, bread & grass. Medium body. Moderate carbonation. Medium bitter finish. Enjoyable
0,355 l bottle from Systembolaget Enköping. Good IPA, alhough not among best ones.

Poured from 12 oz bottle into pint glass. 2" sudsy off white head drops slowly with moderate lacing. Color is hazy orange with abundant streaming carbonation. Aroma dominated pine, citrus, tangerine, over white bread backbone. Mouthfeel is medium, sticky, with a slowly drying finish. Flavor bready malts with orange and pine resinous hops. Overall: excellent
Super complex hop profile with an extremely palatable beer taste structure. It will overwhelm some of the more delicate foods, but stands up to (compliments) hearty or spicy meals.

A strong smell of grapefruit and citrus. The medium large white frothy head has a normal duration, the body is dark orange. A quite bitter and strong taste, very dry. The body is medium strong with a lively carbonation.

330ml bottle. Pours a darkish gold with medium amounts of pillowy white head. Grassy and pine hops on the nose with no heat. Medium body with mild grass and pine hops at ht efrint and light biscuity malt at the back. Has an interesting flavour throughout which I cannot pick, but I assume its due to being a different water source.
IPA de llibre. Aroma d'herbes i amargor justa, retrogust agradable i refrescant.
Blank, bit floral and fruity, very mild, brilliant golden to amber color with small sized white head, taste is bubblegum, floral, resin and citrus, thin body, average carbonation.

Poured from a bottles, properly chilled. Amber in the glass with a moderate white head. Strong IPA flavor, yet pleasant with dinner. Best not to linger too long on the tongue. Let the smooth brew flow across the palate, and down the throat as an excellent compliment to your dinner.

(bottle 12 fl.oz. from Americanbeer.cz online shop) Overall: Good IPA, malty-hoppy balanced.
 Aroma: Hops, pine, malty.
 Appearance: Clear dark golden. Medium, white head.
 Taste: Light sweet, malty, caramel, medium bitter, hops, pine, citrusy.
 Palate: Light-medium body. Bitter finish.

amargor medio
olor a lupulo herbal y pino
espuma blanca media
color tipo lager

# 2311; 10/2020. Citrusy, resiny and tropical fruits in aroma. Deep gold brilliant body; white head. Tropical fruits, slightly caramel and alcohol. Very good IPA. 0,5 l, bottle, supermarket, Schlanders (Südtirol, Italy).

0,33l lahvové zakoupeno přes nový internetový obchod americanbeer.cz. Na takto vysoké hodnocení docela průměrná IPA. Vysoká karamelovost, to mi na tomto pivu vadí nejvíce... Kdysi v 90 letech asi určitě super, ale v současnosti je pivovarský svět jinde.
병을 열자마자 흘러나오는 시트러스향. 적당한 탄산과 과하지 않은 솔, 풀향이 깔끔한 마무리를 보여준다. 부담스럽지않게 시간을 보내기에 깔끔한 맥주

Robe brune clair. Peu de mousse et de bulles . 
Nez sur le canabis , le citron , la mangue , des notes de caramel.
Bouche sur la mangue , le caramel. 
Amertume assez forte , final sec.
Easy IPA to drink and eat, nothing special but I liked, it is a honest IPA.

Imperial pint can poured into a 20 oz Belgian Tulip.

Aroma is strong - it hits as soon as I cracked the can. Citrus and tropical. Orange and melon. Slight pine.

Clear deep amber color, topped by a tall bubbly head with OK retention, leaving thick lacing down the glass. Great look.

Taste is an interesting combination of the citrus, tropical fruits, and (as a weaker player) pine. The bitterness begins in the aftertaste of the first sip and grows from there with each successive drink. The aftertaste is decidedly resiny and bitter. This influence grows, giving the entire taste a piney, resiny, and bitter dominance after half-way through or so, more than you might expect from the IBU rating. The citrus and tropical fruits remain as a delightful aspect throughout. I really like the taste of this beer overall.

As the beer warms, it develops a malty, slightly sweet undercarriage that balances the bitterness quite well.

Body is moderate for the style, perhaps on the thick side (again, for the style).

Overall, an excellent American IPA of the West Coast substyle.

Aroma : Toasted sweet caramel malt, light citrus fruity hoppiness, with a faint herby/green vegetable note  Taste : As aroma. Light citrus hop, light caramel, light boiled green veg. Not horrible just a all too light and understated
Bon... une IPA que j'apprécie, un peu au moins, c'est assez rare que pour le souligner. Elle m'a semblé plus maltée que houblonnée, et c'est sans doute ça qui m'a un peu séduit.

Dark gold, small white head with some retention. Hoppy with grapefruit, tangerine and pine. Moderate body with a good malt content. Taste is quite sweet and malty at first and then a zingy tropical fruit and pine note, and then a moderately high bitterness kicks in but not overbearing. Best consumed warmer than fridge temperature though. This is an very good IPA, my only criticism would be I would like the carbonation to be a bit softer.

Bona i clàssica West Coast. Predomini maltos, resinosa i punt de caramel. Amargor perfecta. Potent i consistent pels seus 6,2 abv. Fantàstica opció de lineal de supermercat. Ampolla de 355 ml del Carrefour

With a glint in his eye and a spring in his step Terry Pemberton strode into the bookies and headed for the cashier. Last night he had placed a bet on Lagunitas India Pale Ale being a great beer. Today he was here to claim what was rightfully his.

The description of this IPA on the beer menu promises citrus and fruit. Instead, I sensed many much heavier, pine-type hops, even a hint of gasoline spirits. A well-balanced strong taste, with just the right bitterness. Refreshing IPA.

Bière pression bue au Kostaldea à Anglet, mousse peu persistante, robe dorée, fines bulles en petite quantité, senteur et surtout goût persistant au fond du palais avec d'agréables notes d'agrumes prononcées.
Aroma of some citrus and some pine.  Nice gold color which a white head.  Sweet malt up front.  Some caramel and grapefruit.  Medium bitterness on the finish.

From a shop in Italy. Golden Amber with a hint of orange. Thin head, very light citrusy nose. Flavor is smooth, thinner than expected for an IPA but refreshing and tasty. Lemon, melon, pine, very clean brew. Gotta get back to the bbq before the chicken burns...

Clear copper pour with a medium white head. Aroma is fresh and crisp. Hops, pine, citrus fruits, mango, caramel. Taste over medium bitter sweet. Medium bodied with average carbo. Tasty IPA. Not spectacular but tasty nonetheless.

355 ml bottle @ home, served in a teku glass, due date: 2021/03/17.

Aroma: very weak aromas of citrus, grapefruit, toasted malts, hints of sulfur when swirled. Hints of flowery and perfumy overtones.

Appearance: light amber to copper color with light beige and very fluffy foam made of small to medium sized bubbles, high head thickness, low to medium retention, medium Brussels' lacing. No haziness. 

Taste: low to medium sweetness, medium bitterness, low sourness. Flavors of citrus, grapefruit, toasted and light caramel malts, caramel, hints of burnt caramel and burnt sugar, orange, tangerine. Balance is slightly toward the bitterness but well balanced for the style.

Mouthfeel: medium body, oily to watery texture, medium carbonation, medium long dry finish with medium bitterness and the same previously mentioned flavors. Alcohol is very well hidden and only noticeable because of its throat and mouth warming. Astringency is low but slightly noticeable.

Overall: good appearance, weak aromas and more robust flavors of citrus, grapefruit, toasted and light caramel malts, orange, tangerine. This beer is brewed in Netherlands and maybe it's not as fresh as it should. I want to try the real thing because this one is not very good.
Color dorado. Buena retención de espuma aunque sin tener una gran Corona. Refrescante. Retrogusto amargo y resinoso. Una ipa clásica
Colore dorato brillante e schiuma persistente, profumo agrumato e retrogusto amaro resinoso.

Cappello mediamente denso di dissipazione controllata. Colore arancio. Buona la persistenza dell’aroma con finale luppolato. Gusto una po’ spigoloso ma di buon effetto. Aromi erbacei e resinosi tipici della ipa.
Bonne amertume. Un nez fruité. Une persistance en bouche. Un léger goût de malt. Plutôt sèche en bouche.

So we have a weed smelling Beer from a weed loving brewery, maybe that’s why the founder sold to Heineken??? Cause Heineken was founded in Amsterdam if that needed explained. And Amsterdam is the weed capital, if that also needed explained! So the aroma is very interesting to say the least, and the flavour is just mayhem in your mouth, which makes it a fun, but beautifully imperfect Beer. Therefore, this mad experiment kind of works!

Read the full review here:
www.beerwithus1.wordpress.com/2020/05/17/lagunitas-ipa

Steady pour from a 19.2 oz can into an elongated tulip produced a soapy, 2-finger, off-white head riding on a clear, effervescent, honey-amber body. The head held up pretty well, fading slowly to a surface film that left traces of spotty lacing. Early scents of sweet malt and citrus - grapefruit, orange, lemon - with some late pine, wet grass and a whiff of skunky onion. Flavors of grapefruit, pineapple and pine, then crackers, grass and herbs. Well balanced, nicely carbonated, medium bodied, with a dry, mildly bitter, lingering finish. Still solid, West Coast old school!

Robe paille qui tend sur le caramel
Douceur d'orange confite en bouquet. Puis cette mousse neigeuse invite à liper. 
Très amère. 
La sucrosité attendue disparaît assez rapidement.
L'amertume l'emporte.
Manque d'équilibre.
Bottle 0,355ltr: Clear orange coloured brew with an dry bitter taste with hints of grapefruit, caramel an some subtle pine.
Una cerveza de sabor muy potente en boca y altamente refrescante, al final se percibe altamente el lúpulo y un toque de naranja

Testa bianca compatta e persistente con texture fine, corpo limpido color rame con splendidi riflessi arancio. Profumo di malto, pane e miele, agrumi, luppolatura erbacea. Al palato elegante base maltata, caramello, cracker, la parte luppolata porta sensazioni agrumate ed un bel finale luppolato, erbaceo e resinoso di pino. Ben bilanciate le componenti dolce e amaro. Corpo leggero ma solido e frizzantezza media e pungente. Buon IPA vecchia scuola.

355 ml bottle. Dark golden colour, small head with average durability, partly lacing, soft carbonation. Nose is sweet malt, caramel, some honey, and fruity, peaches. Flavour is medium sweet, medium bitter, malty, herbal, grapefruit, light pine. Pretty good one!

35.5cl can at home. Appearance: crystal clear golden with a fairly big white head. Aroma: quite malty, but mostly hops, orange peel, pineapple on syrup, some citrus. Taste: medium sweetness and high bitterness. Notes of malts, orange peel, hop bitterness. Palate: medium bodied, slick texture, lively carbonation and a dry finish. Overall: quite okay for a supermarket IPA
Dark orange-gold color with off white head. Smells malty and fruity. Tastes very hoppy up front with a malty-floral sweet , acid aftertaste , not one of my favourites IPA .

Bouteille de 33 CL achetée chez Super U. Robe dorée quasi limpide avec une fine mousse blanche. Arômes d'agrumes et de citron. Texture crémeuse, carbonatation moyenne, faible amertume et légère. Notes herbacées, houblons. Finale sèche.
Draft at J.M cafe in Rouen. Pours a medium white fluffy head... A clear amber to gold colour. Smells of hops citrus hay and grass. Tast is a lots of hops citrus grass fruity. Lots of carbo..

355 ml bottle. Pours clear deep golden with small head. A: fruity, caramely, water melon T: medium carbonation and body, malty, mango, quite bitter, dry, much better when it warmed up, high drinkabillity,
Simple and straightforward with a pine grove aroma, nice bitterness and sharp finish.
Lovely IPA. Fully rounded with a subtle sweetness to it and no harsh notes. Fully recommended!

Hops aroma is so subtle, almost imperceptible, a big mistake for an IPA. I liked so much the choose of the malts that give a pleasant biscuit taste without expiring in the caramelly. Golden clean color. Bitter as I expected . The foam is frothy and long lasting. It's a pity for the hops aroma.
Smooth west coast ipa.fruity,bitter,pine.nothing to complain about.tastes better than typically from a bottle.

Dzięki Krzysztof.
Wygląd: Barwa złota, klarowna. Piana biała, średniej wysokość, zbudowana głównie z drobnych oczek, opada do ostatniej warstwy pozostawiając średni lacing.
Aromat: Zbalansowane, słodkie białe i egzotyczne owoce, brzoskwinia, mango, gruszka, melon oraz słodowość chlebowa, lekko tostowa z subtelnym akcentem miodu na średnim poziomie. W tle niskie cytrusy w postaci pomelo i pomarańczy.
Smak: Podobnie jak w aromacie, pojawia się średnia żywica dorównująca składowym z aromatu. W ustach półsłodkie, treściwość średniowysoka, bardzo gładka, kremowa i mączasta z lekką lepkością, wysycenie średnioniskie. Goryczka średnia, żywiczna, całkiem długa i miło zalegająca, przyjemna. Finisz półwytrawny z goryczką żywiczną i nutami owoców tropikalnych. 
Ogólnie w aromacie i smaku zbalansowane. W smaku bardzo fajna żywiczna goryczka, pozostająca przez dłuższą chwile w ustach bez żadnego gryzienia, szorstkości. Ciało pełne, pszeniczne.

This is a very good average ipa. Not the best, not the worst, just consistently good.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tight fluffy white head stayed on a light copper coloured still body.
Malt, stewed fruit & hoppy aroma.
Medium bodied, soft on the tongue with a well carbonated back.
Bitter hops, malt, stewed fruit, pine & pithy tastes.
Banging!
0,355 l Flasche. Helles Bernstein, stabiler Schaum. Riecht und schmeckt nur dezent hopfig, leicht säuerlich, frisch, dazu angenehm bitter.

Belle robe ambrée avec une mousse blanche discrète. 
De beaux arômes houblonés.
Superbe amertume, belle complexité. 
Top a redeguster avec plaisir

Bottle. Golden, average and mostly diminishing head. Moderate, malty and dryish - lightly sweetish aroma, faint caramel and light tropical fruitiness, citrus/light grapefruit hoppyness. Body is medium to full, malty and dryish - lightly sweetish, light caramel and light - some tropical fruitiness, some citrus/light grapefruit hoppyness. Finish is average, malty and dryish, - lightly sweetish faint caramel and light tropical fruitiness, citrus/light grapefruit hoppyness,. Well hopped IPA. Could be little bit drier.
C est pas si mal pour une IPA grand public qui appartient au géant hollandais. Facile à boire
Una buona IPA ... il profumo del luppolo non è particolarmente presente ma sufficiente per rispecchiare le caratteristiche del sul stile..amaro pungente nel finale nel complesso una buona birra!

12 oz bottle. Smells of grapefruit and pine. Amber in color and clear. Bitter through and through, tastes of resinous pine and grapefruit, slight malt sweetness. Nice balance. Bitter finish. A solid IPA.

Body: golden, crispy, thick white head.
Taste: a bit of melon, bread and honey.
Aftertaste: long and hoppy.
Decent PA sample, strong enough, full-bodied.
Good bite, and strong flavor. Heavy aftertaste. Good beer nothing that will wow you. Pours nicely with a golden amber finish and good thick white head.

I have found this bottle, at one monoprix, at Paris, Faubourg Saint-Antoine. Drinking and enjoying this bottle, at our rented flat, at Colmar, in september 2018. Unfortunately bought by heineken even though I have found this beer correct, a classical IPA with fair notes of pine tree, certain side of sweetness, eucalyptus, dry malt, average hop and bitterness.

E ovo je prava IPA. Prava američka IPA sa 6,2% alk. Inače su amerikanci vrh što se tiče IPA-e, bar je takav moj dojam. Jako lijep miris, ugodna gorčina, perfekcija od pive. Pitka i traži još jedan gutljaj. Šteta pa nemam bar koju gajbu toga. :-/ uspio sam samo jednu 0,355 bocu donijeti iz Pariza.

355 ml bottle. Unclear golden, big foamy head. Pine, grapefruit, mango, herbal hops, some caramel. Hoppy bitterness, malty sweetness. Full bodied, oily texture, soft to lively carbonated, dry hoppy finish. Good classic IPA!

This beer has beautiful color, with an elegant head structure, presenting a quiet, expressive song. However, all this is folderol when the delightful hop bouquet springs forth, carrying one directly into the hop fields, themselves. But that, too, drops away as the dramatic intensity of the beer’s finely balanced flavor profile flows forth. I’m impressed.

En copa, cerveza dorada con una fina capa de espuma blanca. Aroma fresco a pino y resina, junto con cereal blanco, fruta dulce muy madura, hierba, y una nota floral. En boca, textura ligera y acuosa, de carbonatación baja/media y amargor media en garganta. Sabor dulzón a fruta madura, junto con cereales, caramelo, hierba, pino, y un fondo muy resinoso. Una IPA que pese a no ser un cañón de lúpulo, resulta ser una delicia. Equilibrada, de gran aroma y sabor, con la amargor perfecta.

Pours copper with really good head. Hoppy grassy sappy aroma. Creamy nutty piney flavor. Not a hop bomb like most west coast ipas, but a really fine balance of classic Brit IPAs and hop forward ones. I like it.
Una clásica ya de supermercado. Esta buena, lo que hace pensar que cuando eran de verdad CRAFT debido estar espectacular. La consumo bastante
Uzupełnienie ocen piwnych bez opisu z uwagi na przeniesienie z papierowych zapisków.
Hazy amber beer with medium head. Citrusy aroma. Big hoppy bitterness with citrus and touch of pine. Lasting bitter aftertaste. I love this beer, partly because it reminds me of being in California.
Great ipa in DFW, have a comfortable sleep on the plane after drink. 16oz a bit strong.
Light amber/orange, bit hazy with medium white head. Slight citrus aroma.  Remarkable hoppy bitterness with quite strong lemon sourness.  Lasting bitter aftertaste

355 ml bottle. Clear gold color with average white head. Smells nice coriander with some grapefruits. Taste are average IPA hops bitternes with some coriander notes and hidden grapefruits. Easy drinkable and refreshing. Average time aftertase grapefruits bitternes and some pineapple taste.
Could be 4 seasons in CANADA! Reminds me of 1960s Labatt 'IPA', a brew faithful to the roots of the ideal recipe.

Bottiglia 33ml. Colore ambrato chiaro, bollicina fine e schiuma media. Birra mediamente corposa dal profumo fresco di agrumi e miele. Sapore luppolato con buona persistenza. Non amo le Ipa ma a mio gusto questa é una birra gradevole.
Didn’t like it. Uncommon taste of pineapples is really disruptive. I wouldn’t get this one again, I’d rather choose another beer.

On tap at 'Foodhallen'. Clear, deep amber with a medium large, frothy, almost stable, off-white head. Sweetish, gently fruity-resiny aroma of mango, orange jam and some pine. Gently sweet, malty, moderately bitter, quite resiny and slightly fruity taste of orange jam, pine and some mango, followed by a short, gently bitter, quite resiny and slightly grassy finish. Medium body, smooth, slightly creamy and moderately effervescent mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Pleasant old school IPA.
Golden pour with a nice creamy white head.  Citrusy with a hint of malt.  Very drinkable, good value, an everyday IPA.
Aromat bardzo ładny, nie ma do czego się przyczepić. Niestety w smaku słabo, bardzo jednowymiarowo. Goryczka mocno zalega
Decent tasting IPA. Aroma of pineapple. Doesn't really have the ordinary taste of the IPA.
A good IPA that I had in the afternoon sun in Amsterdam. Definitely recommendable IPA.

Draught at the craft beer shop in Maji Square near Yuan Shan MRT, on Jayne's leaving day. Aroma: pineapple, processed cheese. Appearance: clear dark amber, residual lacing. Palate: medium-bodied and astringent, average carbonation; bitter, very astringent finish. Taste: medium-bitter, grapefruit, some vanilla. Refreshing but ordinary.
I just do not like this and I love IPA's. If it's the only IPA available to order I drink something else.
A bitter disappointment - and not in a good way. Did Heineken took away all the flavour and hops?
Llena de aroma y sabor tropical y de hierba fresca. Intensa, muy equilibrada, refrescante, de gran textura media y enorme bebestibilidad. Fantástica!
Clear golden colour with an average white head. Malty, citrus, some lemon peel, piney, soft carbonation.

Poured almost copper color, half inch but relatively thick head which stuck around and provided nice lacing to the end.  It was an ok balance of hops and malty background but the finish was harshly dry and bitter which leaves me with an overall "meh".
On tap at The Lake View House on Orange Lake, Newburgh, NY.
Esta é uma cerveja excelente, normal, mas sem duvida a repetir. Ligeiramente amarga (gosto muito)
Ipa très classique fruitée amertume moyenne sans interêt particulier mais facile a boire

Bottle 355ml at M/S Silja Serenade. BBE 2020-02-19. Pours clear golden, off white head. Malts, caramel, grapefruit, pine, fruity hops.  Medium body, average carbonation, bitter finish.

Original rating 8-3-8-3-15 from bottle (sample) at SBWF 2009 2009-09-26.

Bottle, 0.355l. Clear amber/copper pour, two finger soapy white head. Good retention, long lasting. Lots of lacing on the glass. Nice on the nose, malty background, good hop character, fruity and herbal notes. 

Medium body, medium carbonation. Relatively thick texture, pleasantly chewy. Bittersweet taste, more on the bitter side. Seems a bit harsh and unbalanced but I have to say that this sample doesn't seem too fresh. Poor storage probably, shame. Otherwise, aroma is mostly fine, caramel malt a little bit more pronounced then it should be, hops in the background. Grassy hops and citruses. Strong herbal spicy notes. Dry. Finish is dominated by harsh lingering bitterness and caramel malt. Yeah, like I said - not so fresh sample, sadly.

Therefore, I'll score it a bit lower then it probably deserves but I'll adjust my rating accordingly once I get ahold of a fresh sample.
Lagunitas IPA 6.2%. Golden, citrusy aroma, light bodied, pale malt, earthy, tropical fruit, citrus fruit, pine, bitter fruity finish. Pleasant IPA from Petaluma, California 🇺🇸

Bottle 0,33L. Clear golden/cooper color with small, frothy, white head. Aroma of pine, grass, nettle and herbs. Taste goes from light bitter start to medium to heavy bitter hoppy finish. Medium body, dry texture, soft carbonation, metallic finish. Very pleasant,  hoppy, bitter ipa!
Nice taste if not a little sharp. Had it on holiday for the first time after being reluctant to try it but was pleasantly surprised. Overall a nice tipple.
Muy buena IPA, con gran amargor. Buena espuma, buen color, agradable al paladar aunque puede resultar cítrica
The beer that turned me onto IPAs. Still my go-to. Pricey but delicious. A little piney, more citrusy but not too much. If you don't like this, you don't like beer.

#3219
Clear, gold, medium white head. Grainy aroma, some fruit. Taste is dry, grainy and grassy, lightly bitter, floral  and bit spicy. Medium & medium.

355ml bottle. Pours clear deep golden colour, medium sized off-white head stays. Aroma is quite, grainy, malty sweet, buttery. Taste is malty, grainy, buttery, burnt caramel, aome mild grassy hops. Medium body, average carbonation. Easily drinkable, sweet brew

Aromas cítricos y frutales
Aspecto rubio claro espuma poco persistente 
En boca frutal y final cítrico amargo 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Gold with a frothy to foamy white head. Peach and pine aroma. Taste is straightforward mildly bitter without any twists. Dry at the end. Okay.

Draft at Moriartys. Clear gold pour with soft white foam. Big splashes of lace. Somewhat malty IPA. Feels full but not overly sweet. Earthy citrusy hops. Sugar cane. Mandarins. Bamboo. Warms to some additional woodiness. Not overly complex but well done.

Tap. Dark orange colored, hazy with a full creamy white head. Nose is full of tropical fruits, mostly passion fruit along with some pineapple and citrus notes and hints of pine. Good strong bitter taste that is balanced by a light sweetness. Medium bodied and carbonated with a smooth mouthfeel. Flavor is tropical us well. Passion fruit and citrus with a stronger malty caramel note. Leaves a bitter and fruity aftertaste.

Dark Golden, Clear, white BeerHead, with frothy, abundant foam. OK Head retention. Powerful citrusy and tropical fruits hints on the nose, like orange, litchi, pineapple, and zesty.Medium sweetness, soft carbonation, High bitterness,  crispy mouthfeel. Quite malty-sweetness in the mouth, also having light caramel, orange, litchi, slightly piney, and hop resins. Hoppy in the aftertaste.

09.07.2019 -- 0.355l bottle from auchan in strasbourg, bb 12.12.2019. pours a clear golden with a medium head. aroma of woody hops, caramel. flavour of chewed pencil, spruce, grapefruit zest. not too sweet, more woody than juicy. long bitter finish. pleasant.
This is a amazing, I have never try it! Taste good and I will buy it again.
Bottle from Albert Heijn. Pours clear golden, bubbly off white head. C hop nose, some diacetyl. Smooth palatable. Bitter but balanced. Standard IPA

Bottle 0.355l, many thanks, Rooz! Clear, deep gold colored. AROMA- citrusy, spicy, tropical fruit, malt, pleasant alcohol. FLAVOR- neutral, bitter, citrusy, tropical fruit, spicy and woody hops, slight touch of paper. Fuller bodied. 
Good, for macro brew.

Mam sentyment do Lagunitas, bo to jeden z pierwszych kraftów jakie wypiłem świadomie. Oczywiście teraz ciężko jest je nazwać kraftowym (dla nie zorientowanych browar został wykupiony przez Heineken) Kolor złoty, praktycznie klarowny. Aromat niski, lekko owocowy. Smak słodki, owocowy, dość ciężki, ale mocno pijalny.
Casi roza las IPAs belgas, donde el sabor maltoso y los lupulos nobles hacen que no sea amarga en exceso. Muy bien equilibrada. Espuma blanca de dos dedos con buena retencion

Spina da 0,20. Schiuma scarsa e volatile. Colore oro. Carbonatura adeguata. Aromi erbacei, fiori di campo e pompelmo. Gusto molto deciso e secco, aggressiva al palato. IPA con gradazione moderata. Finale breve ma intenso. Consiglio 7/10.

Color naranja pálido,sin turbiedad, transparente. Espuma blanca de dos dedos de espesor y muy buena retención. Aroma herbal, más ligeramente fruta tropical y cítrico, grano y malta caramelo al atemperar. Sabor en esa línea, algo más cítrico que tropical, ligero caramelo al atemperar, final seco, de amargor entre herbal y resinoso, alcohol bien integrado. Textura entre acuosa y oleosa. Carbonatación media.
Drank in the waldorf pub Manchester, Friday night (2 days ago) I really enjoyed it, my missus was drinking it too she hates beer and she was impressed. Crisp, refreshing
Belle couleur et bonne odeur. Une bonne ipa avec des notes de fruits pas trop marque et une amertume assez légère

Bottle: 330 ml, at home Price: 1.99 eur

Labai, labai gera IPA.

Fyldig skum, mellem karbonering
Let til mellem Humlet, ikke så bitter.
Svag røget smag.
Una cerveza Indian no muy amarga. Se sale un poco de la norma en este tipo. Agradable y gustosa. Muy rica.

Alleen al het serveren in een confituurpot doet de waarde van dit bier halveren. Walgelijk. Weinig karakter, je proeft alleen felle hopbitterheid, zijnde stro, den en aarde, beetje citrus, weinig aromabitterheid.  Zo zie je maar dat het erin steken van zoveel mogelijk hoppen (43!) het bier niet noodzakelijk beter maakt.  Verveelt zeer snel.  En dit zou dan één van de populairste bieren van Amerika moeten zijn...

Color dorado translúcido con espuma media blanca de buena retención y residuo medio. Aroma ligero a frutas de hueso maduras, hierba y caramelo. Sabor a caramelo, melocotón maduro, resina y notas a membrillo, pomelo y hierba. Dulzor ligero afrutado con final amargo resinoso de larga duración. Textura semi-oleosa, cuerpo medio y carbonatación medio-alta. Una muy buena IPA de fuerte carácter americano que roza lo rancio, resinosa y a precio decente.
Fles op terras Brasserie Thuys, Sint-Oedenrode. Licht roodbruin bier met schuim. Smaak is bitter hoppig en fruitig met iets van thee, citrus en ananas. Mooie smaak balans.

Espuma blanquecina que permanece con una consistencia media, color amarillo anaranjado transparente con burbujas puntuales brotando, aroma ligero y floral en nariz, sabor muy agradable con notas frutales no muy amarga y final seco.

Clear pale golden colour, light white head. Strong fruity aroma, hints of pineapple, mango and tangerine. Bitter taste, hoppy flavor overall, some sweet malt blended with it. Light body, medium carbonation, bitter aftertaste. Good.
Good straightforward and well balanced IPA. Hops and malt sit well together and a satisfying bitterness comes in at the end.

Botella de 355 ml @ Carrefour Zaragoza.
Color dorado ámbar, cristalina. Espuma blanca algo escasa, poca retención.
Aromas cítricos, pino y ligeras notas a cereal. En boca es afrutada (pomelo, piel de naranja), herbal y algo dulzona. Amargor medio-bajo. Final seco.

0,355 l bottle. Pours amber golden with big rocky off white head. Plenty lacing from medium lasting head that leaves a permanent veil. Aroma  is quite hoppy, pine, tropical fruit, citruses along with caramel and bready malt base. Taste is medium sweet and medium bitter. Body is medium, mouthfeel slick and carbonation above average. Finish is long, hop driven with pleasant lingering bitterness. Very nice.
V stanicnom pivovare. Krasna silna tropickoovocno chmelova vona. Medova farba a husta pena. Chut chmelova svieza mierne cukrikova. Na konci dlho ostava.

Colore giallo scuro-ambrato, schiuma densa e persistente che vira verso il giallo, composta di bolle sottili. 

Al naso un aroma "fresco" di frutti tropicali (mango, etc).
Nel gusto viene lasciato spazio a note di agrumi.
L'amaro al palato è forte e persistente. Il corpo è medio-alto. L'alcool si fa sentire ma non è invadente, non c'è la sensazione di "calore".
Il finale riporta note fresche ed erbacee, con quel classico gusto acidulo e un po' secco che si sente in molte IPA. 

La carbonazione è medio-alta. Perlage medio-sottile.

L'intensità olfattiva e al gusto è molto forte ed è facile abituarsi subito agli aromi e anestetizzarsi il palato. Conviene fare qualche pausa o pulirsi il palato di tanto in tanto con un po' di cibo.
Interessante come durante la bevuta emergano tutti i possibili principali profili aromatici del luppolo (frutti, poi agrumi, poi erbaceo).

Pours clear dark golden with a white head. The aroma is slightly hoppy with some mats, pine, resin and bread. Medium body with a light carbonation, sweet and a light bitter. The flavor is not really IPA-like hoppy with pine, resin and some grapefruit along some bread-isch taste. Finishes with a piney bitterness. Overall decent but not really very special.
Orange color, middle foam size. Good beer, aroma and taste fit into the style.
Blonde au goût très prononcé: ce n'est pas une bière de soif diluée mais une bière solide complexe. Le houblon domine un arrière goût un peu amer. Pas mauvaise.

Bevuta alla spina.
Aroma con buona componente di luppolo.
Colore ambrato, schiuma media. Molto limpida.
Gusto luppolato e amaro.
fgP
On tap in black tap, dubai. Pours golden copper with good head. Aroma is beatifull, fruity, mango, pineapple and zesty. Taste little let down compared to nose. Overall good beer.

12 fl oz bottle. Appearance is an almost clear golden-copper colour, topped with a big two fingers head of white froth, which persists for a while. Aromas are a hoppy mix of tropical fruits, pineapple and mango I would hazard, but not distinct, and floral hops. Taste is nicely balanced combination of tropical fruity sweetness, malts, pine and bitter, without any flavour dominating. Medium bodied, nice average carbonation.

Bottiglia. Il gusto al naso è indirizzato verso il luppolo. L'olfatto viene stimolato in maniera elevata e l'esistenza olfattiva è apprezzabile. Il cappello di schiuma ha una buona tenuta. La grandezza delle bollicine è medio-fine. Bollicine medio-fini costituiscono anche la forma del perlage. Il colore è giallo ambrato. Il corpo è strutturato. L'amaro è deciso. La forza gustativa è elevata e la durata è buona. Il gusto è piacevole. Le sensazioni boccali finali risultano luppolate e di pronta beva. Il finale è amarognolo. Il retrogusto è intenso. Al gusto vengono donati toni di miele, frutta secca, luppolo, agrumi, pompelmo e ananas.

Kolor jasny bursztyn, lekko mętne. Biała czapa piany, obfita, drobna i trwała.
Nos: stęchłe cytrusy, żywica z drzew iglastych, mokre słody takie trochę już stęchłe.
Paszcza: wyraźna słodycz, goryczka średnia, 
Właśnie zauważyłem że piwo dzisiaj kupione przeze mnie w sklepie jest już dwa miesiące po terminie. Także spróbuje podejść niedługo jeszcze raz do tego piwa i skoryguję ocenę bo ta jest poniżej średniej dla tego piwa...
Przy drugiej próbie już zupełnie inaczej.
Piękne aromaty egzotycznych owoców. Idealna goryczka w smaku.
Pozostaje mi tylko podnieść mocno ocenę dla tego piwa.
Aroma 7. Appearance 4. Taste 7. Palate 4. Overall 15. Hops and citrus fruits aroma. Bitterness, mango, and citrus fruits taste. Long palate.

Piwo koloru złotego, klarowne z jasną, puszystą pianką. W aromacie przyjemne cytrusy i dojrzałe, słodkie owoce tropikalne. W smaku dużo więcej cytrusów, a zwłaszcza grejpfruta, w tle owoce tropikalne. Trochę za wysokie wysycenie jak dla mnie, alkohol dobrze ukryty, ciało ok. Grejpfrutowa goryczka na finiszu. Na wczasach w miejscu, w którym trudno o jakieś dobre ipa, to piwo smakuje całkiem przyzwoicie.
Amarilla dorada, translúcida. Eminentemente cítrica, equilibrada, no aporta nada nuevo pero cumple. Le falta algo de cuerpo no
De Hipercor. En copa Teku. Jugando a Life of a Pixel Classic. IPA suave, no muy amarga, citrica, donde el dulzor de la malta no queda tapado por el lupulo y le da un agradable caracter acaramelado
Bottle shared. Pours golden color. Aroma of citrus, malts, sweetness, pine, tropical fruits. Mediumish body, quite bitter.
Copper pour. A: exotic fruit, pineapple, lychee, kiwi, citrus. T: bit watery, some malts, medium bitter. Finish is kiwi.

Aroma: citrus, hoppy, little floral
Appearance: amber, clear, white foam, nice head, 
Taste: hoppy, bitter, citrus 
Mouthfeel: fresh, thin
Dobry balans, zywicznego chmielu i tostowej podnudowy slodowej niszczy tepa goryczka.

Bottle in a bar in Basel. Pours a clear dark golden with a white head. The aroma is medium hoppy and lightly malty with pine, resin and bread. Medium body with a light carbonation, a medium sweetness and a light bitterness. The flavor is again medium hoppy with pine, resin and some grapefruit along some bready malt. Finishes with a medium piney bitterness. Overall decent but not very special.

Aroma: 7
Appearance: 4
Taste: 7
Mouthfeel: 4
Overall: 13
Golden with firm white head. Lifted citrus hops with a caramel malt undertone. Palate clean, sweet delivery with a firm bitter finish.
Salon piva.  Deep golden color with medium white head. Aroma of caramel, citrus hops. Taste, caramel malt, citrus hops, zest, pines. Medium long hoppy bitter finish.
Tap at Salon piva. Easy drinking. Light caramelly backbone, moderate bitterness lingering into a long finish. Citrusy zesty hops character. Simple, good.
Bottle as a gift drunk at home. Orange appearance with thin white head. Aroma is malt, earthy, hoppy and caramel. Flavour is fruity, hoppy, dry and malts.
Fijne IPA uit het schap bij de lokale AH. Citrus, lekker hoppig midden,ietwat flauwe afdronk. 6,2% uit de USA. Maar onderdeel van Heineken.
Gold with a nice white head and a floral, hoppy nose. Well-carbonated with a malty mouthfeel and a hoppy finish.
Klassiker, schönes WestCoast IPA ohne viel drumherum , vollmundig, rund. Hohe Drinkability

355ml bottle. Clear dark golden with a thin dissipating white head. Aroma of herbs, citrus hops, orange, bready malts, grass. Taste is similar to aroma. Slightly sweet arrival, which quickly develops into a hoppy bitterness which is the backbone of this beer. Malts subtly make their presence felt as well. Dry bitter finish. Medium mouthfeel. Solid.

On tap at Schmoozy's, TLV airport. Clear gold, white head. Mild pine and citrus aroma, bitter, slightly dry, pink grapefruit taste with a hint of malt. Medium body, lively fizz, slightly buttery finish - taps are sure well-maintained here...

Eines muss man den Amis lassen: IPA brauen können sie -besonders die von der Westküste.
So ist dieses ein wunderbar feingehopftes Bier mit schön komponierten Aromen, wo die Balance zwischen Bitterkeit und Süffigkeit passt.
Ein Bier für einen Feierabend, wenn die Außen-Temperatur auch etwas höher ist.

Pours a clear, copper-gold, with minimal head. Aroma is quite grassy, with some bread, a touch of citrus, and a strong tang of piney hops. Flavor follows, with the hops more dominant. Quite a bitter, hoppy bite to the finish of this one. It's a good, workhorse of a beer, nothing too fancy here.
Tap (O'Learys, Torp Airport). Clear, dark golden colour. Aroma is pour, delicate citrus, malty. Medium herbal, long bitterness. Too much carbonated but not so bad.
Bottle. Golden blonde. Slightly herbal, citric aroma And flavor. Moderate hop character. Even a bit of smoke. Drinkable.

35,5cl bottle, clear amber color, small lasting white head, malt aroma with fresh grass and grapefruit notes, balanced bitter flavor, light to medium body, floral finish with pine aftertaste, nice and refreshing

Bottle at Jinso (Amsterdam Arena Boulevard). Dark yellow with a white head that fades rather quickly. Aroma of citrus and hops. The taste is bitter but with a sour undertone. The aftertaste is bitter!
This beer have a beautiful taste. It has a hoppier taste, but it's not too heavy, and least but not last it has a very massive foam.

Wonderful orange peel  and mango aroma, light head and orange hue color. The taste is absolutely exceptional wonderful with fresh hops and orange crisp citrus and again a taste of mango that knocks a Blue Moon out any day.

Grabbed this as along with my 2nd sampling of New Dogtown Pale Ale.  For some reason I am finding the Pale Ale hoppier than this.  For an IPA, and compared to the other IPA/hybrids from Lags, I thought this would be hoppier than what it is.  Still a smooth IPA, crisp for the summer season, but will be going back to the Lil' Sumtins/Sumtin' Extras, Lucky 13s, or some of their others in the future.  Glad I finally got to try this after all these years....as it slipped by and had thought I had sampled.
6 pack 355ml bottles, £4.99 in Harrods rival Home Bargain Bletchley. Decent brew straight from the bottle. Fruity, slightly spicy, fresh hops. Easy drinking and very enjoyable.
Bottled Bumble Bee's Baja Grill, Santa Fe, New Mexico, USA. Not overly complex, but pleasantly bitter and easy to drink IPA.
Golden body and white head. Sweet bread, grass, some citrus and mango aroma. Hop flavors of pine and tropical fruits with bitter finish. Medium body and carbonation. A good beer.

evenwichtige IPA
redelijk zwaar, maar niet storend
schuimkraag verdwijnt snel
aanrader

Bottle from Albert Heijn supermarket in Gorinchem, The Netherlands. 
The beer is clear golden to amber colored and has a nice stable white head, with very good carbonation. 
The aroma is light malty and very fruity, with notes of caramel malts, citrus, grass, flowers, mango, oranges, tropical fruits and spices. 
The taste is medium bodied and starts with caramel malts, and goes to hoppy bitterness with a nice fruit explosion and in the end spices. 
The finish is refreshingly dry and pretty bitter.
Botella 355ml  Color Ambar clara,espuma blanca,altas,fina,resistente.Aroma notas citricas,pino,frutal.Sabor amargor moderado,citrico,frutal

12floz bottle, no date, marker cost is $9/six-pack, pint glass. Aroma - grapefruit and honey. Appearance  - golden with freat clarity and a whitish head that provides lacing. Taste - moderately bitter, grapefruit and toast. Mouthfeel - medium bodied and carbonation. Overall - your prototypical AIPA...good.
Amber body, white foamy head, just one of the best west coast IPAs out there

Clear amber color with off-white head. Aroma has piney hops and sweet orange peel. Taste is a bit sweet at first with tangerine flavor, gets more bitter towards the finish with resiny hop notes and bittersweet orange candy. Medium body and carbonation. Really well balanced and easy drinking IPA.
Dark yellow with a medium, off-white head. The aroma is of grapefruit and resin. The taste is likewise, solid grapefruit and pine resin with just a hint of maltiness. Very solid IPA.
Very hoppy IPA with strong bitterness. Appearance is deep orange, almost clear.

As good as they come... I wish we had some more Lagunitas selections in Canada - I can only get this one in the chubby 355ml bottles (also the 12th of Never)... I think they went a little crazy with the "43 different hops and 65 various malts" but what do I know - I just drink them...! A great very satisfying beer for all occasions - just a notch below the 12th!

Excellent bier.  Hoppy smell bitterrness expected,  but not the hop bombs which call themselves IPA.  This is another of what I call a true IPA.  On tasting the wonderful carbonation pushes the malt around the mouth with the hops and the lingering bitterness.  To be honest the true wonderful hop flavour lies in the after taste.  Beautiful golden colour great head retention and soooo sessionable if you can stand 6% bier all day.  The perfect bier.

Appearance: bright golden, great head
Aroma: good nose, fresh citrus and pine
Palate: medium Full mouthfeel, medium low carbonation
Taste: solid hop flavours, pine, tropical fruits
Overall: great beer
It’s an awesome IPA man. Said nobody ever. NO. It’s an overkill of rotten hops.

Fra flaske
Klar og gylden med hvidt skum.
Aroma af harpiks, metal, malt, citrus.
Smager let og bittert med høj karbonering. 
Bitter finish.
Dark yellow/orange in color, foam leaves nice and thick traice of it on the walls of glass. Taste: balanced bitter, lingeres in aftertaste.
Bevuta in bottiglia.  IPA dal colore dorato. Buona e non particolarmente amara.

5 January 2019. At Westies, Ghent. Cheers to Eurogamer crew!

From tap. Pours clear golden/orange with a lasting, small, frothy, off-white head; little lacing. Aroma of lime juice, lemon zest, unripe mandarin, mango, pineapple, perfumed hand soap, flowers, yellow grapefruit, golden berries, pine needle & onion. Taste is light fruity sweet, 'basic' apple peel, some pineapple & mango on a bready malty base, faintly yeasty; light to medium hoppy bitter middle brings yellow grapefruit & orange rind, a bit piney & grassy too, accent of sourish lemon zest. Dryish, piney & grassy hoppy finish, lingering bitter fruit rinds, yeast, mango & apple peel. Medium body, slick/oily texture, soft carbonation. Classic IPA, drinkable & accessible.

Robe Blonde. 
Légère mousse.
Pleine de bulles.
Amertume et goût typique du houblon Citra: Fruit de la passion, légères touches d'ananas.

Une bonne IPA industrielle.

Un fruité d’agrumes mettant en vedette l’orange, le citron et le pamplemousse titille le nez. Notes de sapin Beaumier et subtilités florales également perçues. Grosse mousse dense et crémeuse sur liquide ambré, clair et pétillant, laissant une magnifique dentelle sur le verre. Entrée de bouche effervescente et piquante suivi d’un léger fruité et d’une finale plutôt terreuse. Le fruité et de levure et des houblons est important et se développe sous forme d’orange, de pêche, de poire et de subtiles fleurs des champs. La base maltée est sous-jacente au fruité et nous laisse une impression de doux caramel. La finale se veut un mélange de terre et de sapin. De corpulence moyenne et de texture onctueuse, elle développe une vive effervescence qui lui donne un indice de buvabilité très élevé. Une IPA Américaine certes et superbement bien bâtie, mais avec une touche Anglaise bien sentie.
The original and first IPA I fell in love with. Strong citrus smells, and full aromas. Slight bitterness, yet a great example of an American west coast style IPA.

Flasche 0,355l: Bernstein, leicht orange, klar, stabiler feinporiger Schaum; sehr frische + fruchtige Nase, fruchtige Süße, Zitrusnoten, Orangen, Limetten, Limettensaft, kräftige frische Hopfennoten, Malz, Getreide, etwas Karamell, Hefearomen, leichte fruchtige Säure; fruchtiger + frischer Körper, kräftige frische Hopfennoten, würzig, Zitrusnoten, bittere Orangen, Grapefruit, etwas Grapefruitzest, cremig, kräftige Kohlensäure, leichte Hefearomen, zunehmend trockener; angenehmer fruchtig-trockener Nachgang mit kräftigen Hopfenaromen
Draft.  Reasonably hoppy aroma and flavor, but has a mild off-flavor, like a singer in a choir who's just off-key to be noticed.  Overall not bad, just not a first-tier IPA.

355mL d'une IPA d'une brasserie à cheval entre la Californie et l'Illinois, voilà ce que nous réserve cette Lagunitas au nom bien hispanique. Blonde bien rousse et totalement translucide, petit collet de mousse blanche qui colle au verre, stable sur 1mm.  Nez très floral dans la grande tradition des IPA modernes Américaines, sur la bergamote, la lavande, la sauge, le thé vert, le jasmin ainsi que sur les agrumes (citron vert, pamplemousse, mandarine). Les arômes de caramel et de cassonade sont aussi très présents, peut être même un peu trop pour une IPA ce qui a tendance à l’alourdir. En bouche, bonne carbonatation, alcool digne de ses 6.2%, beaucoup de sucres comme les senteurs le laissaient présager, texture souple un peu collante et pour finir une bonne amertume assez vive sur le démarrage mais qui sait s'étaler sur la longueur. Côté arômes, on est sur sa faim pour ne pas dire sur sa soif. C'est assez neutre sur le malt, et hélas, on ne ressent pas vraiment les notes d'agrumes au palet ni le grand frisson sur la langue. L'arrière bouche est maigre, et dans la longueur ne persiste que des notes sucrées/maltées qui finissent par nous lasser. Il en résulte l'impression de boire un jus de malt pétillant et houblonné grossièrement. Une bière très moyenne, buvable cependant mais sans aucune accroche notable.
Passible, though not particularly notable IPA.  Sweeter malt base. Piney floral hops that fairly mild. Decent balance, ok in a pinch.

0,35l bottle. Pours clear golden/copper with off-white head. Aroma of citrus, citrus peel, piney, tropical fruits, more peel than anything else in the aroma. Taste is tropical fruit(mostly mango), orange/tangerine, fruity. Light body, decent carbonation.

Clear golden pour with a fine thick off white head. Nice lacing. Unusual low hop intensity in the aroma. More caramel malty. Decent sweetness and an ok bitterness. Fine carbonation level. Caramel malty, mild resinous and a bit grapefruit hoppy. Decent beer, but I hope for some more hops in the profile.
[Bottle from Systembolaget in Sweden]

Pours amber with fine carbonation and a thick white head. Aroma of malt and hops. Taste is smooth with a sharp hop bite that gradually fades to malt. Palate contains lemongrass, citrus and pine. Excellent IPA.

Aroma is medium to heavy hoppy and light malty. It smells like grapefruit, pepper, hay, quite resinous, with a subtle note of mango or passion fruit. Clear golden to amber color with a medium sized, frothy, white head. Flavor is medium sweet, medium bitter. It tastes like grain, tropical fruit, herbs or green tea, less resinous. Body is medium, mouthfeel is thin to oily. Finish is short and medium bitter. Nice, but not really my taste. 0,33l bottle from Ammersin Vienna.

Draught at Lundy Foot's Bar, Dublin, Ireland. Poured a crystal clear amber with 5mm of white open foam that retained very well and laced well. Carbonation low, average and fine to medium. Aroma strongly of citrusy hops and pine. Taste of grapefruit and resinous pine with a nice strong hoppy bitterness; tasty, fruity, juicy. Light to medium body. Slightly dry with a resinous mouthfeel and a lingering bitterness.
Draught. Cooked veggies, corn. Onion in mouth. Harsh bitterness but in a way I pretty like.  Not bad airport timekiller.
Fles 35,5cl bij Hardrock café in Dubai.  Hopbitters, citrus, licht droog, pineapple, tropische fruit, malten komen er achteraan. (6-12-2018).
Heineken, so not sure you can call it draft. That said, its a nice drink. Darker that i like my IPAs.
Light amber colour. Clear. Aroma is a little bit fruity, I reckon. Taste is fairly sweet with a medium level of bitterness. Meh.

Bottle shared with JFE at Vaaland Bryghuus 01.12.18. Translucent golden. Persistent white head and lacing. Excellent aroma and taste of dried tropical fruits, mango, citrus and Sevilla marmalade. Medium high bitterness. Full mouthfeel.
Aromatic, mango and banana. Fruity and appealing, well balanced, fine malt balance
20oz at the Gordon Ramsay's, Las Vegas. Aroma is light mango, light banana. Appearance is cristal golden with a fine white head. Dry. Full body. Great.

Lukt: sevje, humle, sorachi ace fra brooklyn (gjær?). Malt: karamell. 
Smak: humlete: gress, litt sevja, sitrus, appelsin?, skog, furu. Medium malt: caramell, litt havrete, 
Veldig fin og balansert. Kan sies å være lik en sierra nevada, bare med mindre malt og mindre skog. Denne er litt mer forsiktig. 
En veldig god og «avslappa» IPA: prøver ikke å få deg starstruck. Den er bare en god øl. 
Lett å drikke, lett å elske.
7,2/10
181126
Very bitter and rather dry, citrus flavours are enjoyable but all in all not a drink you can enjoy after the first bottle.

Pours clear golden with white head. Well carbonated, good head retention. Citrus and melon hop aroma along with a bready and slight caramel malt aroma. Quite a bit of hop bitterness in the flavour. Fairly light mouthfeel, fades quickly in the finish. I’d like a little more body and a fuller finish, but nonetheless a good and solid IPA.

Color ámbar, con una ligera neblina. Dos dedos de espuma con buena retención. Aroma y gusto en la misma línea, hierba, pino, pomelo y malta caramelo. Cuerpo acuoso. En buenas condiciones es una gran cerveza, pero dada su alta exportación te puedes encontrar con botellas i barriles con el lúpulo degradado.

Flaska 355 ml från Systembolaget. Guldgul och rejält med skum, lägger sig som en tjock hinna på ytan och på insidan av glaset. Doft av humle och frukt med inslag av smörkola. Rejäl beska, smak av frukt, tallbarr. Frisk smak med inslag av citrus.

Profumata, discreta, gradevole. Colore d'oro carico, schiuma abbondante e persistente. Naso non invadente di agrumi ed erbe fresche, al palato amaro di luppolo ben legato con gli aromi fruttati. Amaro persistente e non eccessivo. Carbonazione bel calibrata.

One of the best beers I've had! Clear light amber with not too fine medium head. Strong fruity hops aroma in the nose, dominated by red berries and citrus, but not exaggerated fruity hops aroma i the mouth, actually almost as much flowery. Luckily not too sweet, very nice and strong body. Just a good combination of components all around.

Bottle. Best before 01 2019. Clear deep golden. Tall rocky head. Perfect retention. Aroma: honey, grains, resiny hops. Medium body. Taste: on the hop side, medium bitter with light sweet background. Clean. Long bitter hoppy finish. Good

Õlle on selline jook, et iga uus kord kui klaasi või pudeli suule tõstad, siis leiad midagi uut, sõltuvalt tuhandest-miljonist pisiasjast, mis hetke olukorda mõjutavad. Seega piirdun iga õlle juures selle tekstiga.
Thin head, fruity, subtle burnt tangerine flavour, long bitter finish. Nice.

Buona birra, colore ambrato chiaro con una schiuma biancastra, piacevoli odori di agrumi. Al palato fa trapelare la sua alcolicità che persiste un bel po’ dopo la bevuta. Abbastanza rotonda, dolciastra e senza particolari sfumature. Una buona birra.

355 ml bottle, served in a snifter. Poured clear golden amber with one finger white head. Aroma: grassy hops, flowers, pine, caramel, grapefruit, orange peel, lemon peel, sweet malts. Taste: citrus, grass, pine, caramel, bitter hops, lemon, orange, grapefruit, pineapple, vanilla, flowers, lemon merengue, sweet malts, bread with raspberry jam, figs. Light to medium body with hoppy bittersweet finish. Nice...
@ Bjällerödsvägen 21/10-18. Bottle from Systembolaget. Fruity and hoppy with citrus and grapefruit. Body is medium, the finish is dry and fruity.

Donkerblond/oranjekleurig met romige off-white schuimkraag die redelijk snel inzakt. Mandarijn, appelsien, caramel, lichte hars. Mooi vol, licht romig in de mond met een mild bittere afdronk. Prima ipa.

A: Light amber with a medium white head
N: Orange and lemon zest
T: Nice and bitter. Orange pith, orange zest, nice juiciness. 
P: Medium-thin
O: Absolutely brilliant and clean

0.33l. Pours in cold orange colour with short living white head. Aromas of citrus, grapefruit. Lightly sweet, higly bitter no sourness, grapefruity bitter aftertaste. Medium body, thick feel, average carbonization.
Fruitige en bloemige IPA met tonen van hop en van bitterheid. Bier heeft een mooie hoeveelheid koolzuur en een droge nasmaak. -backlog de BierApp-

Tap @ Cafe Kobalt, Amsterdam X 2018. Goeie standaard IPA met een frisse doorzichtige gele kleur alsof het een lager betreft. Fruitig smaakvol, niet te bitter, niet te zoet en goed doordrinkbaar. Maar wat een vreselijk lomp glas wordt het in geserveerd. Het lijkt op een jampot. Ik snap niet waarom de brouwer hiervoor gekozen heeft. Dit glas komt de frisse fruitige smaak ook zeker niet te goede. Dat is jammer, dit doe ik eigenlijk nooit maar heb gevraagd of het volgende biertje in een glas van de concurrent kon worden ingeschonken. Om toch optimaal van deze IPA te kunnen genieten. Origineel glas eerst een jam potje en nu een vaasje allebij geen succes.
Flesje gedeeld door Inoven. Het is een goudgeel licht troebel bier met een matig wit schuim. Het heeft een aroma van banaan en hop. De smaak is hoppig, fruitig en wat hooiachtig.
Flesje gedeeld met Tomhendriksen. Goudgeel licht troebel bier met matig schuim dat snel weg trekt. Aroma van banaan en sinaasappel. Smaak is hoppig, fruitig en hooiachtig. Nasmaak is bitter.

La lagunitas se défend bien. Son amertume attaque directement avec des saveurs boisées et épicées et un retour de cannelle. Ensuite on surfe sur les traditionnels agrumes, mais c’est plutôt léger et court. La longueur est la rondeur caramélisée sont présentes et agréables. Pour autant, ça demeure un tout petit peu déséquilibré. Mes les saveurs boisées sont excellentes. Une fausse craft, mais bonne ipa quand même
IPA très légère mais pas désagréable, très désaltérante. Un goût de houblon américain, léger, sans profondeur.

Aroma; pale malt, flower, herb, sweet apricot, fruit. Look; lowhead, clear golden body. Taste; hops, pale malt, resiny caramel, fine weed, grapefruit peel, wood, and finishes straight n hoppy. Feel; normal body and gentle co2. Overall; straight crystal ipa. [35.5cl.btl b@Systembolaget, T@H7] 6374'14

Bottle. Crystal clear golden with frothy white head. The aroma has notes of citrus (orange, lemon), some tropical fruits, herbs and some maltiness. The flavor is very bitter and mild sweet with notes of citrus (orange, lemon), citrus peels, piney, tropical fruits, malt, "green" and grassy. Slightly dry, medium-bodied.

Dark yellow and good head with very Nice lacing on the glass. Taste is a little watery. But nicely hopped. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Flasche am Flughafen in Dallas. Gold-gelb, kein Scahum, moderate Kohelnsäure. Sanftes Aroma nach Aprikose, Mango, Mandarine. Geschmack: Würzig, Heu, Frucht (Zitrus, Orange, Grapefruit) Saftartiger Antrunk.

Lekki aromat cytrusów, trochę słodu. W smaku lekka słodycz, przyjemna cytrusowa owocowość, może trochę mango, fajnie przebija posmak herbatnika. Goryczka wyważona, aczkolwiek wyraźna. Nie jest landrynkowe. Jak dla mnie piwo ma to czego można oczekiwać od codziennej AIPY. Mi smakowało.

Nice citrus nose. Fairly hoppy. Bit of a bite going down. Nice after taste. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

F: huge, egg-white good retention.
C: gold, clear.
A: malty, bit citrus, caramel fruity, roasted onion, pine resin, paprika, grapefruits, hint of tropical fruits.
T: malty backbone, grapefruits, orange, mango, bit peppery, bit pine, red currants, medium body and carbonation, yes lack some fresh fruity feeling but represents beginning for this American IPA beer style many years ago, enjoyed, 355ml bottle from Carrefour Market in Vertus, France.

Bottled from AH in Mestreech. Color is hazy orange with a think quickly diminishing white head. Hoppy nose. Aroma is dry American hops, fruity and some malts. Flavour dry bitter Finishes with a soap tone and dry hoppy with a subdued bitterness.
Decent IPA beer with the nice fruity flavors some pine lingering in the background and a bold bitter finish. Not bad seems like and average IPA. Nice long good aftertaste.

Zapach średnio intensywny, słód, cytrusy, zioła, żywica. Kolor ciemnozłoty, klarowne. Piana obfita, drobna, średnio trwała, lekki lacing. W smaku lekka słodycz, średnia pełnia, słód, cytrusy, zioła, żywica. Goryczka wysoka, wysycenie średnie.

Good IPA. A bit sharp though. Green apple-ish taste with a malty slightly metallic after taste. Very sparkling which I prefer, reminds me of soda water. Not too complex but all together a good IPA experience.
355 ml bottle. It is poured light amber color with a small white foam. Malty grapefruit aroma with a hops. Taste moderate sweet malt, over medium bitter hoppy, notes of grapefruit.

Light ambar colour with a nice white compact head.
Aroma is light malt and pine hoops
Taste is very nice. Well balanced caramel, citric and peach/appricot with a medium hoppy bitterness.
Not a extreme IPA, but really good.

Une robe blonde doré suprlombé d'une fine mousse qui se diffuse rapidement. 
Au nez le houblon se fait sentir 
Bonne carbonation. 
La première bouche présente un groupe fruité et amer pour ensuite ne laisser place qu'à lamer.
Mooi helder, zoet moutig, bloemig, licht tropisch, citrus , iets grapefruit, redelijk harsige bitter.... mooi doordrinkbare IPA

Robe ambré clair, limpide, belle carbonatation, mousse correcte aux nuances rousses. Nez de houblons aromatiques, aux agrumes et fruits exotiques, assez léger. En bouche, grosse amertume en attaque, arômes de fruits exotiques, pas mal de corps, avec du caramel, qui équilibre bien l'amertume. Agréable et bien fait, l'amertume tend à s'atténuer en fin de bouche.
Quite biscuity and malty, a solid old school IPA with medium bitterness. Needs a bit more fruit punch for my taste but a good big brand option if it's there.

Aroma of fruits, pine, malt and some tropical notes as well. Deep Golden with a white head. Medium sweet and medium + bitter. Medium body with average carbonation. Dry and bitter finish. Overall an OK IPA.

19/VII/18 - 355ml bottle from Albert Heijn (Ghelamco, Gent), purchased on 8/VI/18, shared @ home - BB: 29/III/19 (so I thought this was less than 3 months old, clearly they put more than 12 months as a best-by date... Probably 18 months or so? Ridiculous! (2018-849) 


Clear orange beer, lots of CO2 chains working their way up in the glass, big creamy solid little irregular yellowish head, pretty stable, bit adhesive. Aroma: very malty, grains, bit of caramel, bit dusty. Where's my hops??? MF: soft carbon, medium body. Taste: very malty, grains, metallic bitterness, very unpleasant, man this is bad, how the hell is this an ipa? (Discovered afterwards it's probably 9 months old...) Aftertaste: alcohol burn, more malts and metallic in the finish, this just taste like a very bitter lager instead of an ipa. Well, if Lagunitas thinks this beer is still good to drink for another 9 months, this is the review they deserve.

Pours somewhat hazy amber colour, topped with medium small white head, not so lasting. Quite resiny nose with some sweet fruity notes, peachy. Moderate bitterness, resiny with lots of gentle fruity character going on. A bit peppery in the finish. Lasting and quite strong aftertaste. Medium body. Good IPA, but nothing spectacular.

Bottle. from Walmart, Florida. Very subtle aroma of light citrus and soft, dew-cooled pine. Clean, refreshing citrus hop flavor that fades quickly and a decent bitterness that finishes clean. This is an overall easily drinkable, slightly hoppy, balanced beer. This is one of the first IPAs I ever had, years ago, at a place in Orlando called Cafe Tu-Tu-Tangos. I loved it, thought I like IPAs because of it, then spent years being confused by a string of poorly cranked out FL IPAs trying to out-bitter the West Coast craft guys. Better breweries of late have made me an IPA fan for sure. Tasting this again now I see why I liked it initially. This is in the ballpark of Sierra Nevada Pale Ale, but even more approachable. Not remarkable at first, but so drinkable, and if you have a few, they get better and better.

Flaska på Westpub. Kan inte förstå hur jag inte rate:ad denna tidigare. Guldfärgad med beigevit krona. Mer klassisk västkust:ig IPA med toner av kåda, granskott, citrus, grape och apelsinmarmelad som vägs upp av lite kola och knäckiga toner från malten. Trevlig.

Ipa de 6,2 % abv.
Mon exemplaire était à 5 mois avant sa date.
Couleur doré moyen, à la clarté pure, brillante.
Bulles fines, partout, vives.
Mousse blanche, à fins flocons, stable à 2 mm.
Arômes d'ananas, mandarine, orange.
1ère bouche à l'entame malt/houblon, avec une pointe d'épices.
Arrière-bouche relativement simple, astringente.
2ème qui diminue fortement.
Arrière-bouche à l'amertume verte.
3ème qui devient insignifiante.
Arrière-bouche très mal accordée.
La longueur n'arrange rien.
Jambes très collantes.
Levure faible.
Alcool totalement inefficace.
Finale banale.
CONCLUSION : pas de quoi hanter les mémoires … Sur l'étiquette
le brasseur nous dit " la bière parle, les hommes marmonnent ".
Et ici, précisément sa bière marmonne … Petit couac .. (3/2/2/1/4)
Robe cuivrée, fine mousse blanche. Classique, résine, fruits exotiques, herbacée. Pas mal !
Balanserad arom med karamellmalt, tropik och ananas. Smakmässigt något tunn med dominerande tropiska toner. En  lätt efterhängsen bäska.

From the bottle, this pours a flawless appearance of deep copper orange with a foamy long-lasting head, classic IPA. A little more rustic tarnish to it than others perhaps, all the more appetizing. Aroma is strong on citrus hops, strikingly…
Bottle 35,5cl. Clear golden with a white head. Mixed aroma of malt and hops, not very present. Neutral bitter taste, not lots of flavour, but straight bitter. Medium length.

[Rate 04-08-2018: 6-4-6-4-13 = 3.3]
Drank it now two times from draught in Amsterdams pubs, but with different result. First time having a nice hoppy flavour (and even a late 'burp' delivering me that nice sense... ;-). But second time I didn't really smell very much hoppiness, and didn't taste so much more than a vague bitterness. Nice golden pour with white head; and OK carbo. I average these various experiences in my rate; hope to taste it a third time (or from bottle).
[Re-rate 24-09-2018: 6-4-7-4-13 = 3.4]
Bottle at home pours clear golden with a near-white head, falling down but lasting. Aroma is hoppy but not strong; bit earthy and fruity. Taste moderate bitter with more firm bitter aftertaste. It's a nice IPA.

8/2/18
Had on National IPA day after a shopping excursion over the river to Jersey.

Poured from bottle into a Lagunitas shaker pint. Transparent amber with a moderate head. 

Nose is sticky resinous pine and citrus pith.

Taste is citrus pith and pine with a touch of bready malt to balance. Dry and bitter initially but gives way to a nice malt sweetness. Grapefruit pith comes through big on the finish. No shortage of hops, but nicely balanced.

Palate is a soft, medium-light. Not a ton of carbonation and quite drinkable with malt sweetness and grapefruit bitterness lingering.

Overall, an excellent IPA that's balanced and super drinkable. Strongly hopped and bitter, but a good malty balance. No earth-shattering flavors, but more or less flawless. Another winner from Lagunitas!
Gylden og helt klar. Hvitt lyst skum. Aroma av malt. Smaken er av mild granbar og noe sitrus, samt malt. Tynn konsistens.
Moderat hopfiger, bitter-würziger Beginn. Spritzig, trockene Herbe, grasig. Moderat hopfig bleibend, vollmundig, Heu. Mittellanger Nachhall. Okay. 10/9/9/9//9

Barwa zlota, klarowna. Piana sredniopecherzykowa, szybko redukuje sie do pierscienia. Aromat mocny, tropikalny, slodko- przyprawowy. Smak owocowo- przyprawowo- zywiczny. Spora goryczka, troszke zalega, ale jest przyjemnie.
IPA molto amara, non agrumata, con un gusto deciso e rinfrescante.   Da gustare con calma

Not too impressive aroma, with weak hints of resin and wood. Medium bitter and medium sweet taste, with hints of alcoholic spiciness and a slightly dry mouthfeel. Body is on the lighter side for an IPA of this caliber.

Bottle 0.355L.
Clear orange body with a large, frothy, off-white head, mostly lasting with some lacing; very low density of medium-sized bubbles.
Moderate-to-heavy hoppy (citrus, grass, pine) and light malty (some caramel) aroma.
Moderate-to-heavy bitter and moderate sweet flavour; long bitter finish.
Medium body with oily texture; soft carbonation.
Achetée à Carrefour. Nez assez malté et un peu houblonné mais rien de fou. Bouche sèche amère un peu résineuse plutôt sympa. Pas si mal que ça !

"Heineken annonce aujourd'hui qu'il a acquis toutes les actions restantes de Lagunitas Brewing Company", en juillet 2017. Trouvé chez Leclerc à 1,69 €. Bouteille de 33 cl 8 mois de la LDC. Couleur orange clair, carbonatation moyenne, et petit col. Reste dans les grandes lignes, des IPA, légèrement fruité, légèrement amère, mais manque un peu de fraicheur. Rien d'exceptionnel rien de mauvais.

Cette IPA est honorable lorsque l'on sait que c'est un produit industriel. Mais je n'irai pas plus loin, elle manque en effet de présence en bouche et de longueur pour être une "bonne" IPA". Nous restons dans le moyen de bonne facture donc. Robe blond doré fort sympathique en verre avec une mousse blanc cassée de 3 mm. Le nez est appréciable sur les fruits exotiques, les agrumes et la pêche. A la dégustation, le résineux apparaît pour être bien présent. L'attaque est donc sur le résineux et l'amertume mais manque de consistance. La deuxième bouche se densifie cependant pour présenter des arômes de fruits exotiques et d'agrumes en complément. L'arrière bouche est quant à elle sur une amertume herbacée et saillante. La troisième bouche, la plus amère (IBU de 51,5) se repositionne sur le résineux et précède un final décevant où l'amertume retombe. L'alcool à 6,2 % est honnête par contre.
Plenty of floral aromas but bit of a bland taste. I'd expect a bit more punch from an IPA. Also they seem to have recently reduced the keg ABV from 6.2% to 5.5%.

Some people don't seem to like this anymore following Heineken buying a large stake in the company. Has the beer changed since they bought it? I can't tell any difference. Whilst i don't agree with 'Big Beer' swallowing up craft brewers, it doesn"t make this a bad beer overnight. Still perfectly good ipa. Pours clear amber with small white head. Mild classic ipa aroma, hoppy and bitter as you'd expect from the style. Is it the best ipa I've had, no, but just because it's now owned by a huge multinational doesn't make it suddenly worth disowning as some people suggest. If the quality drops then I'll change my mind, but for now it's still worth a look.

35,5 cl. bottle @ home, bought @ Albert Heijn Leersum.
Clear dark golden with a white head. Malty citrus aroma with a considerable lack of hops. Bitter taste. High carbonation. Very basic but not unpleasant IPA.
Clear light beer with light beige head.  Aroma is hops,  grape fruit,  malt, fruits.  Sweet,  medium bitterness.  Good fruity IPA.

Barwa złota, piana biała.
Aromat średnio intensywny, tytoń, żywica, cytrusy.
Czyste w smaku, wysoka i zalegająca tytoniowa goryczka.
On tap at Thema. Clear amber colour, small white head, aroma of hops, citruses, taste as well. It's very good, but bit boring.

Golden colored with high white head
Aroma of honey, malt and grass.
Taste: citrus, grass, honey and malt. Well balanced and drinkable.
Bottle from supermarket in France. Golden color, white head. Pretty basic ipa, a bit loke a very hoppy lager... Not for me
Flaske fra Vinmonopolet Tromsø - Langnes. Gylden. Høyt tett skum. Daler veldig sakte. Pen lacing. God, fyldig fruktaroma. Myk munnfølelse. Smaken balansert. Mørke plommer. Syrlig fruktig ettersmak.
Bottle. Color: Clear orange golden, white head. Aroma: Hop, grapefruit. Taste: Moderate sweet malt, over medium bitter hoppy, notes of grapefruit. Same finish. Medium body, average carbonation. Ok.
Rivers Pub Rouen. Une IPA qui ne révolutionne pas le genre mais qui se boit transquillement. Désaltérante.

33 cl. bottle. Deep gold/clear amber with a cream head. Strong floral hoppy aroma aroma with orange and citrus. Taste is medium bitter with some sweetness. Medium bodied and oily textured with a quite bitter finish. Carbonation is average. Finish is a bit too bitter for my taste. But it is still a solid beer.
Guldig klar vätska med vitt skum. Doft av majs, hö och lite fruktiga toner. Söt len fyllig smak med balanserad beska. God!

Gyllengul färg. Bra skumbildning och stabilitet. Tydlig citruskarraktär. Hög beska utan att bli för hög. Frisk och klar citruston i smak. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
