Flasa Nobell craft beer.Pena samponova nedrzala dlho.Farba zlatista cira.Vona kvetiny,slabsie citrus,cukrik.Chut svieza citrus,cukrik intenzivnejsie,sladovost,chmel.Telo stredne.Dochut pekna chmelova.
une Ipa legere qui envoie son amertume maitrise en toute fin... a boire tres fraiche quand il fait chaud #fifa2018

Klar gyllengul öl med vitt skum. Doft av citrus, tallbarr, och lätt maltighet.
Det samma återkommer i smaken.
Pours golden with small head. Aroma is citrus and grapefruit.Taste starts with a little sweet,little bit sour.Aftertaste is orange and grapefruit.Bitterness finish.Light body.

First tasted this beer with my son at a bar in New York. Absolutely delicious considering I expected all the beers over there to taste like Bud. What a surprise! Very yummy beer with a strong citrus flavor, perfect as a thirst quencher. Pity the bottles are so small but then it is quite strong. Delighted to have it available in UK. Well done Heineken for spotting a winner!

Une belle couleur ambrée, mousse disparaissant très vite, notes d'agrumes au nez, une amertume en bouche assez longue sans trop saturer le palais.
Une fraîcheur agréable qui persiste assez longtemps. Une bonne découverte pour Carrefour Saint-Priest.

Light orange with golden hints, perfectly transparent. A quite big and frothy white head shows good retention and nice lacing. Aroma has a light crackery and maybe biscuity base, citric notes (more on the fleshy/jammy side of things though) with grapefruit most noticeable, moderately intense piney and grassy notes. Taste reflects aroma notes, with medium sweet and medium bitterness and a balanced finish that shows a bit more of grass/pine. Possibly rather sweet for the style, expecially in the finish which is less dry than usual. Light to medium bodied with average carbonation, goes down quite easy. Overall an enjoyable 'simplified' ipa, surely flawless. Surely as well not impressive.

Pours clear apricot with a medium beige head, good retention. Aromas of pine resin, grapefruit, caramel, and dough. Medium body, good carbonation, medium dry. Lightly sweet, medium bitter finishes with a lingering resinous finish. A no-nonsense, big, bitter, West coast IPA.

0,355l bottle, courtesy of the distributor, Pours almost clear golden liquid, small white soapy head, Aroma: fade, slightly citrus, orange, Taste: light to medium sweet, light to medium bitter, light sour, citrus, lemon peel, malty, Palate: medium body, soft carbonation, thick mouthfeel, abrupt citrus malty aftertaste, Overall: not bad, but did not really enjoyed. Boring. Not enough bitter, not enough carbonated, not enough flavorful.

Draft. Clear orange golden with a creamy head. Aroma of grapefruit, orange and apples. Sweet, citrusy, lemon peel, light maltiness, mild bitterness. Light bodied , soft carbonation, easy drinking. Nice.

Ambrato chiaro, limpida, schiuma candida persistente. Aroma agrumato molto gradevole con note resinose. Il gusto conferma gli aromi, con un caramello leggero che bilancia l'amaro spiccato ma non invadente. Carbonazione media che supporta il corpo medio e l'amaro robusto.
Molto gradevole.
Couleur cuivrée; mousse blanche; arômes et goût maltés et fruités; bière très légèrement douce avec finale bien amère

12 oz draft at Beer Bar. Pours clear gold with a bright white head. Citrus and grass aromas with malt underneath. Heavy lacing. Nicely balanced flavors of grapefruit and pine. Malts prevent too much hoppiness and the lingering tart  finish is nice.
(nez > mangue, > pin, ~berga, kumquat, bouche hop, ~poivrée, pin, ~légère, facile, ~savoureuse, 43 hops, 65 malts =))
Bottle flew straight form Seatle to Warsaw (Poland). Aromat little oxidized, caramel, toffee, little citrus. Taste little bitterness, medium sweetnes.

Acheter à Carrefour Wasquehal.
Bouteille de 35,5cl.
Couleur blonde reflet ambre , belle couleur et beaux reflets.
Mousse qui forme un léger col qui ne tient pas.
Au nez : de beau notes agrumes , fruité et céréales.
En bouche : une amertume présente franche mais peut intense .
Légèrement herbacé et foin .
Agréable et longue.
Une IPA bien fait .
Uma IPA tradicional com amargor bem balanceado e paladar bem agradável. Aroma bem intenso e cor âmbar e espuma branca.

Bouteille 33 cl achetée chez Carrefour market à Lille Fives. Robe dorée. 

Cette bière est d'apparence assez plate, bulles peu visibles et mousse non persistante.
Goût très agréable typique des IPA, équilibrée avec des saveurs houblonnées et une belle amertume, sans être trop présente. Mérite d'être servie bien fraîche. 

Une bière fraîche que j'apprécie particulièrement en terrasse avant un barbecue !

Bouteille de 35,5cl. Couleur dorée limpide, mousse moyenne de tenue moyenne. Des arômes principalement sur l' agrume, c 'est également très végétal avec une grande longueur. Une IPA légère pas trop forte mais goûtue et plutôt pas mal équilibrée. Trouvée à Intermarché.
Bärnstensfärgad klar med vit. Doftar och smakar citrus och lite maltigt. Ok öl som inte sticker ut
Found in bottle in Chicago area. The color is appealing as is the aroma. The taste leaves me underwhelmed though. Very much middle-of-the-road standard for the style.

On tap at The Camden Eye, London. Pours a copper gold with a white head. Aroma: bisuity malt, mild citrus, bread notes. Not aromatic. Taste: biscuity malt, grain, mild citrus, cardboard, straw flavours. Thin to medium bodied. High carbonation. A bit overcarbonated. Moderate bitterness. This is easy to drink but there is not much to it. A very basic flavour balance. Decent but not good.

Just a great beer. Drank numerous times when I was in San Francisco. The sort of beer I love and couldn't find that many places in S.F.  or never in California let alone New Zealand. cereal, grass, resin, basement aromas, leather, smoke,

Na salone piva v starej trznici.
Farba: zlatista
Vona: citrusova
Chut: taktiez citrus horka dochut

On tap at Salon Piva apríl 2018
Quite grassy. But still hop centric. Wonder how it was before Heineken

Tap at Salon piva 4/ 2018. Hopy taste, resin, caramel notes, citrus fruit. Clear golden color, white head. Hopy taste, malty notes, citrus fruit, resin, light sweet, medium bitter. Medium body, slick texture, soft to average carbonation and hopy bitter finish. Very good.

Van 't vat. Mooi helder oranjekleurig bier met een witte schuimkraag. Geur: hoppig, fruit, citrus, agrum, wat exotisch fruit en pompelmoes. Smaak: Hopbitter, fruitig, citrus, agrum, harsachtig, mooi in balans met moutzoet. Medium volmondig. Goede koolzuurprikkel. Afdronk: droog hopbitter, agrum, wat moutzoet.

Van 't vat in Gainsbar te Kortrijk. U: Helder goudblond-oranje met een witte schuimkraag. G: Tropische fruitbom gecombineerd met citrus. S: Moutzoet met een stevige citrusbitterheid. Tussenin wat harsige en gisttoetsen. M: Doordrinker met medium carbonatie.
Clear yellow/ochre liquid, small head. Strong aroma of hops, with a hint of fruit and yeast. Light body, average carbonation. Taste is bitter, with a hint of fruits.

Bottle at Beehive, Gatwick South Terminal. It pours hazy dark amber with a thick, off-white head. Aroma is a lot of orange (peel, flesh, juice; all in); some iron filings and fragrant daisies. Nice. Taste is dry, with soft carb and quite intense bitterness (but not shocking, mind you). Long lasting, refreshing and nice.
Really smooth robust hoppy IPA without the need to be totally tropical. Medium bodied with a nice bitter finish. Very nice!

Bottiglia 355 ml, schiuma fine bianco sporco persistente, al naso frutta tropicale agrumi, in bocca malto spezie frutta tropicale uva, corpo leggero, carbonazione moderata, lieve acidula, dolce con deciso amaro lungo nel finale. Classica IPA da battaglia. 07.04.18 @ Caffè Clerici Luino

Tap at Belushis, Hammersmith. Hoppy aromas of tropical fruit, possibly subtle biscuit. Cler gold-amber body with white head. Taste is very good with tropical fruit and some maltiness. Great IPA overall.

Bottle at Gothenburg AirPort, bbd 12/1/2019 so should be about 90 days Old. Not the freshest but still not bad for Europe. Citrus, pine, grass, apricot, and a foul smell/taste of old stuff. Meh this is awful and infected.
Great easy drinking IPA. Golden pour. Light flowers, citrus aroma. A little sweet and not super hoppy. Goes down smooth

Pint on tap at the Quadrant, Brighton. Golden amber beer with solid white head. No carbonation but laces well. Nose is earthy, dry, tropical. Slight fizz followed by fruit caramels. Great beer, a pleasure.
Draught@pub in Champagny. Clear golden with a medium white head. Aroma tropical fruits, some hops. Taste mainly sweet, hoppy finish.
Bottle 355ml. Pours gold with a light white head. Aroma is pine and flowers. Medium carbonation and medium body. Taste is pine and citrus ending with a weird dry bitter taste.

Rødgylden klat skum hvid 
citrus grapemalt blomstkorn 
Bitter meget sød modrate 
Oile livlig 
@fox

Very drinkable, not very hoppy, medium carbonation, nothing to savour,  night out beer
I'm not surprised why this IPA is the most selling IPA in the world. It's just an amazing beer, that's all i can say.

DWG; Bottle 355ml. Pours moderate, hazy gold with a moderate, frothy, lasting and lacing off-white head. Nose is moderate, honey, citrus, peach and light spice. Taste is moderate sweet and bitter with a somewhat lasting tropic finish. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.
Cerveza ahumada de fuerte olor. Carbonatación media. Buena presentación y final amargo.
Where’s the hops? Only IPA on the menu. Won’t have this a second time. Craft beer - NOT
Tasty McGee is what they're calling it. Excellent hoppy build with a tasteful aroma.
Un buon sapore amaro mentre la si beve, non troppo agrumata, ma lascia in bocca un ottimo sapore amarognolo che asciuga la bocca
Classical IPA. Fruity notes and a bit of leather coming straight after first sniff followed by even more fruits and a bit of spices. Taste is just as complex.

355ml bottle from UK supermarket. Pours clear, warm-gold, like california sunshine! 1 finger white foam. Minimal lacing. Dominant aroma is honey with apples and hint of spice. Medium bitter taste with long-lasting bitter hoppy finish. A benchmark West Coast IPA, but not a hop bomb IMO. Not too challenging and certainly not a chore. Just very pleasant, drinkable brew
Pours yellow with white head. Aromas of pine and green hops. Tastes like it smells. Green, vegetal and hoppy. Nice.
Bottle. Golden/Amber colour, finger width of head. Strong hoppy/juniper aroma. Bitter/sweet taste.

Sensacional! Na minha opinião uma da melhores cervejas que já bebi! 
O Aroma do lúpulo utilizado é maravilhoso!!
Que cerveja!!!
Bottle. Clear yellow with white head. Aroma is flowery hops and strong hay. Very pleasant smell.  Balanced carbonation. Bitter-sour but pleasant finish.
Clear amber with a medium white head. Aroma is flowers, orange and pineapple. Taste is resin, lime and mango

Pretty good beer. Nice flavor. IPA taste was easy to drink. Not too filling. Good beer to drink with a good steak. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Barwa jasnozłota, klarowna, piana grubopęcherzykowa, nietrwała. Aromat przyjemny, acz niezbyt intensywny, będący połączeniem cytrusów i słodowości. W smaku słodko, goryczka średnia i bardzo krótka, więc piwo raczej po słodkiej niż wytrawnej stronie. Przyjemne piwo, choć nic szczególnego.
Grapefruit aroma. Clear yellow/amber body with thick white head. Nice palate. Flavour is a soft IPA, nice, not too much pine.
La probé por primera vez hace un par de años en botella en USA, hoy la he probado de nuevo de barril en Barcelona. Buen aroma y buen final. Una muy buena IPA

My absolute favorite IPA! Great taste, good finish. I also enjoy Lagunitas DayTime - a marvelous brew!
Keep it coming, guys!
Lighter IPA with a bitter finish, and very easy going down. Medium head, and not many notes picked up. Still very good.
Czterdzieści trzy chmiele? Sześćdziesiąt pięć słodów? Tę proporcje czuć niestety w smaku. Sucho-słodowa ciekawostka. Kraft Heinekena? To ja dziękuję, nie wspieram
Clean medium-dark gold. Sparse head. Aroma intensity 3.25/5. Egg, honey and acacia aroma. Medium to heavy bitter. Sweet back-of-the-mouth feel. Medium body

Probada en botella en El Lúpulo Feroz de Oviedo 10/2/2018. La última vez que la probé estaba bastante rica, sin destacar por encima de otras IPAs americanas. Pero esta vez ha sido una decepción: apenas aroma, sabor rozando la oxidación. Amargor en una cerveza con poco cuerpo. Es posible que la cerveza tenga ya unos meses y por eso ya no esté al 100%

Bottle. Pale color, med white head.
Aroma, salt and flowers. Taste: salt, medium bitter ending - easy beer
Yeasty aroma. Honey-colour pour, billowy pale head. Bitter bread taste, more bitter finish.
Great aroma and nice IPA, bottle structure is little weird. Beer taste great and definitely one of my favorites.

Pours a clear, deep golden amber coloration with a medium, fizzy head. Smells of caramel malt, grapefruit and orange rind, with a hint of pine. Taste is malt-forward, with pretty little hop character and a certain grainy/earthy quality. Caramel, biscuity malts most noticeable, with mild hoppy notes of grapefruit, orange rind and pine. Crisp and dry, with a medium bitterness in the aftertaste. This the archetype of what I like to refer to as an "old school IPA". Malt-forward, mildly hopped, with certain grainy/earthy notes and dry, piney bitterness. Nicely balanced, but not my cup of tea, as I really prefer stronger hopped brews.

It pours a somewhat hazy gold with a large white long lasting head. It has the aroma of tropical fruit, mango, tangerine, pine & grapefruit. It has a nice bitterness to it and tastes of pine, grapefruit, resin, citrus & flowers. This is a classic west coast IPA. I greatly enjoyed drinking this and highly recommend it.

Review based on the BJCP2015 guidelines (style 21A). Bottle 35.5 cl - Batch L2280 (BBF 30.03.2018) AROMA: medium-low hop notes with a pine and fruity character. low malt background with a toffee character. APPEARANCE: deep gold color and clear. medium ivory head, moussy, with good retention. TASTE: medium-low piny hop notes with a soft lightly toffee malt background. medium to medium-high bitterness with a dry and bitter finish. PALATE: medium-low body with medium-low carbonation. OVERALL: an american IPA where the hops are not very intense (maybe the sample isnt very fresh).
citrus, herbs, golden, orange, red, brown, clear, frothy, minimal head, white foam, light sweetness, medium bitterness, lightly sour, medium body, light body, sticky, average carbonation, bitter,

The definition of a west coast IPA, Lagunitas IPA features crisp citrus and pine hop character layered atop a light pale malt backbone. The hops are juicy and in your fade. A nice wash of carbonation brings the hop spice to a crescendo in the finish. Pours pretty light copper with a healthy white head, and ample lacing.

Don’t let the simple label fool you. This is a great little beer. Aroma is a little floral and fruity and the taste is just over the reserved line. A light pour with a clean taste that allows for several follow-ups. 
The flavour is well balanced between hops and malt and  stays consistent for about 2/3 the glass and then it’s a sweeter finish. 
Easy to enjoy!

12-ounce bottle pours clear gold with a creamy off-white head; lots of lacing. Aroma: citrus and tropical fruits, honey, pine. Flavor: grapefruit, orange, pineapple, mango, pine. Mouthfeel: medium-bodied, dry and crisp.

From January 2011. 

I bought a six pack and brought it home before I looked at the bottles...loaded with floaties. Checking on the Julian date, I see it was bottled June 10. Oh well.

It has a nice honey gold colour with a minimal head of foam and very little lacing. I'm keeping the floaties in the bottle...

Big lemon citrus notes with some biscuit notes in the smell. 

Ditto for the taste only here it doesn't show much balance and the hop flavour seems harsh to me. It's rather thin bodied, lowish with the carbonation, and isn't all that drinkable.

As is, it doesn't impress me but if I come across fresher samples, I'll give it another go and see if a change in my review is needed.

Pours clear golden yellow with two fingers thick white head.
Malty sweet and slightly citrus aroma, balanced bittersweet taste, nice mouthfeel.
Simple and effective IPA.

Bottle 355ml. Nice light amber colour. Candy smell with some herbal aroma as well and malts. Sweet taste, bitternes almost zero, medium body. Hoops, herbs, still a bit of candy taste. Overal, interesting beer.
0.33l bottle. Hazy golden color with medium white head. Aroma: candy, pineapple, caramel. Taste: candy, caramel, toffee, grapefruit. Medium body, moderate carbonation, high bitterness.
Golden color, small white head. Aromas of citrus, malt, soap, pine and slight syrup. Medium bitter taste with grass, pine, lemon peel and hops.
Nice pale looking IPA. Flowery and hoppy and quite grassy, clean pint of beer and slips down easily.
Une bière sèche, amère avec des saveurs d'agrumes, de pamplemousse et légèrement maltée. Une bonne IPA.

Léger col de mousse blanche, bière de couleur cuivre, bulles fines. Bel arôme de fruits exotiques. Le fruité est moins expressif en bouche, mais nous retrouvons ces fruits exotiques, peut être des litchis, sur une belle amertume. Une IPA US industrielle mais de belle facture pour nous européen. Je la recommande pour habituer son palais aux saveurs houblonnées sans amertume gigantesque. 355 ml chez Monoprix
light citrus/pine aromas. gold and clear in color with great head. taste is balanced with nice citrus, pine, faint resin, and light crystal malt notes

33cl bottle at Circus, Rimini, Italy. Pours transparent intense gold with irregular white foam, very fine. Aroma is citrus, with a little caramel, some mandarin when just opened. Body is average with good carbonation. Taste is bitter, with limited sweetness. Finish is average.
bottle. aroma: wet malt, caramel, fruity esters,  light hops, light solvent. medium body, medium unpleasant bitterness. nothing special

Lagunitas India Pale Ale (IPA)

Lukt: Citrus og honning.

On tap at Bryan’s American Grille.  Virtually nothing on the nose. Poured a nice golden color, not head retention though.  Taste is standard west coast IPA, keg might be a bit older. Easy drinking, good bitterness. Light beer mouthfeel isn’t great.
Flavor is very one dimensional and that flavor is bitter. Not really any fruit notes that I like in IPAs.
Tra le migliori IPA.  Luppolatura eccellente, aromi variopinti. Voto personale 8.5/10

Appearance- clear and amber, a clingy 1-finger white head. Aroma- fruity hops, lemon, orange, pineapple, tropical fruit hints. Taste- lots of bitter hops, hop resin, orange peel, clingy bitterness, juicy fruit, pithy fruit, fluffy malt in the background. Lingering bitter finish.

This is a great go to IPA. Perfectly balanced with a nice hoppy, and floral character but not over powering. It's a great beer to pair with your favorite pizza or just enjoy by itself on a nice hot day.

Tame aroma of hops, mainly citrus and grass. Taste is a bit better though, with a healthy amount of bitterness and crispness. Bitter herbs, grapefruit, pine. A bit watery, lacks potency. It's decent and pretty generic.

From the tap (6.2%), free sample from the owner, The Admiral, Glasgow on 5 Dec 2017: floral, pine aroma, golden with a large foamy cream head, grassy, fruity, sweet, gentle fizz, hides the abv very well.

Dec 17 : 4.0 Belle couleur cuivrée, pas de mousse. L'ipa est bien aromatique, amertume bien présente. Bonne ipa!
Mai 19 : 3.6 Regoutée suite à une promo chez Carrefour. Rien d'extra dans cette ipa, commune
Juillet 21 : 3.8 Résineuse, amère, sèche, ipa dans les codes, bien pour une bière de supermarché.
Pours amber colour with fruity hoppy aroma . Tastes good with medium body and good carbonation
fresh, light fruity aroma with a bit of dankiness. well balanced, ligh and refreshing, extremely drinkable!

Golden with a white head - Fruity hop aroma with some herbal notes as well - Malt body to support a good hop flavour that has some fruity notes and a herbal flavourn in the back - The herbal hops goes into the finish that goes dry - This was good
10-09-17 // draft at The Euston Tap, London. Classic IPA. Golden coloured, light hoppy nose. Sweet mlaty Backbone with a piney, citrus hop character. Medium bitter.

Questa IPA si presenta con una bella schiuma e un ottimo aroma di agrumi, pompelmo in particolare. Il gusto ricorda l'aroma con l'aggiunta dell'amaro dei luppoli, molto ben bilanciato. Carbonatura decisamente azzecata che accompagna il retrogusto amaro, molto piacevole.

It has a nice combination of citrus malt and spruce hops.  The appearance was a red/golden color that leads to a white head.  Has a sweet flavor with a light body, lively carbonation and a bitter finish.
Keg at the Royal Standard, Wandsworth. Vague hoppy aroma. Hazy amber. Frothy but blotchy white head. Light bitter. Some sourness around the edges. Light. Thin. Fizzy. Average for the style.

Appearance: dark golden color, with big foamy head
Aroma: malty, caramel, cereal.  
Taste: malty, hops, orange, caramel, and ends a bit bitter.

A hop head's dream, very hoppy, more bitter than fruity but some citrus in there too. If there one downside to this is the carbonation, so fizzy. And it's so tasty that you drink it quick. So you get tipsy quick, 6.2% so no wonder.and you're burping too. Drink it with a meal, and then move onto the session beers.

From a bottle. Pours a clear, dark yellow color, with a big, foamy, beige head. Sharp, piney and citrusy aroma, with some honey, minerals, and damp grass. Very bitter, and not much malt backbone. Light to medium body, with a sharp and slick palate. This is a pretty nice, aromatic IPA.
Draft in Ma’dam restaurant in the A’dam Tower.  Really delicious IPA: would defenity recommand this one

Apariencia : ámbar translúcido (aprox.
6 SRM); cabeza blanco hueso; buena retención; buen encaje
Aroma: piel de toronja y fruta confitada, ligeras notas de resinas, té y malta
Boca: generosa malta con notas de toronja blanca; amargor medio-alto (45 IBU aprox.) de larga duración con notas de madera en el retrogusto; cuerpo ligero-medio; buena carbonatación.

Old rating rerated 08.11.2017, 12 oz bottle @ Vertshuset, Odda:

Nice fizzy-creamy mediumlasting head. Aroma is slightly dry grassy, leafs, old lawn, hay, minerals, light malts, paper, hops, old moss, bark. Taste is slightly dry and harsh grassy, weeds, hay, old leafs, bark, minerals, paper, harsh hops, old moss, metal tank, cardboard. Medium bitterness, watery and harsh metallic mouthfeel. Boring.

On tap The Dubliners - Strasbourg. Couleur jaune dorée et bonne mousse. Nez bien houblonné gras, resineux-pin. Gout bien houblonné résineux, litchi, raisin, herbeux. Bon corps. Fin bien amere avec note amande amere.

Had a pint at the Piccadilly Tap, Manchester. Very refreshing, with a pleasing bitterness. Not as tasty as the bottled version though.
A nice beer to start the day, and could imagine having a fair few pints. Surprisingly light and watery for a brew over six percent.
Lett uklart gulbrunt med fint skum. Herlig fruktig duft med mye ananas og sitrus. Følger ikke i smaken i det hele tatt. Vannaktig og besk med lett frukt og karamell.

Very nice indeed Very nice indeed Very nice indeed Very nice indeed Very nice indeed Very nice indeed

Robe blonde dorée, limpide, légère mousse blanche qui ne tient pas. Nez houblonné : résine et agrumes. Le citron et le pamplemousse dominent largment la bouche, petite présence de la base maltée. Belle amertume persistante, corps moyen et rond. Carbo légère. IPA convenable, mais un peu quelconque, je suis un peu déçu...

Indian Pale Larger americana. Fuerte aroma a hierba, flores y frutas. Poca espuma blanca. Sabor complejo fundamentalmente amargo. Gusto a lúpulo, cítricos, hierbas, pino?. Poca malta. Retrogusto muy amargo y seco. No es mi estilo de cerveza.
Dejlig amerikask IPA med masser af bitterhed. Superfrisk øl, Kedeligt udseende,
On tap at cafe De pijp, Amsterdam. Pours golden color, white head. Aroma of citrusy hops. Taste is medium bitter, medium sweet, citrusy fruits, hoppy.
Clear gold beer with a thin white head. It has aroma of citrus and herb. Taste is citrus and pleasant bitterness with a little spice. A pretty solid IPA !
40 ans d'hadel. Ar�me fruit de la passion puissant Peu de mousse et carbo faible. Bien ronde en bouche. Fruits exotiques bien pr�sent. Une bonne ipa.
Bottle at Morrosko Sabadell. Crystal clear dark orange with white head. Complex aroma: citric, pear and sweet fruits. Long bitterness. Light and easy. Honest, tough, classic IPA.

Tasted bottled @Morrosko, Sabadell. Pours copper with white head. Aroma of fruits and citrics. Sweet and bitter.

Bottle. Clear golden with big soapy off-white head. Citrus, malt, hops. Moderate bitter. Moderate sweet. Good!

Clear golden color with white head. Aroma of tropical fruits, citrus. Sweetish taste, but long light bitter finish. Well balanced beer and enjoyable. A good ipa.
On tap at Angelo's Coal Fired Pizza. Nice copper color and citrusy nose. Not a whole lot of malt with the taste being primarily citrus . An OK beer that we probably will not revisit.

Partagée avec mon cher Appiantiqua dans nos verres "saveurs bières",belle robe orangée surmontée d'une mousse blanche peu persistante avec une carbonatation moyenne.Le nez nous offre des arômes d'agrumes avec des notes d'alcool vieilli en barriques.La bouche nous amène des saveurs à l'image du nez nous laissant sur une bonne amertume et fraîcheur très plaisante.Une IPA de caractère qui se laisserait bien boire en écoutant "Hotel California" des Eagles!!!!

Dégustée avec mon petit Kittenbieer dans un verre "Saveurs bières".
Température de début 6 à 7°.
Robe orangée surmontée d'une fine mousse blanche peu persistante; carbonatation moyenne.
Nez subtil sur des arômes de houblons et d'agrumes avec une note boisée.
Le goût est remarquablement équilibré avec une belle amertume: les houblons sont de grande qualité et on apprécie les saveurs fruitées qui ont du caractère.
Le palais est long, frais et sans aucune lourdeur.
Une très bonne IPA à boire en écoutant "Going to California" de Led Zeppelin!!
Damn fine tasty beer. Doesn't give you that head shaker first mouthful. Nice to sit and chill with. Nice kick in the later hours too.

One of the best beers, great taste and well balanced IPA with a nice clean hop finish. Found this beer in a 24pk at Costco for $25. It was there for about 5 weeks and have not seen it since. Notes of oranges and grapefruit. Dry body, slightly hoppy with bitter finish. So so.

bottle. Poured clear medium amber with a thin white head. Aroma of sulphury hops. Medium bodied, prickly carbonation, lingering astringent finish. Full of piney hop flavour, peppery and tart, malt characters pushed aside.
Bit of a mediocre beer this, was expecting a classical taste, but it misses a true signature, similar as Sierra Nevada IPA doesn't.

Bottle from duty free shop on the ferry to Newcastle. Was not cooled properly, but still very drinkable and aromatic. Aroma: straight hops. Flavor: hops, but without a bitterness that could be unpleasant. Nice brew.

355ml bottle (thanks tiong). Clear dark golden color. Medium size, thick yellow head, stays. Caramel, sweet, bit of cloth, malty in aroma. Papery, malty, sweet, hops in taste. Papery, malty and hops in aftertaste. Got taste, but they sit in different corners. Unbalanced brew.

(London 2017) 1/2 Pint Keg @ Euston Tap (West). Clear amber, creamy white. Nose is grainy soapy cereal. Taste is soap, caramel, grainy, cereal, lacking hop. Cereal & grain body. Wow this was surprisingly weak maybe just a case of the beer world moving in preferences but he classic Stone beers still work amazingly, these guys present themselves as the IPA brewery! Weak.

On tap at O'learys, Troms� Airport. Pours a clear amber colour with a light beige head. Fruity aroma of grapefruit, pineapple, papaya, pine, lime and grass. Hoppy flavour of pine, grass and grapefruit and grassy hops in the end. Has a slick mouthfeel, medium body and a medium to heavy bitterness. A quite hoppy and solid IPA.

Bottle from Wolters, Wasserbillig, Luxembourg!


Pours orange golden with a solid head. Aroma has pine, orange and lots of herbs. Taste has much herbal hops, fruits, pine and orange peel. Finish is long lasting, pine, blood orange and herbs.

On tap @Trapizzino Café (Rome). Ambrata viva, limpida, schiuma bianca media persistente. Al naso sentori di malto, agrumi, erbaceo, cicoria, ossidazione. In bocca va meglio, base di malto media con amaro medio, sicuramente non freschissima, le manca un po' di spunto. Corpo medio, carbonazione media. Si beve, ma non è certo in condizioni accettabili.
355ml bottle, has a really nice hoppy aroma (citrus, pine). Refreshing beer with the character (bitterness).

Thought I had rated this earlier but not so. Therefore we proceed. Drank out of the 12 oz bottle, that's what you do. Pleasant taste, lightly lemon, grapefruit, resin. Decently hoppy, just nothing to put it front of numerous other IPAs. Try again? Of course.

355 bottle from Waitrose, Sunningdale. Amber colour with white head. Grass, pine resin, citrus, bitter hops, floral hops. Body is a bit too thin and watery.

Found another beer I rated years ago where my rating disappeared. Bottle many times over the past five years, most recently at the company banquet. Aroma is citrus, tropical fruit, pine, malty, decent. Appearance is amber golden, off white head, clear. Taste is bitter, citrus and sweet tropical fruit enhanced by malt, floral and decent. Bottle, 35,5cl. Found at local discount store. Pours light amber, orange, clear with off-white head with good lacing. Fruity and fresh aroma. Draft Third of a Pint at GBBF 2010 (Day 1), Earl’s Court, London Aug 2010 - Amber in colour. Hoppy; piney, resinous, oily hops and grassy hops. Fruity; very orange citrus and grapefruit. Not much to say about this one that hasn’t already been said as it is one of the standard bearers of the west coast IPA and still holds up even after 20 years. I’ve had this one hundreds of times before and hope to have it hundreds of times more. An extremely solid classic.

Clear, deep golden colored, medium off white head, good lasting. Aroma is of some malt, caramel, fruity, citrus, pine hoppy. Taste is medium sweet malt, caramel, moderate fruity citrus and pine hops, medium+ bitterness, dry finish, bitter aftertaste. Medium bodied, soft carbonation, oily.

Bottle. Pours golden with a lovely white head. Aroma and taste are fruity, hoppy with some caramel notes and not too sweet. Very solid IPA indeed

Poured from a 12 oz bottle into a tulip.

Aroma: Classic citrus characters dominate the nose - grapefruit, lemon, and orange.

Appearance: Clear and clean in appearance. Color is a light amber or dark golden hue. Nothing special or unusual there. Head, however, is just about perfect. A full finger of fine white foam on the initial pour, and a half finger or so is retained all the way through. Lacing is consistent and long lasting.

Taste: For the most part follows the nose. A mild herbal note sneaks in on the back end. But many west coast IPA’s are, in my opinion, overloaded on hops that contribute to a piney, grassy, earthy taste. This IPA does a much better job of balancing it’s hop load with juicy citrus notes on the front end and herbal or grassy notes on the back. There is enough of a malt presence to keep the beer balanced, but not enough to overpower and make it a sweet malty mess.

Palate: Light enough body to be an easy beer to drink, almost like a session IPA in it’s body. But the ABV is very standard at about 6%, so it’s technically a bit high for a session brew. Carbonation is moderate and feels about right for an IPA. Slightly resinous feeling on the tongue. The finish is pretty clean and pleasant.

Overall: Is it the best IPA I’ve ever had? No, it probably doesn’t take that title. But I am having a tough time finding anything really wrong with it. With that in mind this beer gets a solid tick from me, and I’d happily recommend it as an excellent representation of a balanced and well put together IPA to anyone any day.

The color of the beer is light amber. The beer is crystal clear. Gas bubbles can be seen fizzling happily. A nice layer of rough white foam is formed o top of the beer, which collapses quickly. 
The smell is nice. The smell is more that of a regular pale ale than an IPA. There are a lot of sweet fruit notes, and less bitter hop tones. The fruit aromas contain passionfruit, citrus fruits and a hint of strawberry. There is a nice balance between bitter, sweet and some sour notes.
The taste is just as nice. I again taste some delicious citrus fruits, passionfruits, peach and some tropical flavours. It is a nice IPA. It’s less bitter and more fruity than most times though.
Full pint at the brewery. Iconic IPA in america. Beer that comes to classic.

Bottle 0.355 l, Tesco, Bournemouth, England, UK.

Złote piwo o obfitej pianie i przyjemnym, chmielowym aromacie z owocowymi i leśnymi nutami. W smaku początkowo lekko słodowe i karmelowe, następnie zdominowane przez wyrazistą i mocną, lekko zalegającą, leśną, chmielową goryczkę.

Dorato carico limpida, schiuma ampia e vaporosa. Aroma di agrumi, floreale con note erbacee. Una luppolatura decisa con buon retrogusto amaro. Manca forse un po? di freschezza ma è una ipa davvero ben fatta. Carbonazione perfetta.
Malt forward golden ale. Nice amount of hops. Nice bitterness level. Hops are floral sweet and crisp.
Very enjoyable ipa kinda middle of the road but very drinkable, would not hesitate to drink again.
Bottle. The body is clear yellow, with a big white head. The aroma is flowery. The taste is wonderfully sparkly.7

Thanks altonbrownd for the bottle! Poured into a taster showing well filtered caramel orange with white foam lacing. 

The nose shows caramel malts intertwined with pine. 

The palate is medium bodied and well carbonated. Flavors of tea like malts with a typical IPA bitterness on the finish. Nothing spectacular but nothing bad.
Klar som vatten, orange, tätt orange skum. Doft: Humle, lite växt beska, lite lager, sura godisar. Smak: Svaga smaker av allt, humle, växter, mandarin, pilsner, gräs.
Heldere gouden kleur en een goede kraag en. Ruikt fruitig orange, citrus. Smaakt fruitig, bitter, citrus, kruiden.

A spot on west coast IPA. Popping fresh citrus hops, a bready sweet malt and sold carbonation make it refreshing and challenging. Glad to see it sneaking into Liquor Control Board outlets in Central Canada!

Yet another beer I’ve drank a million times but somehow never rated. Bitter with a caramel-orange heart, bumping into an unusually bready middle. Semisweet on the finish, with a hefty hop-slathered fade. Not a defined as their special IPAs, but tasty.
350 bottle from tesco. Hazy orange . Marmalade nose . Bread coming through . Wow oranges. Nice. Head laces. Drinkable indeed
Bottle. Pours golden orange with white head. Aroma and taste are fruity, hoppy with some caramel notes. Nice bitterness and not too sweet. Very good IPA

DATE: December 3, 2016... OCCASION: Couldn’t get this poured fast enough, as PSU is already down 14 in the Big 10 Championship... GLASSWARE: Brew at the Zoo pint... pours a lively golden amber body that streams bubbles upward... a white, snowy single-finger thickness occupies the top shelf, with a distinct creaminess... the aroma is heavenly west coast hops, pine, tangerine, grapefruit, and orange peel... caramel and light bread aromas suggest balance... the first sip proves rewarding, with a wet kiss of graininess at the throat and a hint of tickle at the teeth... aftertaste lingers like a gentle reminder... medium-bodied and almost sessionable... the taste is heavy on lemon, tangerine, a counterbalancing bread malt, and some late resin--an IPA that knows what its purpose is... balanced, solidly weighted at 6.2%, and encouraging the next sip... not sure why this took so long to find my beer fridge, but as expected, an enjoyable classic....
Bouteille @Les rois malts. Une IPA très agréable, pas agressive sur l’amertume. On commence doucement sur des notes fruitées et une fin légèrement amère.
Tap@ bierpreuvenement Horst. Helder goud, weinig kraag. Smaakt een beetje dun, bitter, citrus, grapefruit, licht mout. Ruikt heel goed, grapefruit, citrus, fris.

Bottle. Aroma grapefruit zest and soiled straw. Pours orange golden with white froth unless your hand (like mine) is slow and steady. Crisp and sharp on the tongue the flavours are medium sour but the texture is more modest. For all the hype of 43 hop types and 65 malts, this is an IPA that will not form the basis for an evening out. It could disturbingly keep you in. Good but no cigar.
Pours clear with good head. Aroma is very citrus and floral. Strong bitterness that finds the right balance with sweetness of malts. Light easy finish, sessionable. Classic!
Bottle from tesco. Not bad, nice drinkability, well balanced, no harsh bitterness and a nice combo of hop aromatics and taste. Caramel notes minimal.

Flasa Saltney. Zlata farba, bez peny. Vona citrusova, jemne karamel, grapefruit. Chut sladova, citrusova, velmi lahko karamel, ovocie. Pekna dlha dochut. Stredne telo, vyssia nasytenost. Pitelne pivo, aj ked ten karamel by tam nemusel byt.
Bottle. Pours clear orange with low head. Aroma is grapefruit, hops, caramel. Taste is bitter, flowers, citrus.
Bottle. Plenty of Cali (???) hops, floral notes, nice malty lacing. Light finish, but plenty of hops to stick around. Pretty classic IPA, hard to disagree.

355ml bottle from Tesco. Pleasant aroma of grapefruit and caramel. The taste is medium sweet and medium bitter with a typical American hop flavour. Medium bodied, smooth and with soft carbonation. A really decent modern IPA.

Amber coloured, clear beer with a small 1 finger head. 

Aroma is honey & marmelade dominant with sweet orange at the back.

Taste is citrusy, flowery and quite perfumey. 

Very light body on this one, almost like a lager. 
Lingers along in palate a long time after having a sip, nice and sticky.

Overall an ok IPA, nothing to write home about but a nice sessionable one.
Bottle from a tesco in Bristol. Pours clear Amber. Nose is citrus, hay. Palate is bread, very hoppy. Good ipa, but not great.
Bottle 33 cl. Amber, clear with a foamy offwhite head. Tropical fruits, lemon aroma. Medium bitter, soft fruit end.
Characteristic flavour; resin, pumpkin and leaves-like hops with tasty short palate. Really unique.

Orangish body with a white one finger head. Aromas of citrus, floral,colliander,hops.The body is light to medium and the taste is dry,citrus like,hoppy,a lot of lemongrass.Not so bitter and very drinkable.
Rating from old records. On tap in Chicago during '16 Series. Straightfoward, balanced IPA. Cubs Win!
The prototypical IPA. Not a strong finish but enough hoppy goodness to drink a few and not have stanky IPA breath.

330 ml bottle. Pours clear golden with white head, good lacing. Hoppy aroma, citrus, mostly grapefruit. Later on less distinctive. Taste follows the aroma, hoppy, citrusy, mostly grapefruit. Long bitter finish, high carbonation. Very good IPA.
Clear light bronze with a strong nature white head. Pine needles, resin, somethinga bit grassy. Light grapefruit and grass. Not at all sweet, nice and bitter. Incredibly smooth and light palate.

On tap; Margarittaville - Navy pier (Chicago)
Cor escura alaranjada e turva; espuma levemente marfim de baixa formação e alta persistência com bom lacing.
Aroma de caramelo e muito cítrico de limão e toranja.
Sabor inicial de caramelo com final amargo cítrico equilibrado; retrogosto adstringente.
Corpo médio e média carbonatação.
Tavallista parempaa ipaa, tavallista paremmalla suutuntumalla. Aika Pehmyt oli
Backlog from june 2016. Draught at Taphouse. Hoppy. Aroma of pine, grass and grapfruit with malty backbone of caramel. The flavour starts sweet but finish bitter.

pale golden with perfect clarity. thick frothy white head that slowly dissipates. resiny citrus hop aromas of lemon and mandarin. notes of melon and soft malts as well. body is medium, with light astringency. resiny texture with a crisp carbonation. flavors are mostly from citrusy hops and bitterness is up front but its perfectly balanced by a bready malt backbone. this bitterness which is just not overwhelming, sticks around well into the finish. this is probably the best Lagunitas IPA in a bottle I have ever tasted! wish it would always taste this good.
355ml bottle. Pours clear golden. Citrus, tropical fruits and pine with more sweetness than average IPA. Good.

Crystal clear, light orange. Quickly disappearing frothy head. Aroma toffee, pine needles, grapefruit. Palate medium, medium carbonation. Taste complex, beginning with light caramel notes, progressing to tropical fruit notes - pineapple and lychee. Bit sweet in finish, long lasting biterness after that. Well blended. Overall nice IPA.

355 ml bottle. Clear, pale golden, thin white head, medium carbonation. Aroma is grapefruity, citrusy and malty, but a bit restrained. Mouthfeel is bitter and dry, with fizzy carbonation. Taste is grapefruity, grassy and herbal.

Très belle bière dorée à mousse beige persistante. Arômes d’agrumes et prune. Entrée en bouche très douce puis pointe l’orange, l’ananas et le houblon avec une amertume bien présente mais peu agressive. Joli !
On tap: Golden color. This has a sweet dank onion hoppiness, reminds me of fresh Columbus hops. Light peach fruit flavor, sort of grassy and herbal with an assertive and lingering bitterness.
Good solid IPA, lovely malty pallet and tropical fruit profile. I think this bottle was grey market so would love to taste fresh

This double IPA has a sharp sensual bitter taste with intense hoppiness - aroma is of citrus hops with a medium-high alcohol content of 6.2%. This robust India Pale Ale has very rich and distinct flavoring. Beer is golden blonde coloring and comes bottled and draft.

van tap @The Amsterdam Beerfair 2016, mooi helder gouden/geel met fijne witte kraag. aroma van graan maar verder redelijk ingetogen, smaken van citrus, gras, zwak/matig bitter, matig zoet, glad, redelijk grassig, citrus, grapefruit, zacht, gebalanceerde ipa, redelijke afdronk. medium body.
Van de tap bij tab homeland. Goudgeel met een witte kraag citrus met een klein beetje caramel tikkeltje wrang in de afdronk.

Aroma- flowers, spice, slight citrus Appearance- golden yellow pours half finger of white head that recedes into a thin sheet. Sticky, consistent lacing. Taste- sweet malt, floral hops, earth, citrus zest, alcohol heat. Palate- medium bodied and somewhat sticky with lively carbonation. Not as bitter as most AIPA’s. Overall- accessible to those who don’t love intensely bitter beers. Some complexity although it comes off a bit busy and unfocused.
Pinta en The Lock Tavern (Londres) Espuma blanca que dura toda la pinta, buen olor afrutado y sabor a lupulo suave, buena Ipa en general

Copenhagen 10/9 2016. 35,5 cl bottle from Meny. Little chubby bottle with straight up label declaring this to be a IPA in great bleck letters. Pours clear yellow with great white head. Settles as thin creamy layer of foam. Lacing on the side of the glass. Aroma of peach and passion fruit with solid tart notes of citrus. Soft carbonation and slightly thick palate. Flavor is medium sweet followed by more heavy bitterness. Aftertaste has nice bitterness and semi dry finish. Quite pleasureable.

9/3/8/5/19 Ein extrem hopfenscharfes classic americanostyle IPA. Viel von allem. Wald, Würze und Tropische Früchte treffen auf eine hohe Drinkability. AGAIN: Fassware. CAFE GRUTER Amsterdam.  7/3/7/4/17 US Malty Pine Backboneism first. Dann echt lägger😉. TangerineHoppy, refreshing & tapwatery!?😎..passe an...

Bottle at pub. Pours hazy golden with off-white head. Aroma is really fruity with hops. Taste has fruits and flowers. Hints of honey and orange. Aftertaste is bitter hops. Hops are not too strong which is a plus for me. Really nice fruity IPA.
Dorée orangée quasi limpide, amertume modérée mêlée d’une petite note caramel, agrumes et fruits jaunes. Bouteille 33cl achetée chez Chop’In, Paris, France, bue le 20/08/2016.

Draft at Beer Wars... Off-white bubbles.... on top of a crystal clear polished copper.

Aroma is cranked up citrus pine and summer flowers Only malts I’m picking up on is a little biscuity goodness.. maybe some toasted grains...but I could be imagining things.

Good balanced bitterness fighting against a good lite caramel/toasted grain back... finishes with a minerally fruity hoppy flavor that I tend to associate with Amarillo hops... I have no idea if their are Amarillos in this one. Very nice mouthfeel .
Bottle - clear, heavy carbonation, golden yellow / orange with large white head. Strong fruity orange aroma. Slight ting on tongue and in mouth. Sharp bitter finish.

Arômes de houblon frais persistants. Robe dorée claire avec mousse abondante, compacte, durable et collante. Malheureusement ce sont là les points forts de cette bière au goût un peu trop timide dans le style de la bière (agrumes, floral).

Bottle. Nice hazy golden appearance with lasting head. A malty ipa. Caramalt, pine some cirtus and some orange in the taste and the aroma. Medium bitter. I like em more hoppy and bitter, but a decent brew.
On tap (Euston tap - London). Color : clear golden ale with very thin white head. Nose : yeast. Aromas : resin, pinus. Dry texture, medium carbonation, medium bitterness.

In my opinion, this is the gateway IPA for newbies to the style. An oldie but goodie that is always a reliable fallback choice. The malt shines through more than the hops making it a PG-13 IPA by today’s standards. Mildly herbal, spicy and mostly biscuity to slight toasty malt on the nose. The flavor imparts a friendly hop bite that is citrus and floral enveloped in a toasty sweet malt character. Seems more English style inspired than west coast.
Alla spina. Una IPA classicissima, vellutata e dissetante con un marcato uso di luppoli "americani" che ne fanno un complemento dissetante e perfetto per accompagnare una bella cena in un pub.

Bottle at home. Clear dark golden, thin white head. Sweet malts, citrus fruity, grassy, resiny sweet and medium vegetal bitter, some grapefruit zest. Full malty body, heavy oily/gelly texture, soft carbonation. Nice but not amazing. Less fresh hops and more malt than expected. // Bottle at Schiermonnikoog. Golden with white head. Sweet malts, dried grass, fudge, citrus, resin, light garliccy. Moderate sweet and bitter. Medium body and soft carbonation. Nice allround IPA. Not too crazy on hops. I do prefer a bit more crazy myself. Freshness of my Dutch import improved now it’s a Heineken beer.

Piwo klarowne w kolorze bursztynowym z dosc obfita piana ktora pozostawia ladny lacing na szkle. W aromacie owoce tropikalne, cytrysy i ananasy. W smaku zywiczna goryczka na srednim poziomie. Czuc slody karmelowe i troche biszkopty. Wysycenie na srednim poziomie. Piwo dosc gladkie i przyjemne ale przydaloby sie troche wiecej chmielu zeby wszystko zaostrzyc.

Bottle @ GMDH. Pours a hazy darker copper beer with a small off white head on top. Aroma of moderate citrus, zest, grapefruit and a big malty, bready sidenote. Flavor is light bitter, grassy with hints of cookies and very easy drinkable and sessionable. Carbonation is fairly high, aftertaste is long and light bitter. Very decent stuff.

355ml bottle at home. BB: 17.05.2017. Nose: Some sweet maltiness and floral hops sith some pine. Taste: malty hoppiness, with a big bitter lingering finish. Quite drinkable and very balanced and solid.

Klar lys brun med høyt hvitt skum. Lett fruktig lukt, sydhavsfrukt, fersken og grapefrukt. Lett til middels fylde. middels pluss i bitterhet, grapefrukt, druestener og noe søtlighet mot fudge. Middels lang.
On tap at the Shacklewell Arms. Just hops for the nose, and a good malty hit in the taste. Perfectly fine but not very exciting.
Bottle from beermerchants. Light hazy orange color. Medium white head. Taste is medium bitter, light sweetness. Medium body. Aroma is orange, pine, hops, grass, pineapple, mango.
Bottle at De Paas. Hazy bright orange pour with a decent white head. Notes of caramel, oranges, honey, tropical fruit. Medium body, medium to low carbonation and a bitter-sweet and hoppy finish.

Nice and light ipa. Very smooth finish and like hoppy taste. Very drinkable

Great bang for the back in Sweden! Not best at anything but good at everything. Not so poppy and fruity as I like them but overall very good!

Tap at The Chicago Diner
Clear golden with lasting white head. Light malts, white grapes, grassy, touch of lemon, dry caramel with a touch of paper. Under medium sweet and medium bitter. Just medium bodied. Very drinkable but also slightly dusty and boring.
Meh... didn’t enjoy this at all. I found the flavours muted, and a strange astringency. Not great.

Golden. Aroma has plenty of citrusy hops, and a bit of spice. Full hoppy flavour, but lacking in malts. Lightly sweet taste with moderate bitterness. Light/medium body. Overall, a pretty good IPA. The ABV is standard for a normal IPA, but due the lack of malt character and body it almost tastes like a session IPA.
Kirkas, kullankeltainen olut vaahtoaa kohtalaisesti. Makean hedelmäinen tuoksu, maku ei kovin katkera, eikä kovin hedelmäinen. Ehkä kokonaisuutena vähän pliisu, tosin nautittu baarista hyvin kylmänä.

Originally rated on 10/1/08. Aroma is nice, strong smell of pine, with hints of citus and some pineapple. Apperance is a copper body, not much carbonation, almost non-existent head. Flavor kinda got me, initial taste of cereal and a lingering bitterness. Overall it is o.k. but i probably wont buy it again. Re- rate 4-9-10 i have had this a few more times and it has gotten better so from the original 3.3 to a 3.6

Bottle @ Black&Brown inn, Stockholm. Pours amber with a White head. Aroma with notes of tropical fruits, light citrus, malts. Taste is somehow bitter with a alot of tangerine, piney, Honey aswell. Light sweet finish.

Served on tap at Coors field. Clear light Amber color with a white head. Malt heavy flavor with a hops finish. Citrus hops aroma. Medium body.

Nice dark yellow orange color. Very piney, with a little lemon to the hops. Slight soapy scent with the standard bitter hops aroma. Mouth feel is good, crisp up front and finishes medium through.Tap

from bottle, poured a deep golden to light amber colour with a white head. nose of sweet bread malts, toffee, pineapple, fresh citrus, zest, and light pine bitterness. taste is crisp, bread, citrus, and a light bitter pine aftertaste.
Slightly hazy gold with white creamy head two fingers high. Crisp citrus aroma, well-balanced hop bitterness (citrus with some resin) with caramel malt notes and a slightly sweet finish.

Deep gold amber colour with big honey foam. Aromas, fruity of passionfruit, pineapple, honey, orange and hops. Palate, medium body with smooth texture leaving sweet finish. Taste, lightly hoppy, floral with hints of honey. Overall, not bad easy going but not outstanding either.
amber color;citrusy, floral hop aroma; citrusy, floral hops with mild pine notes on a light, bready malt base

12fl oz bottle poured into a Samuel Adams Perfect Pint. Sparkling Amber with a ton of offwhite head. Aroma is slightly fruity while the flavor is biscuit and hops. Less hoppy than typical IPAs. Decent brew.

On tap at Cha Chas Latin Kitchen, Brea, CA. Golden-orange with a white head. Aroma and taste of citrus, caramel malt, and pine. Exceptional balance. Quite good and complements spicy food nicely.
Pours orange with small white head that disappears quickly. Highly carbonated. Very hoppy as you’d expect from an IPA. Citrus fruit is prominent - grapefruit. Quite dry texture. Bitter. Nice

On tap at Fermentoren Aarhus. Pours a clear, orangy golden with a big, white head. Aroma has lots of juicy, fruity hops, light caramel, pale ale malts and a piny hop note. Taste has a nice, subtle sweetness, gets more dry and finishes off pretty bitter. Medium high carbonation and an oily body. Rather simple compared to the insane amount of ingredients.
Clear golden, white head. Aroma has pine and passionfruit. Similar flavour with subtle caramel backing. Lasting bitterness but otherwise a bit too light.

Très belle couleur cuivré transparente avec une petite effervescence et une légère mousse. Nez cuivré sur des effluves de mangue et de miel. En bouche, c’est légèrement gazéifié, cuivré avec un léger soupçon de petits fruits et de thé vert. Une petite finale amer laissant trace sur les sucres résiduel!

Âmbar dourada, translúcida, espuma de boa formação e média persistência. Aroma bastante cítrico, alaranjado, tangerina, mel, lúpulo. Paladar médio amargor e dulçor. Corpo e carbonatação médios e bem dosados. Final mantém o cítrico e evidência mais o amargor, malte aparece mas em segundo plano, dulçor continua caramelado/mel.

From tap. Pours dark amber with a light white foam. Aroma is hops and a bit of citrus. Taste is hops, citrus, caramel and malt. I’m a little confused with this beer. The carbonation lacks a bit, but overall a fine brew.

Tap@Søernes. Pours almost clear light amber with offwhite head. Aroma of light malts, biscuit and has a resinous, fruity hoppiness yet sweetish. Taste is light malts, biscuit, light toffee and a fruity, resinous, citrus hoppy character with a crisp balanced bitter finish.

4oz sampler @ VCBW 2016- Day 3. Very bright citrus attack, soft lvl-5-sweet toffee malt. Orange jolly rancher candy (surprise!). Super subtle crisp green hops, lingering for the finish. Mild background tangy. Good flavour, solid, and a nice surprising orange flavour.

Clear golden colour with big, but quickly diminishing head. Medium intensive aroma of citrus, floral and multivitamin note with light malty background. Taste is light sweet, medium bitter with medium long bitter/sweet finish. Soft to medium carbonation. Medium body. Solid IPA.

Sample at brewery. It’s pretty, has a great head, full mouth feel and a good finish. But it tastes like its trying to do too much so ends up confused and tasting like general floralness with some slight pine.

Bottle from Thirsty the Beer Shop, Singapore. Poured a crystal clear medium amber with a frothy white head and a few bubbles. The aroma is tropical citrus fruit, woody hop. The flavour is moderate bitter with a dry fruity woody hop resin palate. Medium bodied with average to lively carbonation.

Good taste, lovely aroma. Had read about this beer are it's exactly as I expected.

On tap- Golden color, thin head. Spice, hops, malt on the nose. Nice acidity and hops presence on the palate. Leaves a balanced finish.
Pours a clear gold with a thin head. Aroma has notes of pine, biscuits, and citrus. Tasting notes include cedar, mango, and more biscuit malts. Not bad, nicely crafted.

Bottle at Home. Pours amber with a White head. Aroma tangerine, notes of tropical fruits, light citrus, light malts. Taste is rather bitter with a alot of tangerine, piney, Honey dew. Light sweet finish. Old School but very drinkable.
Straight from the bottle by the campfire. Smells of pine. Taste is stronger pine. Yep, it’s an IPA, and a pretty hoppy one, even by IPA standards. It’s OK, but not my preferred style.

Draft at BWW. Nose is light citrus like lemon and orange. Light flower. Clear pale gold. White head laces grate. Taste is less hop forward but very drinkable. Like a hoppy cream ale. Leg might be old. Nice.

Can from Tesco: Faint floral and citrusy aroma. Light, clean, translucent amber with a soft white head. Tastes of pine, citrus, maybe fruit. Very lightly bitter and the bitterness doesn’t linger much. Not very much hop character. Another simple staple. *** Much better on tap (at the Maypole, Cambridge, UK). Has much more flavor - a nice fruity kick.
On tap is a very different experience from a 355 ml bottle (much better on tap). Nice clear golden amber color with a decent white, creamy head. Citrus notes on the tongue, sour to bitter finish.
Orange peel and pine needles in a blender. Harsh bitterness, sticky sweet and more orange peel, from an old orange you found in the fridge.

Golden color,
Refreshing

A good IPA found at tesco UK

355ml bottle. Fairly clear (looks like some fine sediment floating) amber-orange colour, two-finger white head, some lacing, good retention. Fresh hoppy aroma, citrus, orange zest. Slightly sweet fruity hoppy flavours, orange zest, lemon, mango, grapefruit, some malt but quite subtle, feels quite well balanced though. Dry and crisp. Long bitter finish.

Draft at some random Irish pub somewhere in North South Boston. Despite being served in a frozen glass it's got an orange tint and an inch of white foam though it's hard to estimate how much the bartender poured down the drain to get there. Solid leafy pine notes on the nose. Solid pine on the tongue. Finished clean. Not my fave but bumping my score up some to compensate for the suboptimal conditions.

On tap at Lagunitas tap room, Pataluma (CA, USA). Dark gold clear pour, off-white foamy head. Nose: floral, tangerine, sweet juice. Mouth: frizzy carbo, middle silky malts, mild bitter finish.

It has a brown-orange colour. Its very bitter, in fact the first lagunitas that i drunk it cost me a bit.

On tap at Token/Brooklyn Roasting Co. A clear darkish gold, finger of white foam, sticky lacing. Nice aroma of citrus, pine, slightly sweet malt. Tastes much the same, very balanced flavours, piney hoppy backend. Very easy to down, quenching dry bitterness. A quintessential standard IPA, no faults, better than I remember.

BOTTLE 12 OZ, courtesy of Maersk. Clear dark amber, creamy head. The aroma is not blowing you away, but is nice and fresh - green grass and zest, notes of gooseberry and lemon pith. The malts are almost non-existent. The taste is also mostly dry - just a little fruity sweetness. The rest is mostly hops - lemon pith tart bitterness, fresh grass and light gooseberry astringency. A good one, even though not very bright.

Clear, light amber with medium carbonation and lager style head. Fruity full clean nose and taste. Lots of pineapple, lemon, zingy-ness. Crisp and dry. Clean medium bitter finish. Accomplished beer.

-- rated with beerbasher/winphone
Pours clear orange gold with a white head that lasts and laces the glass.  Big aroma of citrus and grass. Hoppy with citrus and pine taste. Good bitterness. Good beer.

Bottle. Slightly hazy amber pour with a small off-white head. Aroma is caramel and citrus zest. Taste is much the same, light for an IPA but balanced, caramel and citrus with a bit of a grassy note. Solid IPA.
Dry citrus hops. Juicy. Don’t have much to say about it really. A basic, quality IPA.

Amber color. Huge creamy thick head. Some carbonation. Smells grass, herbs, hops. Very floral. Medium a bit oily body with bitter focus and nice long bitter finish. Tastes usual IPA. Good, but not exceptional

Svårbedömd. Dracks efter många andra öl. Okej humle men inget riktigt bett. Vi får testa igen
