Bottle. Very pleasantly surprised. Great bitterness, citrus, pine. Very tight carbonation. Little spice. Super drinkable.

Le liquide est couleur d’or jaune, avec de petits lambeau de mousse en surface. Le nez est de fruits jaunes et de toffee. Au goût, ce classique de la côte ouest se présente comme une IPA qui laisse les malts voler la vedette par moments ; savoureuse sans être intense, les houblons y sont mais sans tout arracher sur leur passage. Pourrait être un peu plus fonceuse, mais si on aime les bières un peu plus subtiles, c’est un choix intéressant.
Starts with citrus followed by a strong pine taste, all around a very complete IPA

Aroma: citrus notes, mango, some pine and herbs.
Appearance: hazy golden color and white head.
Taste: medium pine bitterness, mango, some yellow citrus, nice malty backbone, resin, semi-dry.
Palate: medium body and medium carbonation, bitter finish.
Overall: An icon, great tasty stuff,

Pours amber brown with slight cloudiness and plenty of carbonation. Consistent thick white head.

Aroma is not that pleasant with a soapy note coming through amid the pine, honey, mint and orange peel. It’s sweet although there is bitterness there as well, but not enough to balance it out. Hint of booze on the nose, but it’s watery for its ABV and has a slightly unpleasant aftertaste. 

If I hadn’t had this a few times before I’d think this one was a dud that was over-oxygenated. At least it’s consistent! I want to like this given it’s availability and origins, but it’s a real disappointment.

Aroma of honey-on- toast and cereal dominate. The hop aroma is quite muted: fairly undifferentiated hints of pine and citrus. Taste: the balance between sweet and bitter is ever so slightly too much in favour of the honey sweetness for me. The bitterness is very nice, though: very orange pithy. It’s a very nice beer but very simple and, because it’s imported, it’s too expensive.
Tap at Winking Lizard Citrus, pine and tropical fruit flavors the most notable. A honey maltiness helps balance all the hops. Very easy to drink.
Nice but fairly standard west coast citrus hop aroma. Average appearance. Very good complex flavor package, this one is put together very well. Excellent aftertaste with decent bitterness.

Pours a fairly small foamy and bubble tan head and has a clear golden light amber appearance. Decent lacing. Aromas of floral and earthy hops. Fruity and toasted malts as well. Flavours are quite fruity and hoppy, lots of citrusy and piney hop notes. Average carbonation and retention. Medium bodied with a bit of an astringent mouthfeel. Good balance of bitterness and sweetness. An easy to drink IPA with subtle and effective hops that don’t overpower the palate.
Cerveja que tomei em Londres no bar The Ice Wharf em Candem Town. Sabor interessante, um pouco diferente das IPAs que estou acostumado a beber. Uma cerveja gostosa.

Aroma is hops battling for prominence. Citrus, grass, a bit of something sweet. Pours a light copper/apple juice color. Fizzy, one finger offwhite head. Long lasting lacing. Taste is a combination of hops. Citrus, pine. Not that much of a malt backing. It is a bit watery. Bitter finish. I know that it states 65 various malts, but not getting much from that (maybe due to too many Utah IPAs where malt is very prominent). Pretty decent IPA. Won’t rank up as one of my favorites - maybe not even in top ten. Also not my favorite Lagunitas....still, one I can see me picking up again.

Flavoursome, fruity, tropical. 
This is a really great beer and available in Waitrose. 
First class!

Inget krångel här utan en enkel lättdrucken ipa. Humle, ljus malt, karamell, sötma, lagom beska. Inget som sticker ut men helt klart en enkel balanserad ipa.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a rich looking apple juice gold, with a short white fizzy head. Sweet sappy nose, with note of grape, toasted cereal malts. Good balance with the toast, and sweet, and piney bitters. Very good beer. More straight-forward than expected. Pithy. Lots of citrus, peach, pine, grass, black tea. Definitely a good palate... but I suppose that’s what you get when you have all those varietals in there. Does it hit a home run.... no.. but it’s definitely a stand up double. It’s good, with a very herbal and somewhat soapy finish.

Bottle, 355 ml. Pours medium amber/orange with a finger of off-white head. Head retains a while with some lacing. Clear with a small amount of visible carbonation. Acacia honey, citrus, orange, and a bit of pine on the nose, in roughly that order. Slint hint of booze and soap maybe, which is a shame. Quite a bitter offering flavour-wise with strong resinous hop character initially, giving way to sourdough bread, cereal and honey towards the end - gets a little bit watery. Quite a dry finish with some lingering bitterness on the tongue. Medium bodied, quite thick and sticky texture with quite sharp carbonation - little bit excessive. Nice stuff overall but there’s a slightly chemical-y and artificial feel here making it not as easy and smooth as it could be.
Draft sample. Pours a goldy straw color with a nice small white head. Small lacing. Nose is citrus hops,some pine, other hop stuff lol. Palate is bright hop resin flavor. I dunno lol it’s delicious

Bouteille 355 ml. LCBO. Couleur jaune assez foncé, mousse blanche crémeuse et persistante qui recouvre le liquide doré. Au nez belle explosion de houblon frais et un peu de malt. En bouche, douce, assez maltée pour soutenir le houblon et un efinale avec une belle amertume. L’équilibre de cette bière est sa plus grande qualité.
Poured from tap at ICC Beverly dark copper color with a nice white head. Aromas of sweet malt fruity citrus and dank pine. Taste is nice slightly sweet with notes of lingering hop bitterness.
Tap at Buffalo Wild Wings, Omaha. Poured copper with a foamy white head. Aroma was pin, citrus and fruity. Taste was bitterness and pine.
On draught at purecraft bar and kitchen Amber with a thin head lightly hoped body with a lovely aftertaste nice

12oz bottle - Pours medium copper and bubbly head. Balanced. Citrusy, and more floral in the nose... but with hint of ripe fruit. Sour dough bread, with an almost herbal like finish. A beer for most occasions, and a good pizza beer. Decent IPA.

Nice floral orange aroma, good mouthfeel, taste explosive sweet, wooded mushroom, really bitter. Too bitter for many styles but perfect here. Balances dry sharp with alcohol perfumed elegance. Really nice beer.

A solid standard for the type. Pours clear dark gold with lots of foamy head and clumpy lacing. Nose is grapefruit. Flavours of grapefruit, dank, resin some cereal. Taste medium bitter light sweet. Full smooth and sticky body with lively carbonation. Nice.
Ámbar limpio, espuma blanca. Aromas cítricos, pino y resinas. Cuerpo medio, maltoso, con sabor como en aroma y final de amargor equilibrado.

12oz bottle. Clear amber with a frothy white head. Flavors are caramel, bready cereals, grapefruit and pine resin with grassy and floral notes notes. Medium body, moderate carbonation, smooth texture. Solid west coast IPA.

Lugunita’s IPA , Pataluma, California, USA 6,2 % Vol. - Owocowa nuta - mocne akcenty grejfrutai limonki. W tyle domieszka karmelu. W smaku także sporo domieszek ziołowych, kwiatowych i żywica lasów amarykańskich. Super pijalne!!!
Kolor bursztynowy. Obfita, bardzo gęsta, biała jak śnieg piana.
Fez pouca espuma, que logo dispersou. Bem aromatica. Coloração dourada levemente turva. Amarga, mas não muito, gosto citrico e floral. Resumindo, top! Deliciosa!

355ml bottle from Brewdog BottleDog (The Good Spirits Co, Glasgow - £2.40):

A cracking IPA with a very good aroma that jumps right out of the bottle at you & the taste backs it up with plenty of pine, citrus & plenty bitterness. Whilst not as good as their ‘A Little Sumpin’ Wild’ this one is still very good & yet again the brewery doesn’t disappoint. This one is a beer that is well worth a try if you happen across it.

Aroma - caramel and citrus and floral hops.
Appearance - body is a clean amber, with a little sediment. The head is white and about 1 3/4" and settles slowly. Some lacing.
Taste - has caramel malt with some citrus, floral, and herbaceous hops.
Palate - medium body, not oily, average carbonation, bitter finish.

Wow...usually don’t an IPA nearly this high since I’m not a big fan of them. A yeasty, earthy type brew without the normal after taste of an IPA. Solis brew and one of my top 3 for this style of beer.
A nice smooth IPA. Grains blend nicely with delicious choice of hops. Overall a nice IPA.

Big airy white head, nice lacing. Crystal clear dark golden colour. Aroma is pine and crystal malt, not very complex. Fairly malty caramel and pine flavour. Pleasant yet firm bitterness. Medium mouthfeel with a dry finish. Pretty tame by today’s IPA standards.
A good IPA but I prefer Maximus instead.. Well it's not so bad but it's better for me to chose Maximus instead this ipa

Butelka 335ml. Piana szybko opadajaca ale ladny lacing. Kolor bursztynowy, klarowny. Aromat lasu, slodkich ziol. W smaku lekko miodowa slodycz, las, kwiaty, laka, ziola, slodkie jablko. Slodycz dominuje goryczke, ktora mimo, ze schowana na drugi plan, daje znak swojej obecnosci :). Bardzo dobre AIPA

I think I expected too much. Very standard, no faults but no outstanding points either. I bought a bottle for 8$ so there weren’t much benefits in price too. A little bit dry, more of hop accented than other west coast IPA like Sculpin.
Muted aroma of pine and citrus. There’s grapefruit, sweet caramel malts, a bit of tropical fruit and some herb. Decent bitterness. Not an outstanding IPA but a good one.

Many, many bottles in many, many different places. How have I not reviewed this beer before? It’s a very middle-of-the-road American IPA, which means it’s got a moderately-high hop aroma and firm bitterness, some malt but not too much, and a pretty clean fermentation. I honestly can’t fathom why they make it with "43 different hops’ and ’65 various malts’ (??), but that sounds complicated for no reason, so good for them and their logistics team. Overall -- not a bad choice if you see it on a grocery store shelf.

6 pack from LCBO. Kills me kinda to buy six but the things we will do for a rating. Had their pilsner in Florida (liked it) & their more hop forward ipa in Columbus, Ohio (really, really liked it) but this ... Is just your run of the mill, table ipa. A review below suggests this brew is a good middle of the road export beer & that’s why Heinken hoovered this up. Makes sense to me. Hops seem old & muted, malts are forward but offer little in the way of complexity, bitterness is whatever, really lets be honest I feel I could write anything here ... No one is reading, no one is listening, I’m Kafka stuck in a beer rating website, drinking too much & getting raged by the machine. But yeah anyways decent beer to pound after you drink something more local & more interesting.
Wonderfully fresh taste with a distinct hoppyness. Balanced and mature. Will try again.

Bottle from Morrisons. Fresh zesty citrus hoppy aroma with subtle malty notes. Nice looking golden colour with a nice white head that’s lasting well. Midweight, nice clean hoppy flavours, lasting well on the long finish, again subtle malt in the background. A cracking beer! :)

Bottle, acquired from Morrisons, drunk at home. 16/01/2016

For quaffing a good clean IPA this is really a go-to beer. It’s got a load of hop extract and I always find it strangely consistent which is why Heineken decided to stump up the cash I’m sure. 

The quality is second-to-none. Unlike most hop-forward US IPA’s this one stands up to export. The malt balance is very good. The malt they have used is excellent. Super clean beer. Super sessionable. Cheap and easy. No messing around and a classic I can go to again and again an d not be disappointed by. Great beer.

Poured from a bottle. Pours a clear medium amber with a full head of white foam. Pine resin aroma with a hint of citrus. Not too strong but noticeable. Medium body. Mostly bitter citrus rind flavor on the roof of the mouth. Not too harsh with a fairly smooth finish. A little lingering bitterness but most of the flavor disappears fairly quickly. Somewhat refreshing but a little too bitter for me. OK but not great.

From a bottle at Animal Kingdom. Pours clear bright gold with a creamy, bubbly off white head. Tastes like sweet grapefruit, caramel malt, bready, and tropical citrus hops. Light/medium body and low carbonation. Smells like bready and caramel malt, citrus hops, grapeftuit.
Pours copper with nice head. Aroma is of malt, citrus and pine. Taste: pretty malty and a nice bitter palate. Good one.
Bottle from morrisons small thin head nice color loads of fruit flavours going on,pineapple mango, lychee, kiwi decent stuff.
Drank from bottle. Find this brewery to be good, but slightly over hyped. Good ipa, not great.

Bottle - Wow, I’ve never dated this? Okay--here we go! Pours clear golden amber with a foamy off white head. Nose is pine, citrus, and a lightly sweet caramel bread malt base. Taste is the same, though a little more sweet and dull. Light pine and grapefruit on the finish, though it’s a bit medicinal. Slick and oily, with medium carbonation. Not that impressive.

12 oz. bottle pours an orange/golden color with two finger head that lasts a while and leaves some lacing. Aroma has the expected citrus and caramel. Taste is slightly bitter with some sweetness in the middle before a short, dry, inoffensive finish. Body is light to medium with average carbonation. This is an omnipresent IPA in Chicago, which I took for granted for too long, but which serves its purpose and satisfies.

Clear golden pour. Aroma is lots of grapefruit and some malt.
Taste is thin - some citrus, some hops, some malt but nothing really shines.
355ml bottle. Clear amber with a frothy white head. Caramel aroma with some fruit. Taste is grapefruit, floral, caramel. Just the right level of bitterness

Bottle from Rehills Newcastle. Strong, fruity, hoppy flavours. Bitter but really refreshing too. A fantastic IPA 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Butelka 330ml. Bursztynowy kolor z biala dosc duza piana. W zapachu cierpkie akcenty owocowe i chmiel. W smaku uderzenie koleandru , cytrusow,owocow tropikalnych wszytko bardzo orzezwiajace ale i wytrawne. Goryczka wyrazna na finiszu. Ciekawe IPA z USA .
Clear amber, large frothy slightly off-white head. Mild fruity and floral aroma. Nicely balanced fruit and hop flavours, good malty backbone, not over sweet. Really nice.

Bottle at home. Pours a clear golden amber with a medium white head. Aroma is tropical fruits, bread, apricot. Taste is biscuit, mango, apricot, slight pine, slight bitter finish. A decent enough beer that is readily available in local pubs and supermarkets. Not quite as hoppy as I remember from first trying it a few years ago.

Pours straw color with a medium tan head. Aroma of pine resin. Initial taste of floral pine that starts bold then mellows and lingers softly. This is a classic IPA. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy
Bottle. Ambre color, frothy off-white head. Aromatic hop aroma. Herbal hop flavor with an oily finish. Good balance. Medium-full body, medium carbonation. Nice!

Bottle from Kirkcaldy’s M&S. Pours clear. Wet straw coloured. Quickly diminishing head. Bit of lacing in the glass. Bit metallic in aroma. Wet dog. Quite earthy. Not the freshest. Lemon cordial. Small amount of pineapple tropicality. Medium carbonation. Quite creamy. Medium body. Slightly oily in mouthfeel. Dry cracker malt. Some more lemon cordial. Bit sharp. Dry finish that really coats the mouth. Prefer the aftertaste. Nothing special.
Bottle at Phoenix hotel. Cloudy golden colour, white foamy head. Tropical fruity hop profile, slightly resinous, sweet malty base. Medium body and low carbonation.

Bottle. Citrus, resin, tea-like herbal notes, some tropical notes. Very good malt-hop balance, with the body balancing the grapefruity, pomelo finish. Far from being overpowered by bitterness. Very tasty.

Bottle@home, from Wine Spot, Cleveland, USA. Light/medium aroma with sweet but fresh mango. Light copper color with small white head and slightly hazy liquid. Medium taste with slightly over aged mango. Simple taste with narrow spectrum and medium bit hoppy aftertaste. Medium body with light/medium carbonation. Overall drinkable but too simple.

Pretty good ipa but nothing that outstanding. Nice faint citrus and pine aroma, taste mostly pine and bitterness. Not that complex or tasty, just above average. Worth trying again on tap but nit to buy for home. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours almost orange with a light white head. Great aroma of citrus in particular grapefruit and hops. Taste again of citrus and resin with a nice bitter hoppy aftertaste. Really like this one, beer for all occasions. The more i drin it the more I like it, deserves a few extra points!

Tap; (Lolo’s, Stillwater, MN) pours clear copper pour with a white head; aroma of citrus and pine with a little malt and herbal notes; taste is grapefruit and other citrus fruits with some pine and malt; bitter, dry finish with some herbal hints; nice IPA
This one was a bit to hoppy for me, too bitter with an after taste that last, wasn’t for me.

Bottle.

A- Caramel, pine, citrus, rubbing alcohol.

A- Orange color, clear liquid, off white head.

T- Carmel, floral, pine, citrus, bitter, corn.

P- Medium body, average texture, average carbonation, slightly bitter finish.

O- Figured this would be super aggressive but it was actually quite malty and caramelly. Not overly exciting.

Bottle from Waitrose. Pours light golden amber with velvety white head. Aroma is quite unusual - pleasantly grassy with oak, citrus and vanilla. Taste strong in hops with oak, dusty malts, molasses, pineapple and resin.

One of those classic West Coast IPAs, tasted many years ago but apparently I cannot find my rating anymore, so I purchased a (relatively) fresh bottle. Clear, warm orange blonde colour with peachy hue under a medium thick, egg-white, moussy head slowly dissolving but retaining well on the edges. Appealing aroma of strong roasted onion (Simcoe?), fairly strong pine resin, yellow grapefruit peel, chicken spices, freshly toasted bread, more subtle accents of lime zest, cedar needles, mandarin, mango, cigarette tobacco, paprika, green olive, tropical flowers, mineral water. Clean, crisp onset of restrained fruit sweetishness (hints of mango, orange and redcurrant) with salty and umami accents, soft carbo, very supple, lean, bit oily body carrying an increasing amount of hops which come to maturity in the finish, drying, peppery, aromatic but softly yet deeply bittering as well, onion-, pine- and grapefruit-like retronasally, allowing just a narrow trace of malt ’juiciness’ to peep through, minerally effect in the back as well. This beer introduced me to American-style IPA years ago and did that job very well. Still enjoyed it a lot.

on tap at Brothers Beer Bistro (Ottawa, ON). Limpid amber body with an average, white foamy head. Good hoppy aroma with malty, woody, and citrusy hints. Its sharp, robust hoppy taste carries woody, citrusy, and some brown sugar notes. Ends with a long, strong bitter finish. Good stuff.

Bottle, from Waitrose. Gold, thin but lasting white head and good condition. Sweet citrus orange, yeast and solid hop resin fight for attention in the nose, full and citrusy in the mouth with a pleasant sweet yeastiness, some melon and bubble gum and a good hop resin bitterness, finish is quite sweet and alcoholic with a lingering chalky hop and yeast bitterness.
Bottle at tgi Fridays. Best thing available here. Citrus, hoppy nose. Taste is ash, but not too much, wood, pine. Middle of the road ipa.
Draught at Beer Market Dublin. Clear gold and a frothy white head. Huge grapefruit aroma. Fresh grapefruit up front with a nice bitter finish that isn’t too dry.

Botella 33 cl tomada en el momento en Liberty Bounds. Zona Tower of London. 05..11..2015. (r2400). Color ámbar claro algo velado con espuma blanca persistente. Aromas y sabores lupulados frescos. Cuerpo medio con 6.2 vol fácil de beber y con algo de espuma y cierta densidad. Buen toque de lupulos frescos y herbaceos con ligeros tonos cítricos y maltosos algo dulces. Bastante buena para repetir sin duda.

0,355 l pullo @ m/s Amorella. Kirkas kullankeltainen. Tuoksussa hedelmäistä humalaa, mallasta. Haistaessa saattaa olla liian kylmä, koska tuoksussa löytyy metallia. Maussa raikasta havuista humalaa, mallasta.

Draught, small long lasting, slightly dense creamy bubbly head, clear light copper to deep rusty orange color, aroma of citrus and pine, flavor of herbs, shrubs and grapefruit with an underluying malty backbone, strong mellow shrubby grapefruit bitterness, light piney mellow aftertaste, Classic satisfying IPA.

This is weird, I’m 100% sure I have rated this before as I remember writing that I had it at my wedding. Anyway, just had 3 bottles at a pub yesterday. Nice hoppy smell with pine and grape. Similar taste. Nice strong bitterness, not sharp though.

Pour copper with thin white head. Rich aroma of pine, resin, grapefruit, citrus and sweet malts. Taste is medium to strong bitter balanced nicely with the sweetness. Quite slick feeling in the mouth, a very decent IPA

Mmmm ja very nice hoppy tasty great with some nuts.
Clear good head ripping juice ja ja tuk tuk

Decent head that leaves a fine layer of lace. Light amber in color and slightly cloudy.

Floral hop nose with an interesting milk-like (lactose?) aroma. Very fresh and clean smelling. Inviting

The initial malt flavor is completely covered by the hop bite within milliseconds. For an IPA, this is a good thing. The upfront malt could be described as slightly fruity. The bitterness is a continuation of the floral hop. Very long aftertaste that is entirely bitter. The richness of the beer is appropriate; I’d describe it as moderate. Carbonation is fine.
Aroma is citrus. Taste is a very well balanced citrusy hop. Overall a very drinkable IPA.

Vom Fass in den Docks in SFO. Orange-goldene Farbe, flacher cremiger Schaum. Intensives Citrus und Aprikosenaroma mut Harziger Note. Toller runder Geschmack. Grapefruit und Malz. Schön bitter im Abgang. Lecker zu Garlic fries!

Rating #1224 07.08.2014 On tap @sugarbowlcafe. Pours a rich golden, small white head, minimal lacing. Aroma is grapefruity, pine, pastry dough. On the palate, similar citrus and pine zest, mild resin, mild pastry dough malt. Medium bodied and extraordinarily balanced. Lots of toasted malt complexity and a great balance of grapefruity, pine hop notes. Superb.

Classic overbearing american ipa. Amazing after one pint sickly after two. Still this one is a little better then the majority. The flavour is more complex then most, and it goes down easy. Drank on tap.

12fl.oz. bottle. Pours a clear amber orange with a large, frothy, long lasting, off-white head that leaves lots of lacing. Hoppy aroma of grapefruit, pine needles, grass and caramel. Sweet flavour of citrus, caramel, pine needles and grass with a dry, bitter, slightly resiny finish. Medium body with an oily texture and soft carbonation. Nice.

Bottle. Tropical nose with lychee mango and some citrus notes. Taste is pineapple, mango lychee leading to a larger like cereal quality, leading to light resin bitterness. It’s more of an American pale than an IPA but is a good way to introduce a lager drinker to new world hops. Bland.
What an aroma. Full of hops, citrus, and light floral notes. Flavor is light, crisp, citrus with a mild carbonated finish. Basic IPA.

Aroma has sweet tropical fruits. Pineapple and papaya. Pours clear amber with a small head that leaves lacing. Taste has heavy bitterness and medium sweetness. Resin and pine from the hops. Medium bodied, average carbonation. Long bitter finish. Overall a bit off balanced beer. Could benefit from little more sweetness. Aroma and taste don’t match.

Yay, a Heineken. Tap at Bar Hop’s new place on St Peter Street in Toronto. Near clear amber, frothy light creamy head. The nose is a mix of resiny and fruity hops... kinda nice, but in no way exciting or stimulating. Flavour’s somewhat jammy, with citric notes. Meh.

Pours clear golden with off white head. Aroma of pine, orange peel, grass, pineapple. Medium bitterness.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Clear orange, thick remaining white foam head, lacing nicely. Strong hoppy aroma, bitter taste, some earthy notes. Bitter aftertaste. (Chicago 201510)

Bottle. Hazy, golden with white head. Aroma of tropical fruits. Medium body, bit sweet with bitter finish

-- rated with beerbasher/winphone
On tap. Pours blonde with white head. Lots of grapefruit, passion fruit, lemon zest. In the mouth is again very fruity, bit pine also. Nice smooth bitterness. Very fresh hop finish. Great beer

Pours a brilliant copper color. Huge carbonation bubbles. About one finger thick off white head head that hangs around. Some decent lacing.

Aroma is hoppy, more than usual. Also all sorts of citrus like grapefruit and maybe lemon zest.

Taste was a shot to the throat with hops bitterness. I was surprised by it, but after the initial shock...It’s quite sweet. Hoppy yes, but not overwhelming. The malts balance the hops. But maybe only slightly hop heavy. I also taste peaches, maybe. Some citrus.

Mouthfeel is medium-light. It’s very smooth, almost silky. It’s dry, but not super dry.

Overall, this is really different for an IPA, but it works. I love the simplicity of the label, and the small print stuff on the label is funny. But absolutely you should try this one. I almost passed it up, but I’m glad I didn’t.
Bottle from Vintage. Poured amber with beige head. Aroma sweet citrus. Light carb med bod. Semisweet juicy taste.

Refrigerated 12 oz. squat bottle poured into a glass. Clear light orange with small off-white head. Aroma is grapefruit hops, medium body, medium carbonation, and a little lacing. Taste is herbal hops, grapefrut hops, and slightly bitter finish.
Âmbar com média formação de espuma. Notas florais e cítricas com leve frutado, o malte da corpo a cerveja. Corpo médio, final longo com agradável amargor
Als je het uitschenkt komt er een heel rijk aroma boven. De kleur is mooi goudgeel. De smaak echter zoals de gemiddelde IPA. Dus niet echt mijn ding

Bottle at The Water House (JDW), Durham, £2.49/335ml. 

Pours mid-amber with a foamy, off-white head and slight visible carbonation. Peach and citrus in a powerful aroma that blasts through the airways like a menthol stick. The flavour opens with a cereal graininess before a big, thick fruit hit. There’s a pleasant, creamy mouthfeel and a short dryness to the finish - a little more would be welcome - but on the whole its a very well balanced beer and worryingly drinkable at 6.2%.

Peaches & pears on the nose. Full tropical fruit (mango, pineapple) hop taste with an earthy bitter finish. A solid US IPA.

Rated by BrewTom

Bottle 35,5cl / Botella 35,5cl.
@ R & J Liquors, Granby, CO, USA
A: Golden / Dorado.
T/S: Hops, citrusy, resinous, slightly malty / Lupulo, citrico, resinoso, ligeramente a malta.
Flaska från SB. Bärnstensfärgad med liten litet vitt skum. Doft: aprikos, citrus,tallbarr och honung. Smak: citrus, grapefrukt, tallbarr, bröd och honung. Tydlig beska.

(Tap) Es hat eine dunkelgelbe Farbe, ist klar filtriert mit einer fast weißen Schaumkrone. Das Aroma ist fruchtig, viel Mandarine und süßlich. Der Geschmack ist fruchtig mit Mandarine und harzig. Der Abgang ist fruchtig-bitter.

I poured a 12oz bottle into a room temperature wet tulip. Beer poured clean 1.5 fingers head. Aromas were faint but there and good. Taste over powered the aromas in an amazing way and I was very pleasantly surprised by the mild hope taste, but powerful fruity flavors.

Beautiful golden pour with thin white head. Visible carbonation. Aroma has a beautiful bouquet of malts and hops. Taste is solid, they use many malts and hops to make it, so, it’s just brilliant. Sweet caramel start and hoppy finish. A beauty!

Pours with in a clear dark amber color with a thin line of white head. Aroma, Hoppy citrus, caramel, malt, pine, pinapple and hay. It’s creamy with flavours of citrus, caramel pinapple and pine with a nice malt overtone and finish.

Lagunitas IPA is brewed with no less than 65 different malt varieties and 43 different hops. Then this becomes virtually impossible to recognize at least one hop or malt. It has a moderate foam and a lovely aroma of light hops notes where especially pine and citrus characterize it. Taste wise it is nothing sweeter than usual American IPA’s and it sounds certainly strange, but I find a malt sweetness with light caramel which also has a very little and mild vanilla. Hop bitterness is gentler than expected, but pine, citrus and slightly exotic fruit together form a hop profile that pleases me very much. I do not think its hop bitterness is quite as bitter as I expected, and it is a positive element in this context. It is a very elegant and tasty IPA offers a great experience.

12 ounces bottle. Gift from trade. Aroma: quite malty. Caramel, citrus, pineapples and a tad piney. App: hazy almost clear copper, medium frothy off white head, great lacing. Taste and palate: medium body, resinous, thick texture, and malted profile, light sweetness, moderate bitter finish. Overall: well made. Too malty for me for an IPA but great palate. Almost smooth. Enjoyed it. Awesome job Heineken... I mean good job Lagunitas.
Very nice beer... Quality IPA. Highly recommended and pleasantly surprised. Great aroma and very good taste.

Poured from a few bottles scored from the back of someone’s fridge who wasn’t using them. Orange side of amber about a fingers worth of white collar. A bit of tropical, some bitter, sticky, overall tasty and very easy drinking. Now that they have put this in a 12-pack and made the price competitive with all the commercial swill out there, and got it into grocery store displays, I can see this being more of a go-to. I’m still partial to their higher alcohol more character offerings, guess they have to make some for the light weights.

Not my favorite from Lagunitas, but this is still a really enjoyable beer. Good, if not great.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
On tap. Pours clear gold, small white head. Aroma of grass, pale malts, lemon zest. Taste of same with a minty herbal undernote. Finish is semi-dry with astringent citrus bitter bite.

Apariencia: De color ambar y aspecto muy limpio, esta coronada por una duradera espuma blanca.
Aroma: Agradable a malta, caramelo, naranja y con algunas notas que recuerdan a pino.
Sabor: Amargor es moderado y muy buen equilibrio, encontramos cítricos, melocotón y caramelo.
So that’s what 43 different hops tastes like! To be fair, not bad at all. Classic American IPA. Plenty of citrusey, piney bitterness with a little exotic fruit to match the sweet malt. Good stuff.
Solid ipa, had it too many times. Got some good aromas and balanced very well. Nothing special though, but nevertheless good beer.

Can’t believe I’ve never reviewed this before..... I’ve drank the shit out of this all summer and in the past. Looks like beer. Aroma is nice but mild, malty aroma, caramel, some pine, finishes with astringent. Taste is way better. Lemon, smooth, good stinging carbonation, bitter lingers. Love this beer it has tons of flavor and so easy to drink.
Pours golden, nice white foam. Aroma is fresh. Grassy and herbal. Taste is also aggressively herbal and grassy, hopped up. Feels quite light and not very alcoholic. Classic sample of West Coast IPA.
Keg at Ox184. Yellow pour, slight haze, white head. Hoppy citrus nose. Medium body, sharpish fizz. Bitter and citrusy. Always good.

Robe blonde et limpide. Mousse peu.
Très résineuse. Zeste d’agrume et pamplemousse. Herbale. Arrière goût de marmelade.
Amertume marquée.
Longue en bouche.
Une très bonne IPA.

Draft at the movie theater. Times are a changing. Lovely Ipa, balanced and does not overstay its welcome. Lively carbonation. Better than the movie.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from ’Spoons so, naturally, its probably 10 years old. Pours an amber colour with a slight head which soon recedes. Aroma is malty and earthy. Taste is earthy, malty, slight spruce, some herbs, caramel and medium bitterness.

IPA konkretne dosadne i bardzo goryczkowe. Przypominialo mi to IPA bardziej w stylu Angielskim niz amerykanskim. Smak gorzki mocno gozki, slodowosc niewielka, pianka takze minimalna, naturalne malo nagazowane. Klarowne. Ale smaczne i tresciwe gorycz doskonale w upalne popoludnie gasila pragnienie. Takie zawsze sobie wyobrazalem dobre IPA, i to wlasnie takie bylo. Polecam
Solid ipa, nose is very impressive with citrus flavors. Flavors come in a little less robust and finish with a woody character.
Bottle. No label taken - Pours gold white head. Nose/taste of citrus, caramel, herbal and bitter hops - medium body.

This is a great, well balanced IPA that is crisp and refreshing. Not overly malty or overly hoppy, as some might complain about with certain IPAs. I am not averse to imperial IPAs or IPAs that are stronger or happier than this one. I’m just saying that I enjoy it as much as my benchmark favorites, which often run quite strong, malty and hoppy. I really like this beer. Perhaps I am not off the charts to the far right of the scale in my preferences anymore. This brew deserves to be very popular, as it is served everywhere these days. It is well crafted and satisfies even a hard nosed, hop-head, high gravity beer snob like me.

Every once in a while, I’ll have that IPA that just hits the spot. Incredibly balanced with 43 different hops, you can pretty much taste the whole variety. Pours dark yellow with a medium head, good lacing. Aroma of citrus, pine, spices. Flavor is smoothly carbonated with plenty of citrus flavors and hop bitterness. If I had to recommend an IPA to a person whose never had one, it would probably be this one, even though it’s more along the bitter side.
Pours golden with small head. Light carbonation with hints of citrus and herbs. Very nice ipa.

Bottle from Fulton Market NYC. Giallo ambrato, quasi dorato limpida. Schiuma beige fine non molto persistente. Aroma non troppo intenso fruttato, citrico, scorza d’arancia e aghi di pino, caramello, malto. Gusto abboccato, piuttosto amaro, senza eccessi, lievemente acidulo. Media carbonatazione, poco corposa, più calda dei sui 6,2 gradi alcolici. Abbastanza rotonda. Piena. Equilibrata ed abbastanza armonica.
Pours clear golde. Nice hop aroma of pine. Taste is also hoppy, pine dominating. As an ipa should be.
Origin: Bottle. Vessel: Tulip Glass. Supplier: WG Grace (Bristol) Zesty and hoppy.

First time in the U.S. - ridiculous at my age - but a good chance to try some great beers in their natural habitat, from the tap. This is good - grapefruit, peach and orange with a solid bitter finish. Medium body, typical IPA look.
ipa di yi ci pin cang zhe zhong feng ge de pi jiu .chu ci pin cang jue de wei dao hen xiang .fei chang xiang .ru kou you dian ku .zhe zheng shi ipa de mei li.wo hai hui duo jia pin cang ci lei pi jiu
Bottle. Pours clear golden with a medium frothy white head. Aroma is sweet and hoppy. Taste is sweet and fruity with more malt than hops. Soft carbonation. Nice easy IPA.
Orange with white head. Resin, green grass and tropical fruit. Sweet, earthy, dank and fruity finish. Overall: nice!

Perfect clear golden-copper color with thin pored foam. The smell is hoppy fruity with sweet notes. The taste is fruity hoppy bitter sweet with a tart finish. This beer combines a lot of tastes. Very nice IPA.
On tap arrived orange with a white head. Aroma of tropical fruits and citrus. taste follows nose.

Poured from the tap into a pint glass at the Carolina Ale Works in Columbia, SC.
The aroma is citrus and pine, very nice.
Appearance is a golden amber color.
Taste is a nice hop blend with citrus as the backdrop. Overall, this is a very good beer. Highly recommended
Bottle @ home. Amber clear color and a medium white head. Aroma and taste of grapefruit, orange and some pine, toffee, caramel. Well balanced. Assertive and lasting bitterness, medium body.
Bottle. Small head with a clear medium body. Unusual mixture of hops and fruitiness. Slightly different but just one of many beers of this type.

Poured from bottle into teku, orange with moderate head, classic IPA aroma, solid taste and body...just a solid, good IPA. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

355ml bottle. Pours golden colour with two finger white frothy head. Strong hoppy, citrusy nose - grapefruit and orange predominantly. Slight smell of pine towards end of nose. Oily yet smooth mouth feel. Upon tasting, initially hit with citrus notes (strong grapefruit yet not so much orange until later into drinking) and maybe slight caramel, which subside to a more bitter piney note. Really lovely stuff. Highly recommend.
Tap. Pours a medium gold with frothy white head. Grassy hop smell. Good malt balanced with floral hops. Very good and drinkable.
Draft in a bar in San Francisco. Nice golden colour with a small White head. I expected more hoppiness from this beer. But nice and well balanced

On tap at Cobb’s Landing, Ft. Pierce. Golden amber color with a white, frothy head with good retention. Nose is rather weak, taste is malt forward with a hint of hop bitterness on the back end. Highly drinkable.
A well-rounded, highly drinkable IPA. Has a richness that mellows out the hops.

A classic modern craft brew IPA. Wonderful nose and rich and balanced hop and malt taste. A wonderful brew! 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On draft. Orange amber hue with nice fluffy white head that leaves a healthy lacing as I drink. Sweet caramel malt flavors with some biscuit and bread also. Hop flavors are a mutt mix as it seems to have a little bit of earthy and herb to the citrus and piney without out one standing out. It is a good beer.
355ml bottle. Clear golden orange color with white head. Hoppy aroma, fruity, citrusy, grapefruit, pine, malty caramel. Sweet and bitter taste. Medium oily body with soft carbonation.
The GOLD STANDARD IPA, HANDS DOWN!........................................there is no question.............there is no doubt............fade out to black.................
Hazy orange color with small white head. Aroma is grapefruity, citrusy, piney. Taste is following that: citrus fruits and pines, the bitter bite is not too harsh. Easily drinkable. Good classic IPA.

Botella . @Señor Lúpulo. Despacho de cervezas, Frikicata Gijón 27/06/2015.
Color ambar, aroma frutal, sabores citricos, futales. 4
Botella de @Masymas, Oviedo . 29/03/2021.
Light amber pour with a fairly non descript bitter aroma. Mainly a bittering IPA with a little passion fruit flavor coming through in a very smooth body. Good!

Finally got around to trying this on tap at Garret 700 yen half and 1100 yen regular. A brilliant copper color with a fruity hop bouquet. Med-light bodied with a soft mouthfeel. The taste is citrusy pine a bit dank with some balancing crackery sweet malts. Very solid.
Bottle at home. I duno, I just couldn’t get enough of the song What time do you call this by Elbow.. Grapefruit, citrus, & piney hops aand more Elbow.

DID YOU NOTISE LAGUNITA’S HOOCH MAKERS DO NOT DO THEY’RE OWN HOPS! TRY THIS IPA OR EVEN THEY’RE DUBEL IPA AND THEN TASTE PLINY (ITS THE PERFECT BEER SEVEN YEARS IN A ROW!) AND YOU NOW THE DIFFERENSE. LAGUNITA’S IPA IS NO HOPPY AND, ITS PROBLY 97 IBU WICH, IS JUST NOT ENOUGH IF YOU PUT IPA (INDIAN PALE ALE) ON THE LABEL. MAKES ME THINK LIKE WATER OR LITE BEER OR SESSHIONS. PLINY (200++ IBU) IS MEANING OF IPA AND SO FAR OTHER BREWERYS DONT GET IT. THEY ARE SCARED OF SPEND TO MUCH $$ ON DO THEY’RE OWN HOPS.

Bottle. Orange malt and grassy orange peel aroma. Golden yellow with moderate head. Sweet orange/lime malt and moderately bitter lime/grapefruit peel flavor. Nice blending and body. I guess it’s a waste of time to say that this is a great IPA and probably the best you can get without a hassle.

330ml bottle. Nose is deep fruit, sweet grapefruit, orange, pineapple and some sappy pine notes. Taste follows but with impressively solid malts entering the equation. Dense syrupy fruits with heavy caramel notes. Great mouth feel, medium to full body. Drying but not crazy bitter finish with sweet fruit lingering on. Great stuff.

I’m a fan of this. Lovely full aromas, initially floral (rose?) followed by citrus and tropical hints, especially passion fruit. 

Medium bodied and carbonation, taste is a good balance between caramel malt, citrus and pine resin. Great dry bitter finish. A classy beer, well put together and on the borderline of sessionable.

Bottle from Marks & Spencer, costing a very reasonable £1.52 after a multi-buy discount. Deep gold in colour, with a thigh, white head and a lot of fizziness. Clean aroma of tangerines, pine and a touch of grassy hop. Flavour had sweetish, biscuity malts, some more citrus fruits, leading to a decent, bitter, finish. Enjoyable.
It has a bit of a pine taste to it......not bad but different.....overall its a good beer but don’t recommend it to beginners. Has a great alcohol content and is great to drink.

330ml @ a Wetherspoon brixham. Phone rating . A good ass hoppy beer . Easy swiller ! There  is an abundance of grapefruit hop texture and caramel accent . Bit of citrusy woody pine in there  ! Good shit .
Flaska@Vaxholms kastell. Grape och ananas dominerar doften. Häftig och påtalig beska som attackerar gommen. Efterlämnar en smak av tropiska frukter i en skön eftersmak.

It pours a dark golden with a white head and plenty of lacing. There are aromas a citrus with a touch of spruce, complimented by a touch of sweet malt. It has citrus flavors with floral compliments and a slight hit of caramel. It has a moderately bitter twang on the palate.
Very nice foamy head not to strong or hoppy. Drinking it on a hit summer afternoon, just hits the spot. Carmel color citrus flavors.
Aroma piney, flowers, grass. Taste -piney resiny, a little grapefruit. Golden pale very clear

On tap at Wipeoout on Pier 39. The pour is a nice coppery gold with a thin film of head that leaves awesome lacing. The aroma is loaded with hops and pine resin. The soft tropical fruits are excellent as they last throughout the entire inhale. The flavor is pretty good. The pine still remains strong, but the tropical fruits and hops kind of fall off in favor of a little bit of a malt presence. The mouth feel is watery with a quick fading carbonation and a real slick finish. The aftertaste is lingeringly bitter, but not as bright as the aroma would lead on. Not bad. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Hard to find a bad beer from these guys. Deep golden pour with sticky white top. Aroma is pine and malt. Flavor is more of the same, with a bit of a bite at the finish that just brings you back for more. Malty, piney goodness, smooth stuff.

Poura a perfectly clear orange body with a fluffy white head. The nose is quite pungent with resin, pine needles, citrus fruit and rapeseed flowers. The taste is quite sweet at first but is quickly pushed away by a hefty bitterness that linfers on the palate. Medium carbonation and rich, sticky palate. A good solid american IPA.
Gold with a lacy thin foamy head; aroma is mild Flava is mild and sweet malt graininess with some hop bitters; feels light silky finishes tangy and mildly bitter and woody/grassy
Drank this straight after a Bengali from Sixpoint. Just as good. Very similar actually, and that’s no bad thing. Lovely. 8.5/10.

Very good better than average IPA. From bottle. Pours orange with white head. Decent head retention. Hoppy but not too much - moderate at best. Does not bite.

Bottle. Clear gold with hefty white, frothy head. Aroma is citrus and pine. Medium carbonation. Taste is fruity and moderately sweet, which nicely balances the bitterness of the hops. Crisp and refreshing without being overly bitter. Very enjoyable.

Draft.
white nice head. golden to yellow.
honey and warm citrus aroma.
medium bitter. Light body. Metallic finnish.
caramel, citrus, alcohol, golden, clear, minimal head, white foam, light sweetness, medium bitterness, medium body, oily feel, soft carbonation, bitter, long finish,

Pours a pale orange with a nice white head. Head retention is good. AROMA: herbal/floral hops, tropical fruit, tangerines, citrus, caramel, sweet hops, orange, passion fruit, spruce, pine bitterness and malt. TASTE: sweet herbal hops, citrus, passion fruit, malt, hop bitterness, orange, orange/tangerines, spices, pink peppercorns, light spruce, yellow grape acid and caramel. Amazing IPA with an abundant amount of complex, pleasant and savory flavors and aromas that’s also readily available. Will definitely enjoy my 6 pack of these brews throughout the next few days.
Bottle pour, half a finger head. Aroma is malty and piney. Flavor is mildly piney with a nice bitter finish.

Pours relatively clear, some particles flowing around. 

Aroma is typical Lagunitas, nice enough hop profile, just to close to their pale ale i feel.

Taste confirms my thoughts. It´s just to little difference between their pale ale and this offering to warrant a "different" beer on the shelf! Want more than new dog pale ale, just get Maximus!

Bottle from SB
Bottle. Pours a clear coppery color. Aroma and taste are citrus and some resin.

Bottle to tumbler. Amber, clear, small head. Weak aroma, fruit barely noticeable although on tap I remember more complex aroma and taste. Fairly drinkable but boring compared to other solid CA IPAs. This one definitely loses something in the bottle.
This has a nice color and a nice initial taste. Then the citrus hits and the bitterness comes on strong. A little off for me, but not bad.

On tap at Beertemple, Amsterdam. Body is clear golden, head is medium, white, rocky, average lasting, excellent lacing. Nose is light tropical fruits, flavor is fruity, orange peel, resin. Medium sweet, light bitter. Finish is medium lasting light hoppy bittersweet. Medium body, thin texture, average carbonation. Easy, refreshing, less hoppy than Lagunitas pale ale, or mixed up in the pub, good though.
