355ml bottle at Arlanda Airport, waiting for a delayed layover flight. Not what I imagined for my #200, but at least it?s a good classic. Pours clear golden yellow, slight hints of orange. Sticky big head. Flower and grass nose. And whoops, while I’m typing this suddenly the delay of the flight is removed and I have to drown this to go board the plane. At least it?s a story, right?

Je crois que j’avais trop d’attentes, ça va m’apprendre ;-( C’est bon mais simpliste (au nez et en bouche). C’est plutôt bien fait et c’est un exemple typique de la côte Ouest.. Un bon mélange des agrumes et de la résine en cette belle journée!

Keg at brewdog bar, Sheffield. Bright golden amber colour with small white head. Aroma is more malty than hoppy, bready and a bit woody. Taste is subtle bitterness with a refreshing moreish aftertaste. Prickly and a bit thin. Very drinkable.
Very nice IPA, clear and pure taste!the appearance not interesting, but aroma recompense it all. Citrus, freshness and so nicely balance bitternes. Very good.
Nice amber color. White head. Hoppy aroma. Bitter taste. Some citrus. Malt and hops. Medium body.
Draft. Bottle. Aroma is a combo of sweet malt and citrus hops. Nice appearance of medium gold with perfect foam. Flavor is crisp hops, caramel and a nice medium body to it.

Initially good, but the taste and palate fall flat after the first couple of sips. Hoppiness is hardly there. This is an IPA, right???

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Easy drinking IPA . Équilibrée et pas trop houblonnée. Parfaite avec un bon plat épicé ou pour boire au soleil. Légère et rafraichissante.
This is a re-rate. I had it on tap.  It pours golden with a white head and lacing.  The aroma is floral and dank hops.  It was crisp and hoppy.  It was refreshing and flavorful.  It is a solid IPA.

On tap @ Euston Tap, London - UK. Color: clear pale blond beer with small carbonation and small white foam. Smell: resin and hoppy. Notes of grass. Taste: hoppy blast with good caramel balance. Notes of hops. Aftertaste: caramel and grassy finish. Resin hops. Bitterness attack.

From the bottle, this pours a flawless appearance of deep copper orange with a foamy long-lasting head, classic IPA. A little more rustic tarnish to it than others perhaps, all the more appetizing. Aroma is strong on citrus hops, strikingly reminiscent of mandarin orange and Pacific forest. On the tongue, this brew comes on as a strong bitter piney and resiny rendition, with a sudden warm caramel maltiness in the finish. Some interesting sweet mango citrus notes on the hoppy side too. Too much bitter resin for me, seems a bit out of balance with the malt. I do love the aroma and appearance, but it's harsher on the palate than others. Probably would pair well with dinner rather than solo. Since the Heineken acquisition its not as bitter as i remember it, I'm not sure whether my palate's shifted or they've toned the bitterness down.
Arrived early at Oakland. Enjoying a popular beer from Pataluma until I depart. Definitely airport prices here. Ouch!! Hope everyone had a good weekend and has a good week. 😊👊👍🏿👊🏿
Pours clear amber with low white head. Aroma of citrus, light resin, mango and apricot. Taste is medium resin bitter with mild fruit sweet finish. Light, oily body with soft carbonation.

33cl bottle. Coppery golden colour with a medium big white head. Aroma is sweet malty with hoppy notes. Some hints of pine and caramel. Flavour is lightly bitter. Malty at first but hops and caramel soon became apparent. Some pine and toffee. Medium long aftertaste.

Tap. Medium ivory head, filigran lace. Chrystal clear amber. Malty and grainy aroma. Bready, hoppy, pine woods, resin. Balanced set of flavours.

-- rated with beerbasher/winphone
Great example of an ipa, full of hop aroma and tastes, and not too much abv.
on tap at J B Dawson’s - VERY good IPA. Nice hop flavor and aroma. Very drinkable - good stuff!

A classic ipa. A lot of pine, heavy on the pine. Lagunitas loves their IPAs and I go back for them

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

A mid golden yellow coloured beer with a frothy white head. A huge hoppy aroma, grassy, piney and pithy citrus fruit. Dry mouthfeel. The taste follows on from the aroma, a mouth puckering bitter hop flavour. Grassy, piney, lime and orange citrus fruit with a dryness in the background that suggests malt. The finish is a lengthy bitter hoppy affair!
Citrus, pine, and some caramel malt in the aroma. Citrus and tropical fruit in a surprisingly light flavor. Flowery hops in the finish. Good, not great.

Medium white frothy head. Clear, yellow-brown. Aroma has orange, pine, soap and plastic.

Taste has pine, bitter hops, citrus, hay and a little malty grain. Strongly hopped. Mouthfeel is ok, just a bit on the watery side. Aftertaste is nice and sturdy. A good IPA.
Poured copper with big white head. Lots of pine and citrus in the aroma. Nice and hoppy in flavour. Citrus, tropical fruits. Nice level of bitterness. Very good ipa

Bottle - good size foamy head, light copper color, very big grapefruit hop aroma and flavor, mild malt backbone, the epitome of a west coast IPA of course, excellent (can't believe I hadn't rated this one before now!) 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Old rating. Pretty good option in IPA world…fairly available. Piney, citrusy, bready body, bitter and dry finish. No offensive, won’t blow any minds

Amber with generous white head. Piney and citrus smell. Taste is very bitter with a generous malt backing to it, with the citrus and pine showing through in the aftertaste. Slightly oily mouthfeel. Solid everyday beer.
355ml bottle. clear golden with a white head. Hoppy aroma of tropical fruit. Tastes fresh hops, tutti frutti and pine. An everyday classic!

12 oz bottle. Appearance is orangish-amber color with medium, off-white head. Aroma is citrus and some pine. Taste is similar with good amount of citrusy hope bitterness moderately balanced but tipping dry with a mild malt sweetness. Palate is medium-bodied, smooth texture, dry finish.
This is a strange and unique IPA I guess. This one may have over done it as it really has too much malt and not enough stand out hop character for me.

Bottle @ Viking line. Citrus like biting one. Fruity, sour, not bad but too sour.

- beerbasher
26.7.2014. Aroma of pine, fruits. Hops. Old notes, obiously not much to say.

Comes out of the tap clear amber with fine-bubbled cream-buff head. Aroma is strongly hoppy, mainly resiny, with malty and citrus undertones. Boldly hoppy flavor is quite evergreen, a little bitter; crisp malty and citrus tones provide support. Texture is fairly firm and lively. Whoa, that many different hops and grains? Adds up to a worthy ale.

12oz pour to pint. Pours a nice golden orange. Head is about two fingers thick quickly dissipates to a thin head with moderate lacing. Smells very danky, citrus, pine and mango scents linger. Tastes much like it smells nice piney/citrus noyes with with a mingle of sweet malty bread. Lingering bitterness extents the hop profile. Very drinkable and great after a hot afternoon. Cheers!

Tap at CBM Jimbocho. Well-balanced nose with hops and malts both present. Palate is really well-balanced. Not super bitter and not overly malty. Just amazing balance. One of the most well-balanced IPAs I’ve had. Really smooth finish for an IPA as well. Solid!
12oz into Lagunitas mason jar. Pours an orange-gold color with a sticky off-white head. Aroma is dank, resinous hops. Taste is crisp, dank hop bitterness.
Excelent ! Hops in a complete armony, flavourfull. With an incredible sensation. It´s makes me want to drink another one, as a few IPAs that aren´t so well balanced.

I think I had this before on draft but this seems different, better, it has a nice nose, hoppy and malty, no bad aftertaste, very good

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

First brewed in 94' and still relevant for a reason. Citrusy and malty with that distinct spring onion characteristic. Malty sweet and biscuity on the palate, hop bitterness is high with some lingering retronasal citrus. Crushable 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

35.5cl bottle at The White House, Scraptoft (JDW) poured into a tulip glass. Small white head which quickly disappears. Clear golden colour with light carbonation. Nice lacing. Aroma of passion fruit and pine. Bitter to the taste - grapefruit, oranges and tropical fruit. Medium hopped. Nice fruity IPA.
(Bottle) A very mediocre ipa. Nothing really stands out here but I could drink it, especially on a hot day.

Draft. This is a popular IPA and I don’t quite understand why, or why I keep agreeing to pitchers of it. Clear golden appearance. Not hoppy or particularly bitter. Somewhat soapy taste. An IPA for people who don’t like IPAs?

Bottle at the Mandalay Bay. Beautiful moderate heavy hop aromas - pine needles, citrus (lime, orange), malty caramel nom nom. Moderately sweet, moderate heavy bitter, oily, average carbonation. Very nice

From 22 oz bottle, cap has a dog that looks like Spuds McKenzie



Aroma: loads of citrus hops, flora hops



Appearance: Amber, clear, tan head



Taste: light sweet, medium bitter



Palate: really nice dry finish, sticky texture, average carbonation



Overall: Really enjoying this IPA. Good price, I think around $3 for 22oz, slightly more than SN Torpedo. Really nice finish. Very nice hop bouquet. Solid IPA.

Pours a golden yellow with an off white head. The smell is citrus, mild pine, light malt sweetness. The taste is light malt sweetness up front followed by citrus and a dry slightly bitter end. Light body with mild carbonation.
Bottle at home from mchughs. Aroma is citrus, spruce, orange, pine. Flavour is big caramel malt, grass with low carbonation bitter finish. Great balance. Nice.

Bottle at The Green Dragon, Leek (JDW) Pours a clear pale amber colour with a fizzy white head. Aroma of big grapefruit, orange, pine, resin, some wood, slight butter and grassy hops. Taste of grapefruit, orange peel, resin, some wood, slight toasted malts, a little caramel and grassy hops. Medium carbonation and a slightly oily texture. A long, dry, grassy hop bitterness in the finish. Packs a really good hop punch at first but then mellows out with a tasty malt sweetness. A well done IPA.
Pours clear dark amber. Small white head. Smell is almost none. Taste is taste is sweet, corny, slightly hoppy ( not enough to be called an ipa to me) . Sweet malty ending. Meh..
Pours an amber from a bottle. A nice floral hoppy nose, rather well-balanced bitter flavor. Good beer.
Poured from 12 fl oz bottle. Clear golden yellow with subtle orange hue and white head. Slight grapefruit, tropical, pine hops with mild funk and subtle caramel malt.
Pours a golden colour. Taste is very hoppy and dry. Too strong and too hoppy for a session. Good beer though

Bottled at St. Mazie’s. Pours a golden pale color, small white creamy head. Aroma is orange, citrus, Floral notes, malt biscuit balance. Flavor is caramel, orange, lemon, really really balanced. Not overly hoppy at all. Not dank. Very fresh. Awesome balance here. Not too much carbonation. Great IPA.
Served on tap at Lucha Cantina in a shaker glass. Good start and finish-the flavor lingers for a bit but it is a delicious IPA, probably my number one go to out and about.
How: Tap Appearance: orange color with a white head. Aroma: Floral, lime, spice, grass. Palate: medium body, smooth carbonation.

Poured from a 12 oz bottle into a tumbler on 05.31.14.

A: 2 finger fluffy white head. See through caramel body.

S: Grapefruit with sweet malt. Also some daffodil.

T: Malt and brown sugar dominate. Spices are subtle.

M: Creamy. Somewhat chewy.

O: This was a strange experience. A Lagunitas beer that is malt forward? Maybe I bought an old bottle. The hops were barely there and only on the back end. There was some bitterness but not much. This did not seem like an IPA. If the bottle was ok, this was a rare miss for Lagunitas. EDIT: Since early 2014, I’ve had more of this and the flavor is the same. It just doesn’t seem to be very hop forward.
Nice IPA I’ve had several times before. Seemed fresh and tropical hoppy. Nicely balanced.
On draft. Amber color with one finger white head. Tropical aroma. Taste is bigger than the aroma. Tropical fruit and some pine. Delicious.
Poured from bottle, pale amber with medium head. Aroma with notes of bread, caramel, pine and some citrus. Taste mildly bitter and somewhat sweet. After taste lingering bitterness.
355ml bottle. pours clear amber with cream coloured head. aroma is pine, dry citrus fruits, hops and grass. quite dry. sharp hops and lots of citrus.

6 week old bottle > a wine glass
A: Clear orange gold. Little head but fair retention and nice lacing. A few bubbles visible. 
S: Citrusy hops but also noticeable caramel malt sweetness. 
T: Citrus and pith, mainly grapefruit quickly followed by biscuit and a slight nuttiness. Well balanced.
M: Light body with a good clean finish. Average carbonation level. Not too fizzy or too flat.  
O: Nicely balanced IPA that's not too strong. Good enough to buy again.
Aroma is a bitch slap of hops. The taste garssy, hoppy and absolutelt perfect. A flower cloud raining life and happiness over you.

Smells of pine and citrus. Tastes of hops and a little malt. Looks like an IPA and has strong lacing against the glass. There is a prevalence of grain in the taste. Good all around, not overly distributed in my area. Was glad to give it a whirl.

Tap @ Bredog Helsinki, thanks bluus. Pours orange with a small, off-white head. Aroma is hoppy piney, light citrus. Taste is grapefruit, citrus, caramel, pine. More caramel. Surprisingly light, good carbonation. Tried in London a couple of years back, much better and fresher there.
Aroma of slightly sweet malt, caramel, tropical fruits, pine, resin, hops. Flavour is moderate sweet with a medium bitter finish. Not a fruity hop-bomb, but a nice IPA regardless.

Drinking cask at the williams ale house in bishopsgate. Mild aroma. Quite fizzy. Quite citrusy. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Rich amber/cider color; Medium body; Aroma of floral/pine hops, & citrus; Flavor of slight sweet malt, pine hops, and citrus (notably grapefruit); Finish is slightly bitter; Good overall.
Copper colour with thin white head. Heavy hop aroma. Caramel and sweet toasted malt up front. Peppery finish.

Had this one on tap. Surprised by its lack of aroma - other lagunitas beers have such a great smell. Having it on tap, perhaps that is why. Tastes very refreshing without knocking your tongue off with hops. Overall I enjoyed this one very much. This would be a good IPA to convert non-craft beer people. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Clear copper color. Bouquet of floral hop aromas. Citrus hop flavor. Very smooth, no bitter bite.
Pours a light copper colour with a nice thick head. Nose is grass and pine hops. Taste is biscuit malt with nice piney bitterness.

Bottle Wetherspoons. Hard to review this as the bottle was straight from the cooler on Hogmanay. As far as I can tell there is lots of grapefruit. My now freezing tongue tells me it’s sweet with a bitter finish and the overall impression afterwards is, bizarrely, Special Brew. Surely not! 
Edit: second bottle - room temp. Totally different, much better - more enjoyable! ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Golden IPA with a strong hoppy flavor and a bit citrus. Heavy carbonation with a lot of lace. The slight bitterness makes this one very enjoyable.
At the recruiting Sergeant in Horstead. Goes into my top 3 of all time. A strong, hoppy, citrusy, solid IPA

A nice golden/orangey color. Aroma is citrus and piney. A nice hoppy flavor. A good IPA.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
3rd rerate and up from a 2.1 to a 3.0 now. It's still a below standard IPA though. Some resinous notes and pithy bitterness. Thin mouthfeel but also has a weird oilyness. Out of balance.

Another very good brew from Lagunitas. One of the best IPAs I have had. Nice deep deep golden color, with a somewhat metallic aroma. Nice hoppy flavor with some bitterness on the aftertaste. A Little Sumpin Sumpin is my favorite from this brewer, but this is pretty good.

Very creamy and smooth IPA. Lots of tropical fruits in the aroma. Some little cheesecake and candied fruits. Moderate bitterness. The beer is all about smooth mouthfeel and a clean aroma. Nothing off or extreme about it. Could be found boring but it’s a perfect IPA for beginners. Well done.

My favorite Lagunitas and the brewery's finest contribution to beer. One of the best pale IPA’s available, IMOP. I was introduced to this beer on tap at a local sports bar. Good out of a bottle, too. But of course, better on tap.

Nice light amber color with medium white head. Hints of pine and mild citrus on nose. Malt is prominent and bready. Very drinkable and refreshing. Surprising amount of variation between bottles in the case - some are pretty great while others are mediocre.

Sampled on draught at the Bull in Highgate. Darkish gold colour with a white head. Aromas of malt and fruity hops. The taste has sweetish malts and very prominent citrus flavours from the hops. There are hints of grapefruit skin, apricot and lime. Not too astringent and with a reasonably dry finish. A really tasty and full-bodied IPA using American hops

12 Oz bottle. Clear copper with a frothy white head leaving decent leaving. Aroma of piney and floral hops, with some apricot notes. Flavor is mild sweet, but piney and resiny hop dominant. Dies away in middle, the leaves a long, resiny hop linger. Medium-light body with a thin mouthfeel and mild carbonation. Overall, some nice aromas and decent flavor at beginning, but then it all kind of falls apart.

Bottle, pours golden with frothy white head, good lacing. Aromas of floral hops, a little pine, light fresh citrus, grapefruit mostly, a little apple perhaps too. Taste is a good balance of lighter bitterness and light sweetness. Body is medium, nice fresh mouthfeel, good carbination. Very tasty.
0,33l bottle. Flying Horse at Gatwick. Golden lovely colour. White head. Wonderful aroma of citrus and hops. Fresh and light with a very good balance of hops and sweetness. Close to the top.

have had this a few times now and never had a pint i haven’t liked nice amber colour little white head. sweet fruit on the aroma with a little pine smell about it. in the taste nice hop kick in the taste and a little bitter on the finish a very nice beer

Floral and lime aroma. Pours amber with a good amount of carbonation and off white head. Nicely balanced hoppy bitterness with some biscuit and grassy notes. Full bodied with some bitterness in the finish.
On tap at Euston Tap, London. Pours orange with white head. Hops, fruit, citrus, sweet with nice hoppy finish.
Hoppige ipa met lekker dik schuim. Bittere lichtzoete smaak die niet te lang blijft hangen. Makkelijk doordrinkbaar en dat voor Lagunitas !

Lagunitas India Pale Ale has a thick, off-white head, very heavy lacing left behind, and a clear, somewhat bubbly, burnished-gold appearance. Aroma is of sweet, white bread, mild, piney hop resin, and a touch of grapefruit rind. Taste is the same, and bitterness seems low, as one would expect from a 1995 recipe. Mouthfeel is medium and a touch slick, and Lagunitas India Pale Ale finishes fairly crisp and definitely easy drinking. RJT
Pours clear amber, small white head (very filtered looking). Aroma is more malt than hop. Taste is similar to other American versions of English IPA. Very drinkable.
On draught a few times. It’s a great ipa, not as hoppy on aroma as others, has a nice bitter finish.

Pours a mid-to-light amber. Nose is a resinous-piney with some malt, very different from the usual cascade-accented west coast IPAs. Sweetness and maltiness nicely balance the hop bitterness. The hop flavor isn’t as complex as the very best IPAs, but this is quibbling. Pleasant bitter finish with no harshness in the aftertaste. This is a terrific IPA. And it’s available in 24-packs at CostCo.
citrus, amber, hazy, light sweetness, very bitter, medium sourness, light body, oily feel, lively,
33 cl bottle, Ann Arbor, MI, USA. Clear gold, sweet honey-pine aroma. Sharp hop flavour, honey sweetness, then a long mellow pepper citrus finish.

O.K. My on -off relationship with Wetherspoons takes another swing:. Having paid £4+ a pint for some fairly ordinary "craft " beer in Newcastle, we called into the Tilley Stone, Gateshead on the way home for a last one, and they sold me a 355ml bottle of this for £2.50p. Now this is not the greatest IPA ever brewed, but it’s certainly up there in the premier league, ticking all the boxes. Robust, a goodly dose of hops proper ABV: Unless ’Spoons have something I’m more curious about, my default drink there from now on. However, I HATE the commercial description and wish terrible things on the sun-kissed Californian bubble-heed what wrote that shite. And yes, I am a cheapskate.

Look: pours a darker golden color. White head. Very clear.
Smell: cat piss, citrus fruit.
Taste: hop forward. Cat piss. Grapefruit, lemons. 
Feel: medium carbonation. Dry, leaves u wanting more on every sip.
Overall: nice ipa. Well done. Makes you want more each time.
First drank: 11/19/14 Sol Bistro Dexatur, IL

Aroma: High hops.fruity, grapefruit pith, Medium-high spicy, Medium, floral, grassy.
Appearance: Body: Clear, gold. Head: Medium, white, good retention. Lacing!
Flavour: Medium-high hops, spicy, Medium floral, fruity. Medium malt, biscuit. Medium-high bitterness. Dry finish with lingering bitterness.
Mouthfeel: Medium body, Medium-low carbonation, creamy. light astringency.
Overall: Wonderfully complex! Amazing beer.

355 ml bottle, poured. Thanks Andre!
14A. English IPA

Bottle at the Crown Rivers, T5, pre US warm up and one I’ve had many times but never got round to rating 07/11/14.
Clear golden orange with a decent off white head that collapses to a swirl and edgeing.
Nose is floral, juicy hops, pine, bitter citrics, grapefruit, straw.
Taste comprises orange pith, pine, floral hop, grapefruit linger, tangy citricana.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close with semi aggressive hop bitterness.
Solid IPA.
355ml bottle, pours clear light golden brown, small white head. Aroma of caramel malts and resiny hop with light citrus notes, floral and spice leading into a long dry bitter finish. Tasty
Good hoppy flavor but falls a little flat on aftertaste. Low carbonation . Good color.

Sample, draught, 4 ounces, during the Bacon and Beer Fest in New York with Luc Bourbonnière, savoured on July 26 2014; eye: amber, tiny sheet of off-white head, no lacing; nose: resinous hops, light fruity, slight malt; mouth: resinous hops, light fruity, slight malt, finale in hops with slight presence of pine, medium-full body, average carbonation, mildly bitter, slightly sweet, barely harsh texture; overall: fine

FRANÇAIS

Échantillon, en fût, 4 onces, durant le Bacon and Beer Fest à New York avec Luc Bourbonnière, savourée le 26 juillet 2014; œil : ambrée, petite couverture de mousse blanc cassé, pas de dentelle; nez : houblon résineux, léger fruité, très léger malt; bouche : houblon résineux, léger fruité, très léger malt, finale en houblon avec très légère présence de pin, corps moyen-corsé, carbonatation moyenne, moyennement amère, très légèrement sucrée, texture à peine râpeuse; en résumé : bien
330 ml bottle . Golden pour with a thin white head. Quick to disperse. Strawberry nose. Astringent citrus strawberry flavour
Clear golden beer with a thin head. Not much aroma, just very light sweet fruit. Flavour is quite mellow too with a bit of sour fruit and hop. It’s not especially exciting but it’s rather drinkable.

22 oz bottle. Aroma: malty, citrusy, and resinous, with hints of bread and barnyard. Taste/Palate: sweet throughout; starts crisp, and finishes creamy with a long bitterness. Not perfect, but pretty damn close.
Poured from a 22. Mouthfeel is very thick and almost syrupy. Has a sweet "everything but the kitchen sink flavor. I could not pick out a distinguishing flavor, it was all just there.

355ml bottle, poured into tulip. A: Golden colour, clear, one finger head morphed into a lid of film. Lots of lacing clung to the side of the glass. S: Mild citrus but bizarrely really strong strawberry ice cream was the dominant flavor. T: Strawberry, molasses, citrus, biscuit. M: Creamy light texture, not overly carbonated. O: The sweetest IPA I’ve tasted, but it was balanced and not cloying.
Import bottle. Nose is grapefruit and vegetables. Bitter with a dry finish.
Bottle from ’Spoons. Golden. Citrus, honeydew melon and a little resin on the nose, dry and juicy malt, well balanced bitterness, bitter yet smooth, very tasty.

Aroma: citrus, hoppy, earthy 
Appearance:translucent yellow color with nice white foam head that is about an inch 
Taste: hoppy, grapefruit, citrus
Palette: bitter at end, light body 
Overall: this is a nice ipa, not too overpowering 



---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Light amber pour with a nice white head. Lots of white lacing. Citrus pine nose - very nice. Solid hoppiness in the taste, while the malt is present it does is certainly in the backseat to the hops and bitterness. A fine IPA.
Bottle. A very good West Coast IPA, lighter than some, but still full of fruity flavours and backed up by a load of bittering hops.

This beer needs to be fresh and is best on tap. It has a west coast pine zest aroma with some maltiness. Flavor follows suit. When fresh this is perfectly balanced straight to the finish but it doesn’t take much age for this beer to begin to take on an unbalanced sweetness
Bottle at a Wetherspoons in Reading. Typical easy drinking US IPA, though this gets the hops balanced just right. Could make for a good session.

Reviewed On: (8/4/14): 


*Glassware: Stemmed Tulip


*Serving: 12 oz


*Aroma: citrus, grapefruit, pine, tangerine


*Appearance: Deep gold with three fingers of off-white head. The head has lots of bubbles. The head slowly receded to a one finger head. There was tons of lace left behind from top to bottom on the glass, after the beer was finished.


*Taste: Pine upfront, sweet malt in the middle, and finishes w/ citrus and grapefruit notes. 


*Palate: Medium body, oily mouthfeel, fizzy carbonation on the tongue. Finishes super dry and bitter.


*Overall: A great and easily affordable IPA that that is my go-to because I can it get it for a good price in my area, especially during summertime. Definitely a great buy for the case.

Tap. Clear golden color with a thin white head. Aroma of sugary malt and some fruits. Sweet taste with some bitterness. Medium thin body.

-- rated with beerbasher/winphone
Very complex flavor. Some fruit tones mixed with a bit of spiciness. It finishes with a touch of bitterness. All and all nice IPA with a moderate ABV level that gives a nice kick.
Great IPA! A must try for all hoppy lovers that love great beer!!! Try it try it!

Appearance: this beer pours with a very large beige head, takes a bit to pour it down, has a very nice density, the beer is a very clear golden color
Aroma: bread, egg, kind of faint,
Taste: citrus, very light grain, bitter, perhaps some alcohol, some malty caramel
Palate: soft carbonation, bitter aftertaste, medium mouthfeel
Overall: not bad but not my favorite ipa by a long shot, needs more from the hops than just bitterness, strong malt background but still bitter

Keg at The Hanging Bat. 
Soft white head, good lacing. Clear amber body. Nose full of tropical fruit, pine and fresh grass. Flavour is bitter grapefruit, light berries, grassy finish. Crisp, fresh. Medium carbonation, good mouthfeel, fairly thick. Dangerously drinkable.

330ml bottle served in an ordinary glass.
A: Pours a clear orange color forming a big creamy, soapy and persistent light yellow head. Tons of soapy lingering lacings are formed and left in the glass. 
S: Strong notes of malts and tropical fruits. Also flowery hints. Grapefruit. Strong notes of tropical fruits: green mango, passion fruit and mellon. Very grassy and herby hops notes: flowery and piny profile. 
T: Slightly sweet upfront. Notes of sweet pale malts, grapefruit, passion fruit and melon. Notes of resin and grass. Good hops bitterness. Balanced. 
M: Medium body, average carbonation. Piny and grassy slightly sweet aftertate. 
O: Great drinkability. Great West Coast IPA. 
[ BA Review @ 12/11/2010 ]

Bottled 355ml. -at Crystal Palace (JDW) Glasgow. Clear amber coloured, small to medium sized off-white head, hops in the nose. Sweetish malty, grapefruity hoppy, light caramel and fruits with notes of grass and passion fruit. Pleasant bitterness in the finish and aftertaste.

Golden color with a 2 finger frothy white head. Nice lace until I rinsed the glass. Aroma of florals and pine with citrus rind. I picked up some malt but it was fleeting. Taste was hoppy with pine and citrus rind and more of the fleeting malt. Good medium thick mouth feel. Pine forest burps... Overall a really nice beer.

Bottle@st Matthews hall, walsall. Amber beer with medium head. Aroma of tropical fruits, pineapple and malts. Taste is grapefruit, moderate amount of pine resin, malts and pineapple. Fizzy and light to medium bodied. Excellent well balanced beer. Imagine this is a fridge filler in spoons!
Bottle. Pour is gold with a frothy head, aroma is fruity, sweet, mango. Taste is fruity, caramel, bitterness towards the final finish. Good beer

pours with a fluffy head and has an aroma with a substantial hop presence, but also some doughy sweetness. average in body. well balanced flavor. dry bittersweet finish. was once my favorite ipa when i was new to the craft beer world. still solid, but not even close to the top."
Bottle from Durham Wetherspoons. Pours amber with a nice big cream head. Starts bitter with pine and tropical fruitiness. Really tasty stuff.
Amber color, off-white head. Grapefruit nose, caramel malt, peach, passion fruit. Tropical fruit taste, grapefruit, resin, caramel malt, moderate bitterness. Medium body, medium to soft carbonation.

Pours a clear orangish copper with a frothy white head. Aroma of sweet pale malts, caramel, pine, citrus, grapefruit, hints of tropical fruits... Alot going in there with that many hops. Flavor is much of the same with a great balance and a nice dry finish... Definitely a go to ipa!
Sweet nose, copper clear pour from bottle. Soapy, sudsy foam. Juicy. Dry, cracker malt finish.
Portti, Turku. Enjoyable IPA at its finest, hoppy and balanced. Grassy aftertaste.
Bottle the cuthbert Brodick Leeds jdw. Golden thin head. Aroma is tropics caramel pine taste same lots of pine bitters. Medium body. Good stuff. Tasty.
Solid IPA with a strong green hoppy character and decent biscuit malt backbone, dry bitter finish. Not really my thing hopwise, but a well done classic brew.
Bottle at the the Plant. Gorgeous head. Lots of life. Floral and dry IPA. Very nice and refreshing.

355ml bottle from JDW the Royal Hop Hole Tewkesbury. Colour is a deep golden yellow with an fizzy and quick to disappear white head. A very slight hoppy aroma, with a nice citrus taste and bitter sweet finish.

Bottle. Copper color with thin thick whit head. Heavy hop aroma. Caramel and sweet toasted malt up front. Peppery finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Lite mindre fruktig och fräsch än andra från Lagunitas. 
God, men inte den bästa från bryggeriet.

Draft at the Chicago brewery, waiting for the tour. Best part of any brewery tour: complimentary product! In the generous taster glass, it shows more orange than the Dogtown I had before this, with a thin head. Aroma is hoppy, but easy to take. What should I have expected but a big, hoppy West Coast taste, solid right up the middle.

Poured from a bottle, clear honey orange. Light and citrusey on the nose. Define orange hit followed with a lite Granny Smith apple finish. If I had to, I’d call it a sunny IPA. Not quote sessionable, but deceptive enough to leave you pleasantly tipsy.
Pint at euston tap, London. Lovely dry IPA, not my favouite IPa as it felt lacking in flavour but certainly good on the hoppyness sie of things

Couple of bottles of this drunk at the Fat Cat, Ipswich. Pours a clear amber/gold colour, with a decent white head. Sweet, moderately hoppy aroma with citrus notes. Some bitterness to finish. OK but expected there to be something more to it.

Bottle at Moon Under Water, Balham Spoons. It pours clear orange with a decent white head. The nose is fresh, juicy orange, tangerine, papaya, marmalade, biscuit and piney resin. The taste is crisp, bitter, piney, resin, toasty, straw, orange and tangerine peel with a dry finish. Medium body and moderate carbonation. Crisp and very drinkable. A classic and great addition to the spoons line-up.

Bottle:
Pours clear amber with a tall beige head.
Scent is citrus, orange-peel.
Taste is orange-peel, resiny hops.
Pretty good sweet vs. bitter going on...although the hops get a little heavy and murky towards the finish.

Poured a 12oz brown bottle into Spieglau IPA glass. It poured a clear light orange amber colour with white foam, lasting with lace. Powerful American hoppy aroma: grapefruit, pine cones, spruce tips, blackcurrant fruit, honey, grass, weeds. Flavour wasn’t as bitter as expected, some mild caramelly malt sweetness underneath, loads of hoppy flavour to match aromas. Lingering citrusy aftertaste, tangy but not puckering. Body and mouthfeel a bit bland, but it works to spotlight the hops. Tasty and refreshing, similar to countless other A-IPAs but well-crafted nonetheless.

Poured from a bottle. Nice frothy head that dissipates quickly, but leaves a decent lacing around the glass. Slightly dark golden clear color. Aroma is grassy, piney, and hops. Smooth, almost creamy going down, some citrus in the back of the tongue. Good refreshing beer, my first from this company.

On Draught

Pours a pale golden color with a good head and good lacing on the glass.



The aroma holds a nice grapefruit character with some dank hops and a little pine. It’s grassy, it’s aromatic, it’s totally focused around hops, and a multidimensional presentation of hop character. 



The flavor is piney with some melon and peppery notes. It’s fairly dry and as it warms the flavor moves into more of a grass and grapefruit thing. Either way it’s a very nice presentation of fresh happiness. 



Cool that it’s around here these days.

Draft @ SJC Marriott. Hoppy, citrus aroma. Nice clear golden color with lingering white head. Wonderful flavor of citrus & malt. Perfect body, med to full. Easy drinking beer, not to filling to drink.
Pale amber with white lacing head. Aroma of pine and citrus. Complex flavor, a little sweetness, more citrus, and a mildly bitter finish.

Keg at Euston Tap, Euston. Clear gold with some head & lacing. Massive carbonation. Complex aroma of lemon peel, pine, caramelised vanilla, spruce. Intense bittersweet taste tempered by an herby/umami note. Sweetness in the finish, with a slightly medicinal bittersweet finish. The carbonation supports the medium body. A lovely classic IPA. Aromatic rather than bitter-as-hell, this is a proper US beer!

355 ml bottle shared. Golden yellow color, clear, white head on top. Aromas of pine, lemon, some honey notes. Taste is pretty nice, bitter, with citrus and pine at first, some lemon, some orange, honey and caramel backing up. Light to medium body with medium carbonation.

Crystal clear deep golden color. 
Aroma tropical flowers, pine, resin. Classic west coast IPA. On top of a slight cracker bread crust. Med mouth feel. Bright C hops orange peel, dank resinous tropical grapefruit overtop a thin sweet malt base. Finishes dry with slight furry tongue.

Aroma: resin, flowers. Appearance: dark gold, small creamy white head. Taste: medium bitter. Palate: quite bitter, resin, flowers. Overall: nice IPA, great hops in aroma and palate. Pint at 28 West, Canary Wharf.
Goûtée un soir au coin du feu dans Yosemite. Bref, une bonne manière de la déguster. Couleur ambrée, belle mousse. Une IPA assez bien équilibrée, pas trop houblonnée et assez rafraîchissante.

Transfer from BA review on 4-2-13-

 Poured from bottle into a pint glass

 Appearance – The beer pours a hazy golden amber color with a one finger white head. The head has a moderate level of retention, fading over time to give a good level of lace on the sides of the glass.

 Smell – The aroma is big and bold of the citrus hop smells. A large grapefruit hop smell is the heaviest and is mixed with some orange and lemon smells. Mixed with these are some smells of tropical fruits of mango and pineapple as well as smells of a bready and malty nature. 

 Taste – The taste begins with a moderately malty and bready flavor mixed with a good dose of grapefruit hop. Upfront there is a decent caramel sweetness mixed with the hop and malt. As the taste advances the grapefruit hop bitters more in nature as some of the caramel gets lighter and the grapefruit gets a bit more intense. Toward the end some piney hop flavors bring another hop dimension to the beer and mix with a lighter tropical fruit flavor of mango and pineapple as well as the stronger grapefruit and bready flavors to leave a nice bitter but not overly bitter flavor on the tongue.

 Mouthfeel – The body of the beer is on the average to just above average side in terms of its creaminess and thickness with a carbonation level that is a bit on the lower to average side. Both the slightly thicker body and slightly lower carbonation suit the hop flavors well, but still allow the sweeter flavors to be detected and help balance out the malty and hoppy flavors.

 Overall – A tasty IPA that is fairly easy drinking without any one aspect being too overpowering producing a fairly well balanced brew.
Pours a nice golden color with 2 finger white head. Aroma of citrus and pine. Flavor matches aroma with a bit of a semi-sweet finish. Big bold citrus and pine notes
On tap at the Marquis of Granby, Epsom. Pours golden with a white head. Pine aroma. Malty taste. Bitter sweet finish. Distinctly average IPA.
a nice well balanced ipa. on tap somewhere in santa Monica. slightly sweet with a bitter finish.

Aside from having dozens of different hops and dozens of different malts, it’s a good drinking IPA. Clean aroma of grapefruit and citrus. Some mild sweetness. Flavor follows with grapefruit on top and citrus. There’s some sweet finish but not a ton. It’s pretty nice drinking.

Draft to pint glass
I can’t believe that I’ve never waited this before. As I was sitting in a bar having one I decided to check rate beer and realize there was no rating. Citrus. Spruce, hops, and some caramel. Clear light amber with a thin off white head, but moderate lacing. Light pepper, pine, spruce, some grains, and caramel. Classic IPA.

I can't believe I've never rated this given how many times I've had it! Amber color with thin cream colored head. Aroma has a bit of caramel malt and a good dose of floral and citrus hop notes. Flavor is similar with some biscuity and caramel malt flavors up front followed by a nice balance of hops. Medium bodied, lightly astringent. Not the hoppiest IPA by any means, but great flavor and extremely sessionable.

Hana @ The Flying Dog, Tukholma. Kaatuu lasiin kullankeltaisena ja aivan hieman sameana, tiivillä vaahtomatolla. Tuoksussa on paljon trooppista hedelmää ja karamellia, vähemmän havua ja makeampaa sitrusta. Maussa vahvimpana on taas havuisuus, kevyemmin löytyy hedelmää, karamellia ja marjaisuuttakin, mutta melko vähän. Suutuntuma on kuiva ja katkero puraisee todella kivasti. Samalla löytyy hyvin täyteläisyyttä. Kuiva, katkera ja havuinen palketti, malliesimerkki hyvästä IPAsta. Hieman enemmän hedelmää , niin tämä olisi ihan täydellinen.
Orangegelbes Bier mit schöner Schaumkrone. Geruch intensiv hopfig, fruchtig, sehr malzig, Grapefruit. Geschmack sehr fruchtig hopfig, tropische Früchte, kräftig malzig, spritzig und süffig.
Draft. Clear golden color, scant white head. Aroma of grass and light citrus. Nice balance, but a bit plain.

Tap pour - golden with a small white head. Aroma is very nice and enticing - loads of tropical, fruity hops, hint of caramelized malt, mild breadiness...some pine in there as well - good stuff! Flavor is very good as well - good hop bitterness without being overwhelming - tropical hops dominate, but there is a good piney/forest note as well. Enough malt backbone for a ’single’ IPA to add some balance - I really dug this stuff! Palate is oily and smooth. Lagunitas does it right with this simple, yet delicious (and relatively cheap) IPA - Prosit!
Bottle. Pours a mid brown colour with thick white head, hoppy and malty aroma, taste is light and bitter with a short dry finish.

12 oz bottle, served from same on Fox Lake, IL. Aroma is mild bready hop bitterness with slight metallic oxidation. Flavor is same with moderate carbonation and medium body. Bread yeast finish, not one of Lagunitas’ better offerings.

Bottle. Pale gold with off white head. Smell is caramel, nuts, cereal, resin, grass, citrus, clove. Taste is sweet caramel and nuts, floral grassiness, citrus, and finishes slightly bitter and slightly astringent. Medium body, slightly sticky, soft carbonation. Very well balanced IPA.

From a bottle. Pours golden with a thin head. Nice aromas of resiny hops and sweet malt.  Nice hope bite that counters the fruitiness of the malt. Not overly sweet. Dry finish. Medium mouthfeel. This is a crisp IPA balanced very nicely--not syrupy...not a hop bomb....just right. Delicious.

Bottle. Glowing orange. Sweet candied citrus aroma. The taste adds candied tangerine and orange with bitter grapefruit on the finish. Just enough malt to add a touch of caramel/ bread but the juicy sugary fruits really shine on this one. A bit sticky mouthfeel with high carb. Love this. Lagunitas knows hops! 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap. Golden color with a white head. Fruity, citrus and pine aroma. Flavor starts a dry caramel malt with some fruitiness followed by some citrus flavors and finishining with a resiny pine hop bitterness. Solid IPA. Drank this one on IPA day.

Bouteille 355ml. Couleur cuivrée translucide, mousse blanche aérée. Arôme de pomélo, houblon vert, touche de lime, malt subtil. Goût d’agrumes, malt, côté végétal, sucré léger, amertume légère, moins intense qu’au nez. Carbonatation faible, corps moyen-faible.

Draught@Pappa Grappa, Norrköping. Clear golden, thick white head, tropical fruity, hoppy, mango, grape, you name it. Flavor has tropical fruits, citrus, grape, mango, hint ofsweetness anda loong citrusy hoppy finish. Fresh, awesome IPA. Could drink this allday. Maybe it is the nice weather but just now this is the best beer in the world.
12 FL OZ ($4.00) had at a local bar. pretty good IPA and glad to see that the bar is finally stocking quality beers.

355 ml bottle at Harry’s, Halmstad, on May 4, 2014. From backlog.
Clear golden color, big fluffy lasting white head, leaves plenty of lacing on the glass. Sweet, malty, green, hoppy, forrest mushrooms, slight bit of raw onions scent. Sweet, sugary, malty, bitter, hoppy, wort, citrus taste. Citrus aftertaste. Smooth mouthfeel, medium high bitterness. Dry, bitter finish.

On tap in the Euston Tap. Golden colour. Big initial sweet boozy feel. Hoppy, obviously, some spruce, some sweet citrus. Malty sweetness too. Medium bitter finish. Don’t really know what to do with this beer. Too gassy and sweet (not to mention strong) for drinking by the pint, a bit cloying actually. Maybe I just prefer a more overtly bitter and moreish beer.

Sampled again in the bottle in the US. Definitely didn’t have the syrupy sweetness I felt last time. I guess by now this is kind of a classic IPA and so obviously tastes like a lot of other (copycat) products - decent balance, fruity hops. Is nice.

Yes it does, it does float my boat. Lustrous golden amber in colour with a ski of bright white head. The aromas dwell on the resinous with spruce cones, conifer gum and herbal grassiness along with some dessert pastry. The flavour is a carbon copy of the aroma with a good muscular twinge of hoppy spruce driven bitterness. An archetypal West Coast IPA.

On tap at The Saddle Range in Costa Mesa, Orange County on 12th July 2014. A very easy drinking and pleasant IPA: plenty going on within the brew, mild citrus front in both the aroma and taste to this hoppy beer. Thin white head on a body that was almost orange in colour. Refreshing and although hoppier than the IPA’s I drink in the UK I enjoyed it.

Copper-yellow color with a white head. Aroma is mildly-dank grass, floral. Taste is tropical fruit and that mildly-dank grass with citrus and pine hops that aren’t strong for an IPA, and a balancing malt sweetness. Like most Lagunitas brews, this is unique compared to other IPAs, and I like it quite a bit.

Crisp copper gold color with a little head from tap. Fresh hoppy aroma. Medium thick with some bouncy carbonation that fizzles after the after taste. Hoppy forward taste with a hint of that soapiness I get in a lot of lagunitas but its less intense than most of their beers. This is probably my favorite of theirs.
Keg at holyrood 9a. Pours copper amber, light fruit, bitterness, cold, bit lacking in flavour.

650ml bottle at home. Clear golden with a medium to full white soapy head. Medium body with moderate carbonation. Well balanced bitter- and sweetness. Citrus, pine, grapefruit, spices and malts. A very smooth, refreshing and tasty IPA.

Medium bodied yellow beer with huge white head. Aroma of hops is quite restraint, almost some English notes in there. Quite bitter and bread. Slightly cardboardish, so I am afraid this is quite old...
355 ml bottle - Pours an orange gold but no head and no carbonation. Incredibly hoppy taste and aroma.

12oz bottle. Pours a clear, golden yellow with a one finger, off white head that laces well. Aroma has big notes pine, resin, citrus, and tropical fruit. Taste is bitter but well done. Pine and resin with some citrus, caramel, bread, and a drawn out, bitter aftertaste. Medium body and carbonation. Clean in the mouth with a big, dry finish. Overall a really nice IPA. Great, balanced flavours with a very drinkable mouth feel.
Bottle. Pours copper color with beige head. Nose is citrus and pine. Taste is toasted malt and resin. Very little in the aftertaste.

Pour is golden brown with light white foamy head. This IPA is lightly bitter and straight up hop juice, although it is not a mad hopper. It has a decent bitter finish with sweet malts in the middle. Aroma is what you would expect from an IPA.

Flaska från craftbeer.se
Klar bärnsten med ett lågt vitt skum. 
Bra doft av gräs, grape och barrskog. Något pepprig också. 
Kraftig smak direkt av citrus som översköljs av en mkt fin beska. 
Något åt det rökiga hållet finns där också vilket balanserar upp citrusen. 
Fin IPA!


---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
grass, herbs, golden, clear, white foam, light sweetness, medium bitterness, lightly sour, medium body, thin feel, average carbonation, bitter

Appearance is light golden, standard pale ale look. Aroma is hoppy but not dank, fairly clean but definitely got that American sweetness in the nose. Taste is good, nice and hoppy but nothing too powerful, bitterness is there and about the right amount which is nice. There a is a touch of sweetness but not as much as the nose would suggest . Mouth feel is just right for a pale ale and finish is good and clean. Good beer overall, just not sure about the sugars in the aroma.
tasting-decent ipa, most noteworthy part-citrus variations from strong to sweet, worth a try.

Bottle. Pours clear medium amber, foamy white head. Hops with slight grapefruit and or pine aroma. Not the typical IPA bitterness, actually a little soft. IPAs aren't my favorite but this one I like. IBU 45.6

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Amber color with about a finger of white head that leaves some lacing. Aroma is citrus hops. Flavor is citrus hops and sweet malts.

Draft. Clear amber with a good frothy head. Fruity. Juicy. Loads of citrus. Maybe a little Floral. Moderate bitter that doesn’t overly linger. Hops are showcased but enough malt backing to keep a really Nice balance overall. Pink grapefruit. Mango. Peach. Tangerines. Pineapple. Really liked this. Super good.

Bottle from Petaluma Market. Golden brown, lively looking beer. Aroma is of peach, pine and some honey. Taste is medium bitter for an IPA, tropical fruits hit the senses pretty quickly. It’s tasty, it’s pretty smooth but it’s not a world beater. Tasty stuff nevertheless and pretty refreshing.

Bottle. Pours a clear amber with minimal head and average lacing. Aroma is typical IPA with citrus and pine notes. Flavor is not as pronounced as the aroma. A little spice, honey, citrus, and pine. Very smooth and drinkable. Good but not great.
Mild citrus, mango, pineapple, some grapefruit. Taste is very balanced and mellowed out, no prominent maltbody whatsoever. Straight up hop juice, not very bitter.

Bedankt broertje! Helder oranje-amberkleurig bier met vlokjes gist en wie kraag. Geweldige geur van lychee en meloen. Smaakt ook erg goed, heerlijk fruitig en mooi bitter. Goede body en carbo. Top IPA!
the lightly bitter start breaks off into a fairly alcoholic taste. It has strong pine flavor.  It’s not really bad, but I wouldn’t get it again.
Amber pour with a white head. Aromas of citrus hops all the way. Grapefruit, mango, orange, etc. Flavor is hoppy upfront but balanced by a nice malt presence in the finish. Solid offering.

Crisp, refreshing, and hoppy. Pours crystal clear amber. citrus and grapefruit aroma. Sweet but simple malt, with hops prominently featured from start to finish. Very dry, very clean. This is a solid IPA

A dark yellow beer with a medium and blond head. The nose is full of fructose and tropical fruits, peaches and mangos, some mandarin, fresh even the sweetness. Taste isn’t so fruitfull than aroma, peaches and citrusfruits. Lots of pine needles that are drying the taste together with medium bitterness and the aftertaste is piney. Medium bodied, fresh and light to drink despites of bitterness. Balanced and easy IPA.

Lagunitas IPA readily deploys several hop varieties but at just over 50 IBU’s it may not be the hop bomb you’re expecting. In fact, this ale is fairly reserved for an offering from Lagunitas. That’s not to say that this IPA is a lightweight, though. Not by any means. IPA offers a whole lot of grassy, earthy, spicy, peppery tones. On the fruit spectrum, you can expect lemon, berry, and (no surprise) grapefruit. I should add that the malt backbone is fairly strong, too - it imparts a nice, subtle biscuit flavor. In all, I was pleasantly surprised to find this IPA to be more complex than bitter. While it’s not as brisk as some of the other West Coast hoppy ales that I love so much, the freshness is fantastic and there’s always a new flavor to discover. Once again, Lagunitas does things right.

Pours a clear straw gold with three fingers of fluffy head on a moderately aggressive pour, good retention and moderate sticky lacing. Nose is light - pine and floral hop, and sweet malt in the background. Taste is pleasantly bitter up front, followed by sweet malt. Mouth feel tends to the light, with light sustained carbonation.

Decent IPA without the emphatic presence of their higher ABV products like Maximus, Little Sumpin, or Hop Stoopid, but still possessing sufficent hops to keep me interested. Fairly sessionable, actually, with a decent bitter finish.

Bottle. 

A: Light copper color with a white foamy head. Good lacing. 

N: Leaves and grass, pine, earth, citrus - mostly grapefruit.

T: Good bitterness, some crackery malt. 

M: Medium body, slight resins. Very dry. 

O: The dudes at Lagunitas know what they’re doing with the hops. While I much prefer Little Sumpin’ Sumpin in the IPA category, this is a pleasing sit-down beer.

(Draught at Wirströms Pub, Stockholm). Scent of lightly overripe, slightly stale, tropical fruits, flowers and sweet raisins. Taste of sweet tropical fruit, pine and citrus, dry bitterness in the finish. (Bottle). 737313

Bottle at the bowling stadium in Reno. Nose light pine, floral hop, and some sweet malt. Taste nice bitter up front, Sweet malt and good hop character. Later mid palate malt backbone. Pleasing all around.
On-tap at the local BWW. This pours a clear, golden amber color with a big foamy head. The aroma is bitter with hops. The taste is smooth, well-balanced and still nicely bitter.

Bona cervesa molt equilibrada i gustosa.
Buena cerveza muy equilibrada y sabrosa.

This beer has a perfect taste. Ive tried other beers from Lagunitas and this is perfectly balanced. Maximus is too sweet and you taste too much of the alcohol on the back end. lil sumpin sumpin doesnt have enough hop flavor its too smooth which some people love but I like tasting some bitterness. So this is perfect. LOVE THIS BEER !

12 ounce bottle. Bright copper color topped by a big bubbly beige head. Fresh citrusy pine hop nose. A hint of red pepper, as well. Tangy toasted malt upfront, with a peppery, resiny hop bitterness coming in the mid taste. Slightly funky, leathery bitter finish. Complex and flavorful, with a long dry aftertaste.
Pours a clear copper color. Thin white head with plenty of lacing. Dank basement aroma. Thin, crisp and slight copper notes.

From notes. Windfall, Manhattan 6-7-14. Pours light golden, nice head, nice lacing. Aroma light pine. Taste is very balanced sweet light malts, complex hop bitterness. Light body, a little slick, moderate carbonation. Finishes light citrus and earthy. Decent IPA.

Pours a golden honey yellow with an effervescent bright white head. Almost zero aroma. Lovely citrus palate. Refreshing. A somewhat sweet after taste. Nice. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours a nice clear golden color with white head. Pine, citrus, and more west coast style IPA notes, grass and some floral on the nose; follows onto the palate. Finishes with more citrus and pine.

Bottle at a party in NW D.C. 

The beer has a pale copper body with an inch of white head. Aromas of hops, a touch of citrus (grapefruit, orange), cracker. Hop forward with moderate bitterness mid to late palate. Light in body with a bit of stickiness on the palate. Simple and straightforward. Not one of the better hop offerings I have had from Lagunitas (fresh Little Sumpin’ Sumpin’ and Sucks are both delicious). Sometimes you eat the bar, sometimes the bar eats you...

Hazy orange pour with off white head. Smells slightly of pine. I love this IPA.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Slight touch of pine to nose and taste. Not an overwhelming hop profile, but enough to keep you interested. Solid IPA, pretty sessionable.

Strong nose of sweet onion, grass, very earthy. Poured in 16oz draft a light amber color and lasting medium white head. Medium carbonation with flavors of pine, resin, with a slight citrus finish . Smooth finish with a medium hopped profile.
Mild aroma of floral notes and bitter taste. Mild lacing and flavor. This is a nice beer to start with and is more a session beer than a memorable one.

På fat @ Ölrepubliken. Orange vätska med medelstort vitt skum. Dofter och smaker av tropisk frukt, karamell och kåda. Oljig munkänsla. En stabil IPA. God, men inget som sticker ut åt vare sig det ena eller andra hållet. Stabil som sagt.
Burnt orange pour, white head. Very floral nose, cannabis, some biscuit. Taste is citrusy hops, biscuit, pine. Oily smooth body with a crisp bitter finish.

Good memories of this beer because it was the first IPA I put my teeth into. When I first drank it I gave it an extremely high rating. Now that I’ve drunk it for the second time the rating is a bit lower. A very good and easy to drink IPA nevertheless.

Didn't like as much as the rating. Smooth with as light bitter after taste. Would drink again but wouldn't be in my top 10...

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle in Chicago-- Pours clear golden with medium white head. Nose is biscuit and tropical fruits. Aromas are exotic fruits, lychees, piney hops, some burnt caramel and citrus. Medium carbonation, foamy texture. Long bitter and resinous finish. Great IPA!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Keg at the Euston Tap, London. Hazy copper shade with short white head. Aroma is mostly pointing towards the piney and leafy end of the hop spectrum. Strong bitterness to the taste. Tastes like a classic IPA but I prefer mine with some fruitier hop character.
Very solid IPA. Flavor is a bit off from what I am used to but a nice range of hops hit the palate.
Draft, golden orange in appearance. Fresh juicy hops in the aroma. Taste is citrus hops with nice balance. Solid brew.
Tap at mcgillicudys. Tall rocky white head. Mangoes and tropical fruit in the nose. Taste is hop fruity with a malty undertone. Golden amber in color. Finishes long leaving a sting of hops.

Draught at the Euston Tap, London on 2 May. Poured a clear, deep golden with a dense white head. Somewhat malty aroma, notes of caramel and tinned fruit and some spruce hop. Citrus hop flavours, mixed biscuity malt and apricot. Finish was smooth bitterness, very nice balance between tart citrus, bitter resin and toffee sweetness. Just a very good by the numbers IPA.
355ml bottle - really looked forward to trying this but just didn’t set the world on fire. It was nice

Poured from a 12oz bottle 

Aroma - Nice piney aroma, very inviting.

Appearace - half a finger of foamy head with lots of bubbles coming up from the bottom.

Taste - The taste is good, but may not live up to the aroma.

Palate - Very light mouth feel, very carbonated.

Overall - Not too bad, I think there are a few other IPA’s I would put in front of it though.

Une IPA que j’ai croisée souvent. Cette fois-ci, je peux la boire en fût au Tap42 de Fort Lauderdale. Ma pinte arrive blonde. Le col mousseux est beau. La dentelle laissée témoigne de sa générosité. Les arômes sont bien typés mais délicats avec des conifères, du pamplemousse et des herbes. Les saveurs sont bien fraîches mais timides avec des houblons aromatiques et amérisants qui se frottent à des céréales qui m’apparaissent légèrement mielleuses. La bouche montre un corps moyen avec un pétillement modéré à bas et une texture huileuse. La finale est amère mais facile. Le Tap42 est un resto-pub très bruyant qui contrôle admirablement bien la température de ses pompes.

On tap poured into an imperial pint glass. Pleasing aromas of citrus (mostly grapefruit), pine, biscuit, and toast hit the nose from this one. It pours a clear copper gold with a soft, whipped, off-white head that leaves lots of lace and retains well throughout the drink. There’s a nice abundant head left by the end with only a small break in it’s surface. It’s medium high bitterness is complimented by a medium citrus and malt sweetness. The creamy texture is supported by lots of soft carbonation, and the medium full body finishes with a complex, yet smooth combination of citrus peel, grass and/or pine, and a fruit juice-like quality with an overall dry, crisp, chalky feel. The chalk lingers in the aftertaste with some toast and dry citrus peel.
Lagunita's IPA bottle poured into pint glass. Good beer strong IPA taste. A beer that is very enjoyable a good buy.
Cask at The Flying Pig in East Dulwich. Piney hops, some fruit and a sweet finish. Really enjoyable beer.

Bottle at Cioppino’s, San Francisco, and draft at SFO International. Hazy orange, lots of white head. Grass, hop, some pine, hint of malt flavour. Some bitterness, but closer to pale ale amount than an india pale ale. Medium body and below average carbonation. A good session IPA, but not the one I would go to if I wanted a "standard" IPA.
Nice hoppy citrus session IPA. Pours orange with good head and lacing. Medium bitter finish with a nice dose of malt. Soft carbonation. On tap at American Ice.
amazing taste. Hoppy, grassy. One of the best IPA’s out there. Wish they would export to Germany
At BBF. Goldem-amber colour with white head. Hoppy, grass and malt aroma. Caramel and malt taste, also hoppy and grassy. Medium body.
Light orange color with decent lacing. Malts seem to dominate the aroma. Lemon flavors that really don't seem to finish.
330 ml bottle. Clear copper with white head. Smell is bitter hops some citrus and grapefruit. Taste is medium bitter some citrus and some flowers. Good.
Poměrně dobrá a výrazná IPA. Trochu méně hořká, než většina evropských, ale jinak chuť, barva, pěna atd. super. Příjemné překvapení. Lahváč v San Franciscu.

For some strange reason this is the first time I’ve ever had this beer. I love Lagunitas for their west coast style IPAs and was expecting their flagship IPA to be of the same quality. This is definitely good, but it’s missing the bright, popping citrus and tropical flavors I’ve come to know this brewery by. Definitely more malty than I am used to, but good in it’s own way, and has a nice hop presence in the background and mild bitterness in the after taste.
From tap @ BBF 2014. Pours clear orange with a moderate white head, good lacing. Fresh aroma, tropical fruits, sweet, light herbal. Flavor is moderate bitter, hoppy, tropical fruits, light apple (?)
Avg IPA, not bad, not great. I usually see Maximus next to it in the cooler for the same price, so choosing this over Maximus is not wise.
Pours a clear golden color with a tame aroma. Hoppy and fruity but just and average IPA.
Bue à la pression. Blond doré, CO2 bien présent. Légère dans son ensemble, houblon plutôt discret. Correct.

.5l on tap @ Vihreä Haltiatar 
Pours clear golden with medium high, stiff head. Aroma is hops, fruits, malts, exotic fruits. Some berries. Flavor is hops, malts, herbs, brown sugar notes. Odd side taste. Something like plastic.
Noting impressive about this one. My experience was that it was rather flat right through. This is not a stand-out IPA.

Bottle at Källarkrogen. Clear yellow with a white head, nice lacings. Aroma medium malty (caramel), heavy hoppy (citrusy, piney). Flavor medium sweet, heavy bitter, light spicy. Medium+ body.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Had on tap at Wayside in Biltmore. Totally solid IPA. Pours just on the orange side of the pale/ipa spectrum with a decent head. Not overly carbonated. Taste is reminiscent of all the good west coast IPA’s in terms of malt and hop profile- pine, resin, citrus, grapefruit.....blah, blah. Well balanced and not too dry on the finish. Just a totally solid IPA. Nothing spectacular but accomplishes what it set out to be in spades- a very enjoyable, sessionable, not-lacking-in-the-flavor department IPA. 
11/12  On tap at MOJO in Asheville.   Really good-again.  Just finishes ever-so-slightly more bitter than I want to be a 4.   Hypercritical? Perhaps, but it is Lagunitas after all.
Very sweet on the aroma and cloying on the palate. Did not taste right at all for style like a sweet Belgian vs an ipa.

Reviewed from notes.
The appearance was a red/golden body that yields a half finger white head that lasts for about thirty seconds. No carbonation is seen rising. Some spotty light foamy lacing is seen trickling around the sides of the glass.
The smell had some malts in front of the hops and comes out very strong. There is some caramel that comes out as the beer warms.
The taste was pretty much the same with a nice added sweetness, very much impressed.
On the palate, it sat about at a medium, sessionable, balanced wet/dry aftertaste and finish.
Overall, this is a good IPA, however, with the malts coming out as strong as they do.

A- Pours a tangerine color with a thin, fizzy head that fades fairly quickly.

S- Lots of in your face, grapefruity hops, floral notes, very sweet smelling.

T- Very bready and grainy with light fruit notes and a deep grapefruity hop character with slight bitterness towards the finish.

M- Medium viscosity with quite a bit of carbonation.

D- This is a fairly drinkable IPA but just does not seem to be balanced. The hops just don’t meld well enough with the sweet, lightly fruity malt.
(bottle) bright yellow amber colour with a small white head; aroma of citrus, hint of honey; balanced flavour with a long medium bitter finish

12oz bottle into Le Duvel - nose is cat urine that has settled in carpet for a while. Sweeter than I expect for an IPA. OK, it’s a little hoppier that it is sweet but still... I don’t believe the hype.

on draft and poured a amber yellow color with nice white head. plenty of lacing on the glass. the aroma was very nice and almost mild. the malts and more predominately the hops. the flavor was very good. has that mildness in the malts with the hops on top and blended nicely. nothing bad about this one. now that they are in the area will get more.
Top shelf IPA, had it at the Brewery, get it every chance I get. Perfect example of a West Coast IPA. Great bitterness, light malt, nice aroma when it’s fresh.
On tap at Hopcat E.L. Nice ipa, I would say middle of the road. Not the best, not the worst. Would try again.
Pours an amber yellow color with a white head. Aroma of pine, grapefruit, and hops. Flavor of grapefruit, passion fruit, pine, and a quick bitter hop ending. Very nice!
Bottle from Target. Pours a light copper with a medium white head. The aromas are grass, citrus. The mouthfeel is dry and bitter with a light body and great carbonation. Cheers!
Keg @ Euston Tap. Fresh, fruity, invigorating.. a massive bold taste, excellent mouthfeel and a great teasing bitterness. Awesome stuff.

Aroma is light. A little malty. A little fruity but not so bad. 
Appearance is very bubble but amber. Lighter amber. Looks a little weak. 
Taste is watery. Lighter. A hint of malt on the finish. Some pine hops on the back end. 
Palate is wet. Lighter. Lingering pine note seems a bit off. 
Overall a pretty good IPA but nothing special. Definitely not the most flavorful IPA... Almost drinks like a session but maybe that’s because I love super intense beer. Idk lol
Nice smell. Perfect color. I like the carbonation. Taste is a hoppy, but with a watery mouthfeel. Has an aftertaste that is not pleasant. An average IPA.

12 oz. bottle. Lots of retention on a mostly clear gold. Aroma is citrus, grapefruit, pine hops and toffee.


The taste palate is a little watery. Flavor has some nice spicy and citrusy hops with plenty of pale malts to balance things out. Caramel malt mellows out the hops. Pine notes in the backend. Medium body, high carbonation and slick. Real clean finish. Bitterness doesn’t linger long. 


Overall an average IPA that is easy to find and not short on flavor. By today’s crazy DIPA standards this is pretty tame and could serve as a bridge beer for a friend that is just learning about IPA’s.This could seem rather boring for the extreme hophead.

Draft @ Three Fires. Sweet creamy vanilla and hazelnut aroma ... what the hell? No, I wasn’t imagining it, everyone else at my table got the same thing. At least I like vanilla and hazelnut, so it smelled OK to me, but not what I expected from an IPA. Clear brassy gold with a large off-white head, thick lacing. Caramel malt, orange, and herbal hops flavor. Medium body, soft carbonation.
Hopps right up the nostrils, boom! Taste is smooth and very easy to keep drinking, solid ipa.
330ml bottle. Yellow body with a medium white head. Tropical fruit, grapefruit and lots of pine.
From a 12oz bottle. A clean orange color in the glass. The aroma is strong hemp and damp pavement. Taste is wet hops. So lots of floral musk, but minimal lingering bitterness. Nice, everyday IPA.
355 cl Engelbrekt. Mörkgul färg. Doftar mycket citrus och tropiska frukter. Smakar citrus och grapefrukt. En favorit IPA.

12 oz bottle into a pint glass.

A: Pours a beautiful and clear copper color. There’s two fingers worth of off-white colored head, with okay retention and a soft texture. This head leaves behind nice lacing on the glass.

S: This starts off pretty malty. Once it warms up slightly, it develops a character of piny, grapefruity hops. The Lagunitas house character is pretty unmistakable - and as always, enjoyable. Their other beers show it off better, though.

T: The hop profile here is pretty mild: there’s only a slight flavor of grapefruit and pine. What there is, especially post-swallow, is a decent amount of bitterness. Normally, I’m not a fan of this approach to IPAs, but there’s just enough sweetness to balance out the finish. Since there isn’t much malt or hop flavor here, it’s mainly reliant on the house character of Lagunitas to provide the flavor - and while it doesn’t do a great job, it does just enough to make it solidly tasty.

M: While it’s a touch sweet, it has that clean, crisp feel I enjoy in IPAs. The dryness does a good job of counteracting it’s slightly full body. Carbonation isn’t much of a factor either way.

O: Solid, but not my favorite Lagunitas offering. Still, its great drinkability can’t be overlooked. It reeks of an old-school IPA with its prominent sweetness and generic hop bitterness - however, it’s good enough where I’d have no trouble putting it down again.

This IPA is actually really pleasant, you definitely know you’re drinking a hoppy brew with a nice bouquet of a varietal of hops giving this brew a nice aroma of fruit and floral notes and even a little grass. It has a nice apple juice color to it with carbonation and light silky head. The flavor is very light with little to no bitterness, very easy to drink. I just cant stop sniffing this brew! Cheers.
Draft pour at Mtc Office. Nice aroma, although a bit too fruity for an IPA. Taste is pleasant with little bitterness. For IPA, very drinkable, although low "hopiness".
Now that this has been on tap for 2 months i felt the need to rerate ....had to bump numbers up...very tasty india pale ale....fruity and hoppy ....big head....nice lacing....good stuff!

Bottle. Amber body with white head. Aroma is citrus fruits with some malt. Taste is fruity and malty. Aftertaste is bitter with some malt. Very nice. So that was 2014 2018 is still a nice one but not 4.
Clear golden pour with fair sticky white head. Clean but a little skunky bud aroma. Flavor is citrus and grassy hop. Very bitter, but not overly harsh. Good solid IPA.

Draft. Pours a clear dark gold color with a nice white head. Aroma is a balance of malt and hop although it leans a bit more to the citrus & pine hop side. Taste is the same - nicely balanced, the malt and hops work well together. Finish is a touch dry, very good. Excellent!

Humlig doft och angenäm beska. Något söt, kanske inte så balanserad som man hade kunnat önska.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at Janoinen Lohi, Helsinki. A color of clear golden with a little-sized but lasting white head. Aroma of pronounced tropical fruitiness, peach and apricot feature. Taste is medium bitter with lots of fruitiness. Peach and grapefruit feature, aromatic hoppiness. Palate is medium bodied, moderately carbonated. Very aromatic, tropical IPA.

Pour from a bottle. Clear light amber in appearance with a nice frothy white head and nice lacing. Aroma of citrus and fruits, flavor is much of the same with a pleasant lasting bitterness. A perfectly balanced beer 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
A great IPA. Super drinkable with friends, with food, or by itself. Hoppy and piney with a bit of malt.

12 oz bottle. Pours golden with tall, long lasting, fluffy white head and nice lacing. Aroma is of citrusy hops, orange marmalade and bready malt. Body is full and tangy. Taste is similar to aroma. Finish is long, dry and grapefruity. One of the better IPAs for me.

Draft at Wild Mike’s Shady Lane location on February 8, 2014. Amber/gold color with good clarity, pleasing bittersweet aroma with pine, citrus and other fruits, flavor has some complexity with reisin and lots of fruit, hops become more prominent as the glass warms. Good brew.

This ipa is very nicely balanced, which was a pleasant surprise. Big Centennial and Cascade hop flavors and aromas. A little bit of caramel on the nose. Bright clear pour with nice lacing from the white head.

Smell of hops, spruce. Very clear golden colour, small white head. Fruity, aroma of hops, flowers, fruit (mango among others). Sweet and very fresh. Medium soft and plentiful carbon. Surprising, yet balanced.

Cold bottle, 3 months old, into Struise tulip. Clear light orange, sparkling, big bubbly white head dissipates over a few minutes leaving a few islands of lacing. Smell - sweet lager, yeasty, leather. Body is medium, carbonation is medium to low, not foamy. Taste - sweet malts, floral hops, chlorophyll and leaves, drying. Saaz must feature prominently as one of the 43 different hop varieties they use for this. Nice enough.

Flaske købt i Fakta i Faxe til 18 kr. God ren duft af øl med en snert af citron, rigtig god smag, men lidt syrlig eftersmag som smager super godt, flot ren farve med hvidt skum som ligger i et stykke tid i ca 2-3 mm tykkelse, øllet forbliver frisk i glasset i god tid så man kan nyde den.

Slightly hazy golden amber pour with frothy off white head. Aroma of hops, malt, caramel and slightly fruity. Taste of caramel, malts, hops. Perfectly balanced beer, not overly hoppy, nothing over the top on this one, just a kick ass nice crisp refreshing IPA that you could drink all day. Excellent beer.
Draft: pours a golden color with a foamy white head... Aromas of pine, and dried fruit. The taste is bitter and fresh. Very clean and refreshing IPA. Nice.

Very tasty. Full aroma of piney and citrus hops. Copperish color that seemed highly carbonated but ended up being average and blended well with the bitterness. Crisp palate that coated the mouth. Strong solid flavors of even bitterness that leaned toward pine with a malty background that was neither light nor sweet. It just complimented. Good solid offering.
35,5cl bottle at Stöten. Pours clear deep golden with small head. Hoppy and pleasantly bitter. Nice aroma with fruity notes and hints of pine. Balanced and delicious!

On bottle at Stöten Ski resort. Golden color, good foam. Aromas of hops: good intensity , pine and some fruitiness. Medium body & complexity. Good bitterness & balance. Very enjoyable

Underwhelming IPA, decent , but I was expecting better. Nice foamy head Dry finish with some lasting bitterness, soft aroma and mellow hops bitterness.

Appearance: clear golden/ amber with finger thick white head.

Clear bright copper orange with small white head and no lacing. Aroma is relativelt faint: hop, crisp malt, some grapefruit rind. Taste is crisp resinous hop, nicely bitter though not much else going on. Body has some slickness with a thin-to-medium mouthfeel. A little boring but solid.
Crisp IPA. Light hoppy aroma. Clear golden pour. Slight floral hoppy flavor with bitterness. Not bad.

Draught. Pours pale copper in color with a small head. Fresh fruity aroma, summer meadow and ripe wild strawberry sweetness. Fruity taste, same wild strawberry sweetness and bit of grassy bitterness too. Nice, just the way ipas should be.

Bottle. Clear golden/light copper pour with a soapy white head. Aromas of citrus fruit, caramel malts, and tropical fruit. Grady hops up front followed by bright orange and citrus notes. Lime and caramel malts linger in the finish. Dangerously drinkable and lush. Fantastic stuff

Bottle. Pours clear light orange with a white head. Aroma is caramelly. Has a very balanced hop/ malt interaction. Caramel, bread, light citrus. Not a very good IPA, very boring. Bad flavors blends, just not that great.

12 oz bottle served in a pint glass. Pours light amber golden with thin white lacy head. Aroma is sweet oaky malt, and aromatic hops. Taste is medium caramel malt, sharply bitter yet balanced hops. Piney, floral, citrus notes to the hops. Nice basic west coast IPA. Widely available out here, so it’s a reliable choice.

On tap at Euston Tap, London. Pours clear dark golden with a small creamy white head. Aroma is strong fruity hops, piney, herbal and flowery. Taste is full of flowery and resinous hops, also a bit sharp and fresh new cut herbs.
pours a nice copper with an off white head. Nice citrus aroma. Great hoppy taste with an equally pleasant nasal linger. Great beer!
One of the best IPA’s I have ever tasted. So good and and wonderful aftertaste. This is my go to IPA

Poured from bottle at home. Color is a light orange with a thin white head. Good lacing on the glass. Pleasant citrus hop aroma. Taste is a perfect balance of citrus hops with a malty sweetness. Medium mouthfeel. A lovely beer.

Good head retention, light colored thin body, citrus, floral, light sweetness, medium bitterness, lightly sour, 
I enjoyed the first couple sips but as the bitterness settles in it turns sour. I did a little research and I think this is due to the use of Perle hops for bittering.

Bottle from Harvey Nichols, Leeds. Slightly hazy, orangey amber. Broken, lumpy, white head. Cut grass. Ripe strawberry. Tinned pineapple. Grapefruit juice. Taste is strawberry sweet, prior to the grapefruit bitterness kicking in. Sticky, lightly oily palate. Long, bitter, mouth puckering finish.

Amber/orange body with frothy white head and nice lacing. Floral and citrus hops aroma. Taste is resinous, nice balance of malts in there, sweetness with a bitter lingering aftertaste. Quite a nice IPA.

BD 291/13. Light amber pour with a very nice head and lacing that lasts. Nice nose of balanced pine and citrus hops against a sweet malt background. Light medium body with above average carbonation and smooth mouthfeel. The flavor profile is quite nice and well balanced. Toast malt, malt sweetness, citrus (mostly) hop flavor and a mild bitterness combine to produce a quite flavorful, but not over powering ale. The finish is crisp with a effervescent burst of sweet and tart flavor. A nice grapefruit flavor lingers. This IPA focuses on flavor, rather than bitterness and is outstanding.

Pours out a light orange color with a thin off-white head. Aroma is light of oranges, grapefruit, and pine. Tastes sweet with citrus notes first then fades to a resiny evergreen bitterness of cascade and perhaps centennial hops? Either way it is very well balanced between sweet and bitterness. Mouthfeel is heavier than expected, oily, a clean finish. Nice, not bad at all.

very good IPA, light yellow golden color and thin head. pleasant fruity aroma. very smooth fruity flavour well ballenced with hoppy notes. very drinkable while distinugishing itself from other IPAs. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

New Year’s Eve tasting Flight (1 of 3 8:12p) - bottled. One finger foamy white head. with medium tight bubbles. Orange body. Clear. Light piney aroma. Pine resin in flavor as well. Perhaps a little orange on the back end. Average mouth feel.

Thirty-two ounce growler from d’vines in Washington, DC. Poured into a a glass I like to drink beer from. Floral, hoppy aroma. Clear, golden appearance. Tastes like your average IPA, nothing special. Good IPA, typical showcase of the American bitter west coast IPA. Piney, citrussy and with a solid biscuity malt body.
Tap. Pint at Stanleys. Clear gold, great lacing. Smells hoppy. Taste is crisp bitter hop with resin. Clean and crisp. Good ipa from a place that knows ipas.

I'll always look forward to my next pint, just as I would with a lovely malty cask ale.
