Golden pour with a quickly fading white head. Good citrus aroma, sweet overtones with a bit of bitterness towards the end. A good example of an IPA that is towards the sweet instead of bitter side. Heavy on the palate, not a session beer.

A - Pours a quite clear golden copper - pretty color for an IPA. The head froths up a couple inches, but doesn't retain all that well. There is a relatively thin covering of foam on top of the beer for most of the drink. Nice lacing on the sides. A little bit of visible carbonation meanders slowly towards the surface.

S - Tropical fruit and sweet malts. Maybe just a hint of pine. It's a nice aroma, with excellent strength.

T - Starts to go downhill a little here. The flavors present in the nose are a bit too pervasive while drinking. I get something of an overpowering sweetness, with a nice bitterness, but one that is far overshadowed by the sweetness. Pine is present, but only barely, and only if I go looking for it.

M - Medium bodied, and a little slick. Refreshing finish, but too heavy to be refreshing. 

O - Mixed bag here. Ultimately it's too syrupy for my palate. I've also had mixed experiences with this 12 pack, the last of which I have chosen for this review. A couple felt wonderful, but as I got used to it the sweetness just became too prevalent.

FROM NOTES: August 7, ’12
Poured from draft into a half-yard glass at Yard House-San Jose. 

A: Strong notes of citrusy hops with some slight spiciness. Malts provide a nice balancing breadiness 
A: Pours a clear golden-medium amber tone while yielding about a finger of frothy off-white head; decent retention and lacing.

Lagunitas makes excellent beers and this is definitely one of them. Everything you want in an IPA. Great balance and taste. You can’t go wrong with this IPA at all.
On tap, at the Blue Frog Local 22, in Chicago. Pours a cloudy orange colour with a thin white head. Aroma is citrus and hops. Taste is hops, malts, citrus. Fresh tasting. Liked it a lot.

Deep gold, clear color, tall persistent head. Aromatic nose. At 6.2%, this is what Sierra Nevada Pale Ale was a few years ago - the go-to mainstay that people that don’t prefer IPAs enjoy and go for. For example, my 70-year old uke-playing neighbor that only drinks Longboard Lager says this is the best hoppy beer out there by far.

Keg - Sky Sports Grill, Auckland. Poured a clear, bright golden amber with with small though lasting and evenly lacing creamy white head. Citric hops with modest grapefruit but ever-so-lovely drinkability in that the hops don’t blow your face off. Balancing biscuity malts give body, substance and balance. Medium body, soft mouth feel with a sustained though moderate intensity finish. Thoroughly appealing and the sort of IPA that keeps the palate in check and slakes the thirst.
Pour is clear amber with white head and good lacing. Aroma of citrus, floral hops, light sweet malts. Taste has floral and citrussy hops, grassy, earthy, caramel. Low body and good carb.
Pungent, dank resionous hops meld with a honey sweetness nicely. Definitely pretty mild bitterness by modern IPA standards.

Pours a bit cloudy and with a medium orange color. Slightly off white long lasting head. Aroma is full of a variety pine, grapefruit and other great hoppy notes. Taste moderately sweet but accompanied by moderately bitter throughout. A medium body and an oily texture. A very satisfying IPA
Bottle. Pretty lit up by the time I got around to this one but I t hink it was damn good...gonna have to try again...
On tap at Old Chicago’s in Lincoln. Pours a golden color with white head. Hoppy, grassy, earthy aromas. Nice hoppy ipa.
Bottle 0.355l, thanks to mjs. Colour is clear golden with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Fruits, pine, hops, sweetness and malts.

(Bottle, 0.355 l - BBE 17032014, thanks Seppo S, 20130914) The beer poured deep golden and clear. Its head was medium sized and white. Aroma had fruitiness, pine and malts. Palate was medium carbonation with medium carbonation. Flavours were fruitiness, pine, grain, malts and bitterness. Aftertaste was hoppy and bitter. Nice but a bit thin IPA.

Golden orange, clear beer with a nice soapy head leaving instantly lacing on the glass. Aroma is sweet fruity with peaches and mango.Taste is caramelly sweet, fruity and resiny bitter. Mouthfeel is oily and sticky, little fuller than medium with moderate carbonation. The finish is surprisingly mild. A pretty solid and full West Coast IPA, but I would have preferred a little more bitterness in the finish. The BBE is seven months ahead (17042014) so maybe it’s not the freshest possible bottle.

On draft 8/7 at Boston Calling music festival. Nose is floral, grassy, not in your face hops. Mouthfeel is crisp. Taste is piney, hoppy, simple, nice. Finish is medium bitter, citrus notes. Solid, a good drinker. Good concert beer.

From tap at Monk’s American Bar Stockholm. Served in a Lagunitas jar pint glass. Pours copper with a medium head. Aroma is malt, grapefruit. Taste is typical west coast IPA. Grapefruit, lemon, malt and a good bitterness.
Good beer.
@Volby ølmesse. A fruity bitter flavor but somewhat booring with a watery mouthfeel. Color is amber with a white head.

Bottle. Dark amber with huge pale brown head. Aroma hoppy, notes of citrus. Taste very much dominated by hopp bitterness and not much else. Quite rough. These american style IPAs that doesn´t leave place for anything else than bitterness doesn´t really please me any longer. Rather boring.
roasty and floral aroma, dark brown with a frothy head soft sweetns and medium bitternesss. great palate.

Brought from CHI-land by ck1 for the Desert IPA-land tasting, but was left out due to not qualifying on quality. Thanks bro! Pours golden orange, white head. Aroma has subtle pine with some citrus, much more caramelly malt aroma further down in the glass. Taste is of light citrus and pine, some resin with a solid malt backbone. Light to medium bodied. Slightly sticky. Finishes to the sweet side of bittersweet. Not a ton of follow-through. Sigh, this is what it is, which was a very nice surprise in the ballpark in SF 6 plus years ago (already!) when expecting Bud Light, but really is just a decent, solid IPA.

Pours a nice ber color with a a decent off white head that leaves miderate lacing. Aromas of citrus, hops (a lot), and a little earthy scent. Hops grabs you first with notes of citrus and a touch of malt. Very pleasant beer, not overwhelming but definitely holds its own.

Bottle. Pours clear light amber with stable white head. Clear, intense hoppy aroma with notes of citrus and malt. Bitter, hoppy flavour with touches of malt, caramel, citrus and grass. Pleasant bitter aftertaste. Decent.

Rich copper color and a strong floral hop aroma. Nice hop flavor that is quickly balanced by sweet malt backbone. Some bitterness in the finish. Very tasty and drinkable. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Nice gold pour, medium head. Aroma of  earthy pine, citrus and grapefruit. Taste of hops then finishing strong with grapefruit. Decent ipa.

crystal clear, medium gold pour. Full finger billowy head, some lacing. Nose is pine cones. Bitter. Middle is balanced medium roasted malt, slightly earthy character. Finish comes back bitter, with alcohol starting show. Solid beer.

Pours a bright polished copper color. Very foamy white head. Stick, sludge like lacing. Actually, the term lacing seems inappropriate, it's so goopy. Nose is all hops. Taste is typical IPA hopathon. I'm not a big IPA fan, but it's a decent beer. Probably would be a touch better if I weren't being assaulted by the sickening stench of old grease from the fried rice all around me in this SFO dive.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

From, the "unlimited release" 22 fl. oz. bottle. The pour is a handsome and heady medium amber -brass with decent lacing. A good amount of earthy and floral hops on the nose along with biscuit malts. The body is medium and soft. The taste is like the aroma with a full burst of hoppy flavors, moderately bitter finish, and slightly sweet. A good IPA.

Citrus on the nose with golden color, medium bitterness, medium body, oily feel, average carbonation, bitter finish. I like it, don’t love it but still worth the $399 price for . A bargin among IPA’s.
Thanks to bamsen78 ! Decent, non-soectacular IPA with a smooth hoppy nose, bit citrus in the back and an unbalanced bitter finish. Drinkable though, but not special in any way. Quite average.

Bottle from Bamsen78 - thank you a lot, Marcin! It pours out absolutly lovely and IPA-like with a big nose of hops and spices and a crisp body. Taste of fresh hops, citrus, fresh coriander greens, pink pepper and herbs. Easy and nice to drink, very delicious!
Bottle. Pours clear amber. Thin white head, minimal lacing. Aroma is floral, citrus, peach. Taste is the same. Finish is mild bitter. Carbonation is average, texture is oily, body is light.

Bottle poured into tulip. Tremendous lacing after the light copper is no more. Decent citrus aroma. A bit carbonated but not too much. Very good mouthfeel and very slight aftertaste. A great IPA that I’d push on non-IPA fans. My first sample of Lagunitas but not my last. Well done.

Pours the color of golden straw. Has a deep amber resonance and looks like a bar of gold int he glass. Fat, rambunctious head of white foam that fell like it had all day. Left spectacular clinging lace. A true beauty to behold. 



Nose is sweet citrus with a tart edge. lemon and orange. There are tropical notes behind the citrus but it’s the zesty fresh scent of citrus peel that makes this one so tempting. It’s like shaved orange peel that is damp and sweet. There’s a light malt with a touch of honey. Touch of spice pine and a strong earthy scent. Sweet & floral. 



taste is delectable. All that fruit greets the palate and the sweetness hangs on as it’s washed to back by the light biscuit malt. I like that the malt in this one never goes to caramel and doesn’t overshadow the natural fruit sweetness. There’s a nice moderate hop bitter. It’s not aggressive and it it starts with a little oil at the back of the throat but the resin and pine remains light throughout. 



This is a terrific IPA that has plenty to offer in the way of a well crafted hop experience. The fruit was sharp and pungent on the nose and leads you into a drink that has all it’s elements complimenting one another. The body is full but on the lighter side and smooth. The palate is full of enthusiasm.

Bomber shared with Eyrish @ West Bay Whiffle. More unclear orange copper, medium foamy off-white head settles and mostly lasts. Aroma of piney fruity hops and caramel malt. Well balanced, moderately bitter taste of citrusy piney earth hops and lightly sweet caramel malts, slightly floral, some spice and grapefruit. Average carbonation, light-medium bodied, medium hopped. Long dry finish. NFL (Not For Lagerboys)
Flavorful offering. Nice and hoppy. One of my favorite beers from lagunitas. In bottle.
Bottle at the Boat basin. For having 43 hops and 65 malts this seems fairly light tasting. It’s growing on me the more I drink...
One of my favorite IPAs out there. If it’s on tap I will drink it. Refrigerator.
12oz bottle. Peppery hop flavor-with tones of grapefruit and orange. Nice bitter finish. No disappointments here. Good stuff!
Bottle from Coppers, Newcastle. A dark golden beer with juicy orange and pine flavours, slight peppery hops and a very bitter grapefruit finish.

Orange, grapefruit, touch of melon plus sweet malt aroma. Burnished gold/pale orange appearance; no haze; moderate off white head dissipates fast. Sweet light-caramel taste with immediate hit of grapefruit, softer citrus notes and rounder fruitiness come after. Some resiny pine dank bitterness. Moderately complex without being demanding. Decently full mouthfeel, moderate carbonation, lingering hop flavours. Pretty good beer really, could drink this every day.
Det här var en god men något obalanserad sak med en stabil kropp. Smaken bar toner av grapefrukt, äpple, passionsfrukt och sötma.
Great IPA! Great hop profile! Very good IPA for those just beginning to experiment with craft beers, but still complex enough for experienced hop heads.

Aroma: fruity, hoppy
Appearance: not hazy, orange-yellow amber color. Small head, lacing on the side of glass.
Taste: hops, bitter, floral, roasted, bright, pine
Palate: initially crisp and floral, then bitter and roasted pine on the end...
Overall: this beer is right up my alley, but I’m a fan of floral and fruity notes.

Bottle. Pours a Copper color with thin white head. Aroma of citrus, grapefruit, and resin. Taste the same, loads of grapefruit, resin, pine, and citrus rinds. Sweet malts balance out the mild bitterness. Thick and chewy. Pretty enjoyable IPA.

BLT Burger, West Village, NYC. Draft. Golden copper, off-white head, blah, blah, blah. Great burger, very good beer. Clearer than cloudy, more lacing than Coors Light. Didn't carry me away like Calgon, but good.

Amber with a small white head. Fruity and malty tones. Fruit, malt, pine and hops. Medium body with a nice bitter finish.

A lovely IPA, that is so easier to drink than the 6.2% suggests. A good hoppy aroma followed by a slightly bitter but satisfying crisp flavour.

Great consistent drinkable IPA. From the bottle, great aroma. Moderate to above average citrus hoppiness. I prefer a beer like this with a good meal. Great balanced aftertaste.

spruce, citrus, herbs, cereal, light sweetness, very bitter, medium body, oily feel, average carbonation, long finish,

Crystal orange with a slight copper hue. Just slightly off white head. Medium bodied and rather juicy with some sophisticated light juniper and hereby quality . Persistent light yet lingers piney nose. Delicate rings of complex lacking. The sort of beer Carey Grant might drink.
Great beer, different taste, but it has a delightful aroma. Definable texture, with beautiful aftertaste.

Bottle @ Mads, 10 / 8 2013. Dark orange, medium white head, okay lacing. Aroma, sweet hoppyness, fruity, malty, . Taste, bitter hoppy, weak malty background, . Bitter aftertaste. A bit too much carbonation. Classic ipa, would love to try it fresh. I do prefer the hop stoopid for lagunitas.

12oz bottle from the Beer Boutique, Putney. A typical American IPA, amber with a billowing, soap sudsy, white head; aromas of tropical fruit and pine trees; rich, buttery, mango taste; with a sharp, dry, birch twig finish and some warmth from the alcohol. Once upon a time this would have been considered exotic in England, but nowadays we have many more assertive IPAs of our own.

Bottle. 

Light amber with a medium white head. Smooth and easy to drink with hops, grass and some malt. Not that bitter.

Pours a golden-ruby color with a generous white head. Nice hop nose followed by a somewhat bubble gum sweetness. Definitely leans more toward the malt flavor than a hop bomb ( for an IPA ). Paired nicely with the artichoke & monterey jack dip that I had with it. Overall, very drinkable.

6-pack purchased from a convenience store in Portland. Pours clear amber. Brilliant aroma of strawberry and citrus fruits. Fruity hop taste, also a little herbal. Medium body. Good, but not my favourite IPA or my favourite from Lagunitas.
Keg at the Euston Tap, 7th August 2013. This is a great balanced IPA, very drinkable and a session beer, definitely US in style, with the low ABV

Bolton Brew.

On tap pint served in a weizen glass at The Bistro in Old Line Wine in Beltsville, MD. 

Clear, effervescent, medium amber with a 2-finger off-white head and awesome lacing. The weizen glass shows off this stunning brew beautifully.

The aroma consists of a well-balanced blend of caramel, citrus, floral hops, pine and tropical fruit. 

Taste of pine, citrus (mainly grapefruit and orange), caramel, pineapple and passion fruit in an almost perfect balance. 

Medium body and medium carbonation.

This Lagunitas India Pale Ale looked absolutely beautiful when served and did not disappoint in the tasting. I'm a sucker for beers that pushing the boundaries of a style to produce big, intense brews. This beer goes the other way and strives, with great success, to find the center and to perfect the style. It is not a modern hop-bomb IPA, but instead keeps malt and hops in nearly equal balance.

Keg dispense at the Ravensbourne Arms, Lewisham. Gold pour with a white head. Sweet spice and honey aroma. Citrus and honey flavour. It’s a scorcher out here and this is just the sort of stuff cool things down. Nice.

On tap atr Dockside Willie’s, Harrisburg. Clear gold pour with decent white head. Aroma is quite hoppy, pretty typical Lagunitas hop combo, light piney notes without being overly resinous, grapefruit, very typically american. Actually enjoyed this quite a bit, tasty classic American IPA.

Bottle. Pours clear golden amber with foamy white head. Aroma is milky citrus with floral notes. Also faint notes of warm wooden smoke, rubber and peber. Taste is medium sweet, medium bitter and light acidic. Body is milky with soft carbonation. Finish is long and surprisingly sweet with notes of raspberry lemonade and strawberries but also notes of resin, spruce, pine seeds and citrus fruits. Sweeter than many other IPAs but it’s very refreshing.

Pours a hazy golden with a finger of pure white head. The head lingers for a bit and dissipates slowly. A lot of lacing and some carbonation. This beer is just awesome to look at. Aroma has IPA written all over it. Very very hoppy and citrusy with a lot of sweetness. There is an awesome grapefruit, pineapple, nectarine and pine medley. Very pleasing. Mouth is very citrusy as well. A TON of citrus and bitter hops. A lot of grapefruit and pineapple yet again. There is also a decent malt presence which is surprising. A delicious IPA and the template of what all IPA’s should be.
aroma is moderate to low sweet and moderate bitter with caramel, citrics and pine, medium bodied, flavor is moderate sweet and moderate to heavy bitter, bitter finish, average ipa

Quite nice but a kind of sweet soapiness cuts through the beer and spoils it shortly. Aroma is peach, hedge, rye, soap, colour is strongbow, carbonation is light, taste has an initial dryness then goes through soft fruit and sweet malt. Elements of hand cleaner - cloying by the end.

12 ounce bottle into pint glass, bottled on 5/22/2013. Pours slightly hazy golden amber color with a 2 finger dense off white head with fantastic retention, that reduces to a nice cap that lingers. Nice soapy lacing clings on the glass. Aromas of big grapefruit, orange zest, orange rind, lemon zest, floral, pine, grass, light caramel, bread, and floral earthiness. Damn nice aromas with good complexity of citrus hop notes with a light-moderate malt balance; and good strength. Taste of grapefruit, orange zest, tangerine, orange rind, lemon zest, floral, pine, grass, light caramel, bread, and floral earthiness. Fair amount of floral/pine bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of citrus, citrus zest, floral, pine, grass, bread, light caramel, and floral earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Very nice balance and complexity of hop flavors; with a light-moderate malt balance and zero cloying flavors after the finish. Medium carbonation and body; with a smooth, crisp, and moderately sticky mouthfeel that is great. Alcohol is very well hidden with only a slight warming noticed after the finish. Overall this is an excellent IPA. All around great balance and complexity of hop flavors with light-moderate malt; and very smooth and crisp to drink. A really enjoyable offering.

Hazy orange colour with a white head. Aroma and flavour of hops, fruit and malt.

Bottle. Pour is golden, big white head that sticks to the glass. Aroma is malty to start, roasted bread, earthy hops, some citrus. Taste is juicy tropical fruit, pine, slightly toasty malt,  grapefruit.
On tap at San Pedro market, San Jose. Pours clear amber with little head. Floral and citrus nose. Medium mouth feel and uniform bitterness throughout.very drinkable.

Have had this plenty of times, most recently last night at Murray’s Cheese Bar (Shana’s bday party). Solid, dark amber pour. Juicy, earthy hop aromas and similar palate. Medium bitterness, but the hop bitterness is not lasting - clean finish. Really solid and crisp, even if it’s not a standout.

Draft at Nya Tröls.
Hazy dark amber with a off white fluffy head.
Aroma has fruity hops with caramel as well as quite faint cookie dough malt.
Taste follows aroma well with a bitter hop punch at the end.
Oily and smooth mouth feel, medium body as well as carbonation, a bit too easy to drink. Piny and citrus hop after taste.
Very well balanced, neither malt nor hops take the 1st place in this IPA.
Nice well balanced IPA (For once!).
Grassy hops with a bit on a lemony zing. Yellow in color with thin head.  Oily mouth feel.
Really tasty ipa. Aroma is fruity, hops. Flavor is hoppy, bitter, refreshing.

Not the star in the Lagunitas hop forward lineup, but a solid representation of the style nonetheless. Pleasing bitterness and a warm well rounded toasted malt background. This is a well crafted IPA to be sure and would be a great recommendation to someone just getting their IPA / hop fix on.  Very quaffable.
Bottle from mikkeler beer shop. Not much aroma, little fruity. Lots of hops but not really well done. Good ipa but not my favourite.
Smak och doft av humle, malt, tropisk frukt. Lätt kropp med en grape- och citrusbeska. Lätt sötma.
Draft. Solid IPA, clear with decent head. Strong hops and bitter finish. Good all around

Bottle.  Pours a clear golden orange color with a small foamy head that leaves some lacing behind.  Faint aroma of citrus fruit and wet grass.  Taste is solid but boring.  Light sweetness, moderate bitterness.  Light orange citrus mixed with lots of wet grass and some flowers.  Spicy finish.  The hops are a bit on the stale side.  Thin body and it foams a bit in my mouth.  Decent IPA.

Bottle from Voldby Koebmandsgaard. Pours orange colour, with a small white head. This has a good overall citrus fruity taste/aroma but with the large amount of hops used here found it abit messy/nondescript on the palate. Good still, just not as much as i was expecting.
Amazing to learn about the 43 hops and 65 malts, really?!?  True or not, the best beer I’ve ever had!
Decent IPA that is easy to drink but nothing exceptional in aroma and taste.  I would rather have another Stone IPA in the future then buy his again.
Out of keg,  very noticeable smell.  Awesome floral aroma that comes from the belgian yeast.  Appearance is an apricot color very clean and clear,  overall a great day beer.

Good standard IPA with a sweet maltbase with notes of caramel and a crisp citrusy hop profile. Refreshing!

A very nice amber pour with a big white head that quickly fades into significant lacing.  The aroma is dominated by the hops but they aren’t too powerful.  The taste is surprisingly clean and easy on the palate.  The hops are present but this is one of the most drinkable IPAs that I’ve come across.  It’s quite smooth and sessionable!

Lagunitas India Pale Ale is a great session beer.  Aroma is light are floral.  Pours and expected clear amber with  a nice head that doesn’t stick around long.  Lagunitas IPA is nicely balanced with a nice hop flavor, a bit a of sweetness, and only a light bitterness at the end.  Lagunitas IPA is a great go-to everyday beer although low on the complexity scale for the style.

Bouteille 22oz. De couleur ambrée et claire. Nez de houblon fruité (agrumes, léger d’abricots), citrique, moyennement herbeux, légèrement floral et résineux, malté de caramel doux, léger de pain avec des notes de biscuits. Moyennement ronde en bouche avec un pétillement moyen ainsi qu’une texture aux notes huileuses et résineuses. Goût moyennement amer de houblon citrique, fruité (agrumes, léger d’abricots), légèrement herbeux et floral (une amertume présente toute la gorgée) lors de l’entrée en bouche auquel se rajoute un goût de malt léger-moyen sucré (caramel doux) aux faibles traces rôties avec un léger goût de pain et des notes de biscuits puis en finale l’amertume de houblon se veut plus herbeuse, moyennement résineuse et légèrement asséchante. Post-goût long et aux notes sèches, moyen-amer de houblon citrique, moyennement fruité (zeste d’agrumes, notes de pelures d’abricots), résineux et léger-moyen herbeux avec des traces de malt sucré.

Bue en fût dans un pub irlandais près de Time’s Square. Belle IPA dorée qui offre un nez puissant de houblons floraux et d’agrumes. En bouche, l’acidité est puissante, le houblon aussi. Une IPA qui respecte toutes les règles du style. Les amateurs de houblon ne pourront certainement pas se tromper. Une bière que je rachèterai sans doute lors de mon prochain séjour à New York! Cheers!
Pours light amber with white head. Aroma is pine, citrus, bread. Flavor is good, hoppy with some malt, citrus, and pine notes as well. This is a solid I.P.A

When I think of good, solid IPA, I think of Lagunitas. Not the best one out there, but still way ahead of mediocre IPAs. It has a complex hoppy taste and aroma, and displays typical IPA bitterness, still well balanced.

Bottle from Voldby Koebmandsgaard, DK - Orange colour, with a small white head. This has a good overall citrus fruity taste/aroma but with the large amount of hops used here found it abit messy/nondescript on the palate. Good still, just not as much as i was expecting.

Bottom line....this is what an IPA was meant to be. Light, flavorful, citrusy, pine with a great finish. Perfect balance of hops, malt and alcohol. My go to summer beer.

12oz bottle. Pours a gorgeous, cyrstal clear bright amber with just a little visible carbonation and a thick foamy head that lasts. Aroma a big warm hops over bread with a little citrus in back. Amber pour and a white head. Aroma is of faint scallions, piney, grass, and citrus. The onion character is somewhat of a turn-off for me . Taste is piney, sappy, grassy, and slightly citrus. Finish is excellent: crisp, clean and dry.

Served on-tap at Green Dot Stables in Detroit, Michigan.

Appearance: Solid. Came with a nice head, had a decent color, and also had some pretty great lacing as well throughout.

Smell: Bang, bang -- citrus and apricots. Not a HUGE fan, to be honest.

Taste: The citrus and apricots/peaches/grapefruit up front that you’d expect from a California IPA, but the hops come through on the finish, with a pleasant bit of malt as well. Really quite good, considering I’m not a fan of apricots/grapefruit ... especially in beer. I also get a huge iced tea flavor. Much better than the smell.

Mouthfeel: Nothing extraordinary really, but with the taste and the rest of this beer, it just drinks pretty easily. One sip, and you’re wanting more.

Overall, I’m surprised I like this beer as much as I do. It’s VERY apricot and grapefruit heavy for me, but I still enjoy it... man, I don’t quite understand that, being ’meh’ on the two flavors. Regardless of that, this is a super solid beer that I’d probably try again, due to the awesome tea flavor.

nice white head, quite effervescent.  nice pine hop forward flavor with an orange peel on the back end. A very solid offering from Lagunita.
Bottle @ Pet Sounds bar. Good standard IPA with a sweet maltbase with notes of caramel and a crisp citrusy hop profile. Refreshing!
12 oz bottle. Pours a slightly hazy amber with medium head. Aromas of malts and light citrus/pine. Flavors of malts, resin, and combo of bitter hops and PNW citrus/pine hops. Basic but good.

Aroma is a blend of caramel and fruit with a hint of resin. The fruit is a blend of esters and hop character and is pear, guava and a hint of perfume. Light grapefruit note an background pine resin. I think the fruit note is actually from the way the caramel is interacting with the hops and it works well compared to other beers that use a lot of caramel malt. 
Pours a slightly cloudy copper orange with a pillowy, slightly off white head that steadily recedes about half way before slowing down. Has very good lacing and small legs. 
Flavor is a balanced blend of hops and caramel malt. There is a background cracker and biscuit malt note. The hops is the flavor are more the traditional grapefruit and pine resin character. Light alcohol spice in the finish. Moderate hop bitterness but not astringent at all. Light fruit notes throughout - mostly tropical fruit and pear. 
Mouthfeel is medium bodied with medium carbonation. Low astringency and medium low alcohol warmth. A bit sticky sweet in the finish. 
Overall the beer is a nice traditionally balanced IPA using American hops. It's not as dry as I would prefer though. The hop character is also a bit light an the caramel on the strong side.

Pours a clear golden with a very nice white head on top with the wonderful aromas of hops and citrus.  The hops provide that much sought after aroma and taste here.  One of the best IPAs I have had. Hmm...I’m surprised I haven’t rated this.  Pours a clear bright golden with a white head.  Aroma is hoppy, along with pine grapefruit, orange, and pineapple.  The taste is less citrus and more and has more hops and piney impressions.  It also has some caramel malty undertones.  This one is well balanced all around with what it offers in flavor.  Dry, with a very piney aftertaste.  Medium in body, with a texture that is sticky and slightly rough.  Lively carbonation.  I actually find this quite refreshing.  This is a very good, although maybe unspectacular IPA.  However, I really don’t find any weakness here, and is pretty solid with all it offers.  And it isn’t to heavy so that you can have a few of these.  This is as easy go when and where you find it available.

Yellow Orange pale ale pour with a light head. Aroma is a good pine with a light sweet malt undertone. Nothing to surprising in the flavor. A good hop tone with a little citrus hanging around. Overall a good IPA.

Draft at CAH. Pours pale gold with some head that leaves sticky lacing in the top of the glass. Nose is mild spicy hops and biscuity notes,  nice citruus in the first sip but the dryer finish is slightly disappointing.
Pours a coppery dark yellow. Not much aroma, but a little citrus. Not an in your face IPA, more light and subtle like a pale ale. Expected more but obviously this was made to be a session beer.

12oz bottle ----> tulip.  Pours a light amber/orange with a tiny white head and a little lace.  Smells mostly of bread and a small bit of caramel   Taste is dough and faint bitter orange.  Pretty nice medium palate.  Fairly weak representation of an IPA.  I expect a little more from Lagunitas.

Orange/amber color with small head and little lacing.  Aroma is of sweet malt and caramel with some citrus.  Taste is malty and sweet also with surprisingly less bitter than one would expect from the style.  Moderate carbonation and thin mouth feel.  Good for an IPA. 


---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
A light blonde IPA with notes of bread, citrus and pine.  Not very bold or hoppy for an IPA.  Drinks like a 35ibu pale ale.  Tastes good, but I think it’s a little too tame for the style.

This is one good beer. Not a strong aroma but floral and citrusy very well done. Pour slowly has a frothy had that last long time. Great IPA taste with notes of floral and citrus. One of my favorites.
Tasted from a bottle. Light amber color. Bright hop aroma. Great tasting IPA.

0.33 l bottle. Light amber colour with a thin white head. Floral, hops and malty aroma. Sweet malty character, wellbalanced bitterness. Medium body.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a clear orange copper color with decent off-white head.  Aroma is malt-forward, with a crisper pine more evident later.  Taste is mild on the hop side, decently bitter in the finish.  Malts are winning the battle, with the Lagunitas signature flavor the saving grace of the balance.  It?s good, but not great.  Update:  Big pils aroma... Not my idea of a solid IPA.

On tap @ Buster?s on 28th.  Pours amber with quickly fading head.  Aroma is pine, grass, with some lemon that reminded me just a little of a cleaning solution.  Not as bad as that makes it sound, however.  Taste is great - crisp, piney hops with an ideal level of bitterness.  7+3+9+4+16=3.9

12 0z. bottle poured into a Duvel tulip glass. Nice amber IPA color,1 finger head that dissipates into lil’ pillowy islands. Piney/resiny, hop  & big malty aroma nose. Hop dominate mouthfeel with all  the malts following through on the backside giving a chewy sensation. Seems nicely balanced & very drinkable,will seek again.
Doesn’t have very much citrus, but it indeed has quite the assault of chamomile flowers, green cardamom seeds, white grape skins,and hops. Fragrant, floral, refreshing and lovingly spicy. Yum, yum.

1 Pint 6oz bottle.  Pours a clear golden orange with an off-white head.  The nose is resinous up front followed by some seriously beautiful tropical fruit notes, golden syrup, and apricot.  Medium bodied, and easy drinking with lighter versions of the notes found in the nose.  Add to that an herbal note, and a nice amount of bitterness.  Totally solid.
Pours a fairly clear dark gold with a moderate head.  Aroma of pine, slightly sweet taste balanced by abundant hops.  Very good IPA.

Bottle, shared with BBGTC. Hazy light orange body with a small white head. Aroma is caramel, peaches, mild citrusy pine hints. Mellow and nice. Taste is caramel, floral honey tones, hints of apricot, pine and grass. Mild, and it seems the hops have faded a bit. Smooth body, medium carbonation. Pretty nice, although I wish for more freshness (which probably has to do with age/transportation).

Poured from a 12 ounce bottle into a brandy snifter. Pours a translucent copper with a decent sized white head of foam. The aroma is grassy and on the verge of skunky. Really did not anticipate that. The taste is over the top malty for an IPA. When they say 65 malts, I believe it. Very bready and caramely and cerealy. Perhaps a touch of vanilla thrown in there. Lighter on the palate than anticipated. Minimal bitterness. This beer is way sweeter than anything I could have imagined would be in this bottle. Really not what I was expecting.

Draft at Gleasons in Astoria. Piney hop profile. High carbonation and medium to full body. Has that trademark Lagunitas malty sweetness. Overall it feels a bit muddled and unfocused. Maybe its the 43 different hops.

A very good tasting ipa. Beautiful Carmel color. White thick head with nice lacing. Nice hop and malt balance with slight bitterness at the end.  Over all a good drinking ipa!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

0.33l bottle shared with The Tasting Crew. This is a blurry golden-orange one with a small bubbly and just off-white sidesticking top. Smells fruity and a but pungent-metallic hoppy. Almost like copper-hoppy. Some peaches also in here, but more subtle. It’s soft to average on the carbonation and kinda oily on the mouthfeel. More earthy and coppery bitterness in the flavor. It’s worth mentioning that this is not a totally fresh bottle. Caramel-sweet also with only subtle fruity and dry thing. A bit on the sweet side perhaps. Nothing special going on here, but it’s definitely a drinkable one. Wish it was a bit fresher. 18.10.2012

I bough a bootle of tLagunitas IPA because I was impressed by Lagunitas Hop stoopid.
But Lagunitas IPA left no impression what so ever. It was drinkable bot nothing more.

Clear copper pour, thin off white creamy head and lots of sticky thick bands of lacing ... Aroma is citrusy grapefruit and light piney hops with a touch of caramel malts ... Taste is bitter and rindy with light piney and citrusy grapefruity hops, light sugar, sweet caramel malts and a nice punch of ibu’s ... Finish is dry with a lingering bitter dry hop and malty. .... Solid sessionable ipa abv hidden well ... Mouthfeel is lightly slick and oily.
Great value IPA - $7.99 / 6 pack.  Good balance of hop flavors with alcohol content.
Aroma of strong hops and citrus got me really excited about this one. Tastes like out smells. Really good IPA. Had out of bottle at mojo

Goes well with a strong cigar.  Very hoppy and a smooth taste.  Enjoyable for an IPA fan.

For darkness be thy ally

This beer brings it home. Very nice aroma with a smooth balanced full bodied chewy aftertaste. It goes down well, and hangs in with great steak or spicy burrito. The flavor enhances any meal, but the true test of taste is the first sip, it has a crisp taste with a very recognizable Hop. Presents a clear amber color with little head but nice foam marks as you drink down the pint.

Beautiful orange color, clear with a one finger head and nice lacing.

A sweet pine-hoppy aroma. Some flowers and citrus.

Definitely a hoppy IPA. Floral and grapefruit citrus flavors also present. Not that sweet, fair amount of bitterness.

Body is light and dry, slightly slick, with medium carbonation and a nice lingering aftertaste of bitter hops.

Drinks quite well for the style. Certainly something I’d be happy to grab a sixer of or recommend to friends who like IPAs.
On tap. Amber, slightly cloudy. Small, foamy head. High hops edge. Very citrus flavoring. Little sweetness. Very drinkable. A high point of my different pours this evening.

First beer rate of my bachelor party in Chapel Hill. Clear orange. Thick off white head. Sticky , herbal nose. Some orange candies. Taste is oily, squashy, minerally, a bit bitter. Soft overall. Easy to drink. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle was a little past its prime, so I’ll take that into account. Pours a hazy orange with a nice white head. Aroma is a decent balance of pine and citrus notes. Taste is very much the same, although not as bitter as you might expect. Very well-rounded, if somewhat forgettable. Good beer to try once and have occasionally, but I would quickly become bored if I got a 24-pack of this.
Good beer - stand by.  Very hoppy, not too boozy.  Nice citrus, decent bitterness.  It fits every day.
Had on tap. It was a good IPA, you knew it was west coast in its aggressive hopping. Taste was tilted towards the bitters but you could still tell there was a malt backbone.
Unimpressive. It’s odd,with an almost corny, bready flavor. Not my thing, but not horrible.

12 oz bottle poured clear amber with a small head that leaves ample lacing. A woody, earthy hop aroma is followed by a flavor that is a bit more fruity and a lot more piney in tasting.  Moderately bitter, with a suitable hop/malt balance.  Good carbonation level.  Disappointing for Lagunitas in general and for the brewer of Hop Stoopid in particular.
Aroma is grapefruit and a hint of spice and slight sweetness.  The flavor is grapefruit, citrus, biscuit malts, fruit and a very dry and medium bitter finish.

Pours a nice orange color with a fluffy off-white head. Aroma is surprisingly mild; citrus, pine, some caramel. Taste is clean, fruity, citrus, some pine-flavored bite; a nice hoppy bitterness. Pretty drinkable. Medium-high carbonation. No remarkable lacing. Overall, very nice.
Aroma is very northwestern hop style, citrus, floral.  Taste is smooth bitterness with more of that northwestern hop flavor.

330ml brown bagged bottle  on a bench in QUeens, IX2012 - All-round enjoyable, traditional West Coast IPA that hits all the right notes when you have a thirst for taste: pineapple, citrus, well-rounded malt sweetness backup up by a medium but still highly sessionable drinkability - glad they didn’t stop making this Libery Ale-style basic IPA when they ventured forth into bitter-young-men Stoopid Hop territory!

Ar: Lemon and pine of medium-low intensity, a touch of caramel.
Ap: Crystal-clear orange - medium off-white head, moderate retention, leaving a fine film of foam along the side and on the cap.
T: Bright orange, very fresh tasting - clean and toasty malt, semi-sweet, a bit of candied peach - medium-high and very clean bitterness - juicy lemon candy and orange on the finish.
P: Medium and firm body with high carbonation - finish is medium-dry.
O: Hop-forward, with very rounded, balanced, and fresh hop flavor - clean and clear bitterness, bold but not overwhelming malt profile - could use a bit more aroma, but otherwise very delicious.

Ipa classic. Pours golden with little white head. Faint smell of sweetness and grain. Tastes smooth and balanced rolls off the tongue with notes of biscuit and Flora. Mild hop bitterness, it’s my alternative to Water
golden hazy. Some pine and caramel. Taste has some berries and fruityness and bitter finish. Decent caramel backbone.

Draught. Clear golden/amber liquid with medium to big off-white head. Aroma of tangerine, lemon grass, caramel, biscuit, bread, citrus and light tropical fruit. Taste is dry and medium bitter (a bit low for the style) and has notes of tangerine and caramel. Medium bodied with medium carbonation. Very drinkable. Quite nice.

Bottle. Pour is a nice gold color with a short lived white head that leaves plenty of patchy lacing. Aroma is on the lighter side;  grassy pine and citrus. Taste follows suit, with a bit of sweet malt to round things out. Crisp, dry, bitter finish. A solid IPA in an excellent line of IPA’s

Bright, golden color with a sticky white head. Citrus, tropical fruit, and a touch of pine in the aroma. Smooth palate, lingering finish. Big hop flavor with enough malt to balance. Not a crushing bitterness, but leaves enough dryness to beg for more. Quite refreshing and pleasing. A winner!

Tried this on tap at the Yard House in Lone Tree, Colorado. Piney, floral hoppy aroma. A drop kick to the taste buds with the hops selection and a nice bitter (lingering) aftertaste.

Draft. Poured clear amber with a white head. Bright fruit flavor with some pine and good malt flavor with a nice caramel component bringing good balance. Very drinkable.

Bottle. Dark golden/amber colored. Clear. Dark beige dense head. Lasting. Flowers, fruit, herbs and sweetness in the aroma. Flavour is malty and sweet with a herbal hoppyness. Is quite grassy. Well balanced and medium bodied. Is medium bitter in the end. Quite good one.
I loved the taste of this brew, exactly what I expected for an ipa. I would suggest giving it a shot

5-6 month old bottle to a pint glass. Pours a very clear orange with a thin white head that leaves decent lacing. Aroma is mild fruity esters. Orange, grapefruit, and pine as well as caramel. Taste is pine, grapefruit, orange, tangerine, and a touch of bread and caramel in the back. Thinner and easy to drink with a good aftertaste. Nice ipa.
Bottle pour. Clear orangey yellow color quickly dissipating head. Aroma not too overwhelming, ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Smells of pine and grapefruit. We’re not off to a good start. Pours a nice honey gold with thick white head and a good amount of lacing. Unfortunately it tastes just like it smells: pinesol and grapefruit juice.  The IPAs I like are few and far between but I’ll still try to find them.

Long Island, NY - 12 oz. bottle poured a amber clear color with minimal head and slight lacing. Aroma is hoppy to say the least with citrus notes. Taste is initially sweet followed by a hop explosion. The IBUs linger until the next great sip.

Hazy orange. Aroma is faint citrus, grass, and something oddly astringent in the background. Taste is a nice balance of malts and bitter hops - not overwhelmingly hoppy. Plenty of carbonation.

Hazy orange-tan with a large but fast-fading head. Smells like pine. Hops are just a tad on the soapy side. Somewhere way, waaaaaay in the background is something sour. Plenty of fizz which with the hops creates almost a chill in the mouth before a warm finish. Definitely an interesting, balanced IPA.
4 oz draft sample pours amber with an off white head.  Aroma of citrus and malts.  Taste of sweet malts and the bitter hops.

On tap at the marriott marquis in san francisco. Pours a clear deep gold with a frothy white head. Pleasant citrus hop aroma.  Complex favors. Not i erly bitter for a west coast ipa. Quite refreshing.

Nice IPA. Good hop bite with some floral/citrus complexity in the taste. Crips an refreshing. Good beer.

Bottle purchased somewhere in Germany...! Grass notes in the nose, mild sweet grapefruit (really mild) in the sip. Decent.

O: This was a very decent beer. It didn’t wow me with any flavors, but a solid offering at a cheap price.

Copper pour with some citrus and sweet malts in the nose...hoppy, citrusy with a nice dry finish.

Pours amber with an off-white head. Aromas of citrus, malt, and grass. Taste is up-front bitterness, earthy, citrus, slight malt sweetness, and lingering bitterness. Full-bodied and creamy mouthfeel. A hop-forward IPA. The bitterness dominated a little too much for my taste. Will try again though.

Love Lagunitas stuff but cant recall having the plain ol IPA,before. Pour is a slight hazy orangish slight brown.
Pretty hoppy aroma with fruit/spice pine grass and a bit more of complexity.Malt a little bready,toast,sweet carmel.Some pepperyness.
Taste is same with dry toast oakiness,some tart,slight sour.,pepperSome juicyness..Bittering is grassy,slight tart/sour/peppery on the finish. Bottle:
Thanks to Soren:
My first beer from Lagunitas, love the lyrical content on the label.
An airy but somewhat vaster medium to small white head, which changes slowly into a more vaste (ashy) white lacing on top of an almost clear orange colored beer.
The aromas of hops are well present, a nice combination of hop (fruits like citrus, peach, exotic fruit), malts, barley malts, wood, herbs, tea, and some vanilla.
The taste is a nice mix (truely 50/50) of hops and malts. There are the many hop fruit, flowers, bitter, etc. There’s also an even amount of malts, barley malts, wood. Maybe it’s 49/49, the other 2 are the tea ish herbs and the nettle.
The aftertaste is not really strong and long but has enough bitteress with some hop flowers, barley malts and light
Medium carbo, soft creamy and light spicy mouthfeel, medium to lightly fuller bodied and a light creamy texture.
This beer’s soul seems to be a nice combo of things, like the hops that need to be present but are not truely dominating, some very good malts which blend in very well and some nice spicy notes while being sonewhere in the back but softly dancing on the tongue.
Nice beer!

From a Can to a Glass. Pours a clear Amber color with huge head. Aroma is Hops upfront , Mango, Oranges, Pineapple, Mango, Grapefruit, Citrus notes, Bready malt. Taste follows the aroma well medium mouthfeel. Decent lacing on the Glass. $1.99 for 3.2oz Can great value for the quality of Beer.

Most IPAs I’ve had are of the PNW style.. I guess this is a typical California style. What I find most different is the amount of dry hay in the aroma and flavour. The mouthfeel has found a nice place, half way between cream and light. So it makes its presence known but is still easy to down...  

Good for you, California. Keep it up and you’ll one day get to the level of Oregon/Washington/BC. Kidding, kidding, everything I’ve had from that state has rocked so far.

This ale really hit the spot.  Long hard day at work, a million one things to do before getting home, but all knowing that I’d picked up a bottle of this en route.   A brief chill in the freezer, then into a big glass and mmmm.  Classic pale ale colour, lingeringly frilly head, a real whaft of citrus and grass on the nose.  Lovely balance in the mouth, light but with enough stickiness and solidity from a well constructed malt.  Lingeringly bitter, just asking for the next sip.  Yum.

Cripes. Have had many times on tap and bottle. This be a tap review. Darby's pub once again. 

Pours a clear copper with minimal head. I think it might be low in the keg. As such, my review will be based on previous nights tasting. Soft grapefruit aroma, and sugary pine. Taste is smooth and creamy, with citrus bitters. Medium dry finish. Super easy drinkin.

Solid floral aroma. Good bitterness and a nice malt backbone.  Nothing spectacular but pleasant.

Unfortunately, straight from the bottle. No idea what it looks like. Spruce, resin, caramel. Slap you in the face bitterness. Mild sweetness. Body is lively and a tad acidic. Pretty nice.

A fair amount of piney, grapefruit pith and bitter citrus dominate this beer. Subtle layers of caramel malt contrast the hops well. Just the right amount of everything makes this a balanced brew. A good standard beer. 

--- tasted while on a long journey to understand the world around me...

Piney aroma and good head.  Compared to some other Lagunitas beers, this one is much less sweet - while some good caramel is present, the hoppy, piney bitterness meshes well with the rich, nutty, toasted malt backbone to create a well-balanced IPA that’s good all the way through.  Very impressed.

Pour is amber gold, great big soft white head. Nose is fresh, fresh hop, and citrus. Mouthfeel nice and clean, crisp even, though with soft carbonation.  Taste is not overly complex and has a nice caramel sweetness to it. Finish is nicely n balanced between malt sweetness and hop bitterness. Cracking.
Pours clear copper with big white head.. Caramel malt aroma.. Taste is awesome.. Very smooth... Love it..awesome finish
Has a funky smell, possibly post-date bottle?  It didn’t taste old though, so I doubt it.  Good mouthfeel, looks decent, has a overall sweet hop character.

Copper bodied and white creamy head. Dark yet fresh aroma, clean yeast character and woody hops. Good bitterness. Pretty lively carbonation and a medium medium long aftertaste. Doesn’t sound to special maybe on paper but it’s very well executed. (12oz bottle on Florida trip)
Just a great West Coast style IPA. Light malt profile and juicy citrus hops make this both interesting and drinkable.
Solid IPA.  Strong hoppy flavour, quite fizzy.  Pale yellow-gold in colour.
Bottle.  Aroma is pine, grapefruit and sweet malts.  Taste is mostly grapefruit pith with some pine, a little sweet malt.

2012: On tap at The Met in New West. A beautiful amber bronze color. Not a lot of carbonation. The flavor is highly hopped, with a trace of malt. Excellent!

..and much more recently on July 13th 2019 at Guildford Taphouse in Surrey, BC. 

After an obligatory tasting of an oh-so-bitter extra dry hopped variation of Fuggles Warlock Destiny, i found this extremely pleasant and more than a little sweet, and that in an entirely good way. 4

Pretty good IPA example.  Nice shot of hops, but they’re not overpowering.  Good brew overall.
En botella y tirador.Dorada con buena espuma,cuerpo medio,aromas  delicadas.En resumen.......Me gusta!

Nice golden orange color with a very hoppy citrus aroma. The taste was bland and slight bitter compared to the lively scent. An alright finish, but I’d say the actual taste and palate of the drink definitely doesn’t stand up to the delicious aroma. Meh...
35 cl bottle @ home. Pours clear amber with a white head that leaves a ton of lacing. Aroma is fruity hops and a little malt. Flavour follows the aroma quite well.
light hoppy aroma,amber, clear, off white foam, light sweetness, medium bitterness, medium body, creamy, soft carbonation, bitter, long finish,

Amber coloured and hazy. Has an off-white head, medium duration. Malty and hoppy aroma, faint citrus, herbs, odd malt. Flavor starts moderate sweet and finish moderate bitter. Dry texture and soft carbonation.

12 oz bottle from Premier Wine and Spirits (Halifax).  Pours a lightly cloudy orange with moderate-sized whiteish head.  Aroma is grapefruit, other tropical fruit and caramel.  Flavour is big grapefruity hops, with some tangerine and pine notes and a definite caramel.  Nice bitterness in finish.  Quite good.
Pours a light amber color with a moderate head. Good hoppy notes to the nose, but not too much else. The taste is rather hoppy, which makes for an easy drink.
Pours a light ambe with white head,taste the hops up front with a light citrus finish, overalla solid ipa

Clear dark amber with a thick white head. Powerful nose with pine and orange peel aromatics. Medium bodied, highly carbonated. This shows some caramel on entry before giving way to some tart grapefruit flavors. A bit English in style.

Pours a clear golden with a a medium white head.  Very strong citrus and herb aroma with some caramel and coffee malt.  Despite the very strong hops aroma it is not overly bitter and has a bit of a fishy or moldy/cheese taste that isn’t as bad as it sounds.  Medium to full body with a somewhat creamy texture and slight bitter finish.  This is a great IPA.  Especially if you like cheese, sounds weird I know but it gives it a unique character.  Up there with the best I’ve had so far.
Clear amber pour with a frothy white head. Aroma is pine and citrus rind. Taste is the same with some caramel sweetness. Nice bitterness.

A-- Poured golden brown. Half finger of white head. Very little carbonation shown and nice lacing through drinking.

S-- Grapefruit, pine, sweet carmel, some honey as well. Very sweet smelling.

T-- Hop flavors not there at all. Very sweet and a bit of a copper taste.

M-- Medium carbonation. Pine and soft grapefruit are in back of the mouth. A little bit tingly on the tongue.

D-- One was more than enough. Honestly thought very old. ABV was well hidden but there was a lot of carmel in this. No hop profile besides small bits in this.

12 oz. bottle.  Pours a clear amber/golden color with a marginal amount of white head (little lacing).  Aroma is mostly of pine.  The flavor is a bit of a disappointment; there is a definite hops character but the beer is not very bitter.  It’s a little light on the finish.  This is a pretty drinkable IPA--there’s just not that much bitterness there but also not much distinctive flavor that would make it a great beer.  There’s much better IPAs out there.
Typical IPA citrus (tangerine?), hoppy aroma.  Pale, dark golden in color.  Medium head with lots of carbonation.  Bitter hops, citrus flavor.  Very refreshing.
licht amber coloured body with a off white head a spicy fruity hoppy aroma a spicy hoppy little fruity bitter taste with a spicy bitter finish

On hand at Denver Summer Brew Fest 2012.  Clear slightly dark gold with a generous foamy head, loads of lace. Huge floral and resinous hoppy aroma, like fresh picked hops with some light grapefruit tones...but mostly whole cone floral hops. Flavor is great, and exemplifies the best qualities of the style--leafy floral hops, a touch of pine, and perhaps a little earthiness but with a calming and humble malt backbone providing enough sweetness to drink liberally.  Cereal-ish and caramalty, with a medium body...finally, an IPA that can be balanced, nerdy, and extremely flavorful.
Very good IPA. Nice pine flavor from hops. Very crisp in palate. Nice copper color. A smooth drinker at 6.2 ABV

330 ml bottle from City’s Choice, San Francisco, CA. Pours a clear and bright orange color with a tight medium white head that diminishes into bubbles and a small lacing. Aroma is hoppy but with a clear fruity character instead of the expected hop bomb. Notes of pine resin, hay, dry grasses, apricots, papaya and mango juice. A touch of lemon and an earthy hint complete a pretty rounded smell... but a little restrained. Taste is fairly bitter but not overy so for an IPA. Again marginal sweetness and fruitiness give more interesting touches. Lemongrass is pretty obvious but traces of caramel, green apples, tea and white grapes add some subtlety and complexity. Interesting and well balanced. Not extreme. Medium body, high carbonation. A pretty good IPA that does not overwhelm and could be drunk as an everyday summer beer.

Clear copper with a small but lasting head. Caramel and bread aromas at first, then (after beer warms up a bit) pine, floral, and citrus. All in all aroma not nearly as powerful as I’d have expected from an IPA. Flavor: wow, this is where this beer shines. Pine, citrus, bitter, cascade, and underneath it all caramel. Clean and so balanced that you almost don’t know where taste ends and palate begins. Memorable palate, not as bitter as your expect but extremely balanced. In fact, if I had to sum this beer in sentence that would be it: Not as bitter as many IPAs, but extremely well balanced, and, tasty.
From the bottle to a tulip.  Typical pine, spruce, citrus aroma.  Dark copper color.  Bitter taste. Medium thickness.  A very average and typical IPA, but good and drinkable.
On tap, pours light copper with a medium white head.  Aroma is pine and lightly toasted malts.  Flavor is big hops through and through.  I like it.
On tap at Flying Saucer on 7/20/2012.  Pours copper with a big white head.  Aroma is citrus and pine.  Taste is fruity and pine with some citrus hops.  Very good.

Bottle to pint (from notes).  Looks fine; reddish-orange with some white lacing.  Smells solid; sweet and grapefruit/citrus hops.  Tastes like it smells with decent balance.  Average on the palate.  Solid.
210713. Tap at the brewery. Pours clear copper with a small head. Aroma hops, citrus. Bitter fruity taste. Not Bad.
Bitter with some fruit taste obvious citrus a little much carbonation but a solid beer.

355ml bottle. Floral and grapefruit hop aromas with some caramel malt. Hazy orange amber colour with moderate off white head. Taste a bit of a let down, piney and earthy with less grapefruit and caramel than the smell. Body was pretty average. Overall, I feel that this might not have been the freshest bottle, I’d like to give it another try sometime.

Pours orange-amber with a little transparency. Thin head which laces pretty well on the glass. Carbonation is great. Aroma is amazing floral hops with some sweet notes to it. Good body and not too sweet. Finishes with just a touch of bitterness at the end and goes down smooth. Great ipa!

Nice overall IPA.  Smooth with a medium hop level.  Very nice on the taste buds.

Having given up on the keg taps at this pub we decided on bottles, this has a sharp, pine like nose and a particularly dry palate. Apricot?, grapefruit pith, quite demanding but not a sessionable beer obviously. Quite demanding but reasonable.
Very good kick off hops on the first drink, but the flavor doesn?t linger all day as it does in poor IPAs.

Tasted: bottle. Deep golden color with hint of orange. Medium white head with nice striping. Citrus aroma and a touch of piney hop. Flavor is a nice mix of grassy hops and grapefruit hop flavor. Finishes clean. Light to mefium body with enough malt background to keep balance while highlighting the hops.  A very nice beer.

Deep gold with white foamy head.  Piney-citrus hops on the nose.  Taste - you get walloped with the pleasant pine and grapefruit hops but balanced by a solid malt backbone.  Total west coast hop flavor.  One of the best IPA’s I’ve had.

Pours a golden red with a thin head aroma is a balance of Malta and hops. Taste follows, nothing really stands out. It's a good ipa it's just nothing special.

Draft. Pours a golden orange. The aroma is mild hops. I get a little different hops aroma than a lot of other ipas. Smells more like a brewery filled with hops. The taste is slightly mild, but very refreshing. A solid ipa for sure. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Nose is hops,  particularly the bite of grapefruit. Perhaps a note of apricot and tangerine. Taste is a sharp bitterness on the palate that focuses on grapefruit and tangerine. Bitter hops, particularly citrus notes. Aftertaste is lingering bitterness from the hops with a subtle malt tinge. 
Little malt flavor, but just the way I like my IPAs.
Bottled. An amber beer with a creamy off white head. Aroma is malty and hoppy, pine, grassy. Taste is malty, sweet and caramel. Dry and heavily bitter finish. Nice hops flavor, pine and grapefruit

A clear golden/yellow colored beer, with a thick white head. The aroma of fruits like citrus and orange, gentle bitter. The taste of fruits like orange with a little bitter. The aftertaste is sweet and enjoyable bitter.

Very aromatic (citrus, pine, hoppy fruit, slight malt) and tasting beer.  Lasting head and lacing along with a very flavorful beer.  Very balanced malt with hop bitterness.  Consumed in a Lagunitas mason jar at Blackthorn Grille in Lake Villa, IL

12oz bottle 7/7/12 (Trader Joe’s Napeville)-48° in Shaker-Pours a light amberish orange with a small white head. Aroma of hops, citrus, and slight malt. Taste of the same with more hops. This medium bodied brew is very well balanced and hits the spot. Great job.

Bottle poured into frosted mug. Pour was a nice clear copper with 2 fingers of thick foamy off-white head. Moderate head retention and could tell lacing was going to be heavy. Aroma is fruitful of grapefruit with some apricot and caramel. Taste is awesome with grapefruit, caramel and a touch of malt. Moderate hop bitterness up front that mellows in the finish. Very well-balanced IPA. Glad I took a chance on a case. Will enjoy it.

Beer lover, not snob.  This IPA is a favorite.  Nice grapefruit smell, perfect bitterness, and a smooth finish.  Deep amber with a med head and slightly thick mouth-feel.   It doesn?t overpower so it can be enjoyed in multiple units.

My third beer (and final) from this brewery, had in Brooklyn. Golden colour, clear, off-white head, long lasting and with decent lacing. Fresh hoppy aromas and medium-thick mouthfeel. So far, seems pretty close to their pale ale. Then, it changes. Not as hoppy as the other one. Mild grain and the aftertaste is a little metallic. I prefer their New Dogtown pale ale.

Clear amber pour with a decent head that fades quickly.
Aroma of apricot and a little floral, lots of hoppiness. Bitter with some sweetness to balance. Flavors of apricot, grapefruit rind, malt, pine, and grass. Lingering bitter finish.
Clean, drinkable, very nice.
Heavy on the grapefruit/citrus aroma and taste. Very dry on the palate. Medium to light on the body. Average IPA.
Possibly my new favorite IPA. Picked up this random 6-pack. Great looking pour, perfect gold. Wonderful citrus flavor. Great balance.

355mL bottle. Pours clear golden with nice IPA carbonation and a light citrus aroma. The flavour does seem a little all over the place but it just seems to works to well, sort of like a tropical fruit cordial. Well balanced bitterness to malt, nice beer.
Solid iPa, not too much bite and goes down easy. Found it easy to drink with milder flavors and it doesn’t overwhelm the food.
When will I ever learn to enjoy an IPA. Hmm...This one is actually quite good.

Pours a clear greyish-green with a ruddy brown head. A tiny bit of lacing. Thick barnyard aroma, maybe a little sweat and baking soda. Lovely maple palate, punctuated with pine and bubblegum. Creamy mouthfeel and pleasant finish.
The taste lets this India Pale Ale down as its other characteristics are excellent.

On tap at Benjamin’s. Wonderful juicy-piney hop aroma. Grapefruit and apricot. Dark orange-amber clear with light haze, topped with thin off-white lacing head. Medium body with medium carbonation. Starts medium dry with tons of hop flavor. Pale and crystal malt sweetness, tons of fruity hops and finishes with bitter and nutty sweet after. Nice IPA.

Draught at Brick Store Pub. Dark orange colored beer with a small white head. Typical notes of citrus and grapefruit in the nose. Moderate bitter for an IPA. Again citrus and grapefruit. Well balanced.

Pours a rich copper golden color with a nice 2 finger head.  Great aromas of sophisticated hops and mellow sweet malts... Peach, Pine, Cedar, Grass, Nectarine... the palate follows the nose nicely with a pleasant hoppiness that doesn’t hit you over the head but is pronounced enough to please a hophead.  Good balance between ripe fruit, bitterness, malts and earthy flavors !

Bottle. Pours a golden orange color with small white head. Immediate hops smell. Then some floral, grapefruit, maybe honey smell. Taste is all hops. Not enough floral, but good IPA. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Edited 9/8/12

Maybe my tastes have gotten better, but this is a better IPA than I rated the first go around. It actually has a good balanced aroma. Not too much hop smell; good floral smell. I guess I’ve tasted a lot of other IPAs since then. The taste is smooth at first, developing into a light bite at the end.
Great beer with amazing flavor. Refreshing to say the least. Pairs well with anything off the grill.

Smells like a lotta grapefruit and piney hops and a slight grassy smell. Poured a pale clear orange/yellow with a decent white head. Taste is a slam of hops to your face. Immediately tastes of bitter grapefruit, followed by a lemony sour and finishes bitter with the grassy taste I had in the aroma. Feels light bodied, a slightly slick texture and fizzy.

Very smooth for an IPA has a good palate and the aftertaste on the tongue is very nice.  Not what I expected from an IPA

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a nice golden orange with a white head and aroma of citrus and grass. Taste is sweet yet subtle, of floral notes, citrus, grass, pine, and grapefruit with a bitter, sweet finish. Very drinkable, good IPA from Lagunitas.

Pours a beautiful orange . Nose is citrus with predominant grapefruit and pine with subtle peach. Taste is full of flavor, light but bitter, and busting with citrus. Finish is citrusy, somewhat bitter and sweet. Very nive IPA. Quaff Score 8 / 10
New to this. Very tasty, unique flavor. Friend recommendation. I would purchase this beer again for sure!
Draft. Golden, thin white head. Grapefruit, strawberry, caramel aroma. Citrus, grassy, and caramel.

Clear, copper colour with a bit of a white/light tan head. Aroma has some hops and a bit of fruit, mostly orange. Taste seems fresh, it has a bit of fruity sweetness in the beginning but quickly converges into hoppy IPA bitterness. Light body, smooth mouthfeel, medium carbonation. Solid IPA.

Aroma is a piney citrusy floral not very strong. Golden yellow a bit cloudy light carbonation thick white frothy head little to no lacing. Taste a strong piney resin with hints of floral and citrus, dry and hits the roof of the mouth. Not my favorite ipa but not bad.

12oz bottle poured into a shaker. Pours a very lightly hazy dark orange with about a finger of thick white head. Aroma of pine and grassy hops. Taste is light bitter. Pine and citrus hops. Medium bodied with a somewhat thin texture. Lively carbonation and a long finish. Overall, very good.

355ml bottle.
Pale gold, white head.
Hoppy, resiny aroma, spruce, grapefruit peel, apricot, pinapple core, malt, caramel.
Dry, medium body, high bitterness, balanced CO2.
Fruity, hoppy aroma, citrus peel, spruce, malt, grapefruit, mango, passionfruit, well balanced.
(2012-05-13)

Nice copper color, little head retention, okay lacing. Overall I agree with others: it’s a pretty basic WC IP... pine, grapefruit, clean finish. Very drinkable, and certainly a solid example, but nothing earth shattering.

I’m trying to be objective about this despite the fact that I am getting really sick of IPA’s in general, That said:

Aroma is nice even for the style. Big grapefruit, pine, citrus/ spice.
Appearnce is lovely copper color with a big head on a rough pour that laces wonderfully.
Taste is a bit bready and sweet in the makt department while the hops follow the nose.
Palate is nice and semi-dry best for a refreshing style in my opinion.
Overall It’s good for an IPA but it’s definitely a West Coast style IPA and I’m getting a bit tired of the style.

From a bottle, pours a clear copper with a white head. The predominate aroma is sweet citrus followed up with a slight floral scent. The taste is sweet and hoppy with hints of bready malt flavors. Overall a delightful IPA.
Pours a clear bronze out of a bottle. Nice nose of floral hops. Flavor is a bit water, sweet, not so much hops.

Tap. Pours hazy gold with thin, frothy white head; short retention and some lacing. Aroma is caramel and biscuit malt, honey, floral hops, oranges, and light pine. Flavor is malt forward with good supporting hops (light bitterness) and faint hops; sweet finish.  Medium body, light carbonation, and low warmth.
Wonderful citrus hop aroma.  Clear golden ipa that tastes as good as it smells. Nice rounded palate that’s clean and fresh. A real winner.
Poured from a 12 ounce bottle. This is a tasty IPA. Fruity, citrusy, spicy, floral hops. The malts are nice and bready. Very well balanced.

355 ml bottle.

Pours a copper colour with a white thick head. Aroma of floral hops, pine needles and dough. Flavour of pine needles, strong bitter hops, flowers, dough, honey and caramel. Medium bodied, slick mouthfeel and a bitter finish with some honey. Not really my thing.

355 ml bottle @ hotel room in Copenhagen.

Pours clear golden color with small head. Aroma of pine needles, floral notes, hoppy fruits and grass. Flavor of resin, fruits, grassy notes, pine, mild honey and some mild goose berry. Quite weird as the description says.

4524

35,5 cl bottle @ hotel room, copenhagen

Aroma is rather fresh with forest aromas, resin, pine needles and some exotic fruits. Flavour is sweetish with exotic fruits, some gooseberry bush and pine needles. Some mint in the aftertaste. Slightly different IPA, but nice and refreshing. Almost too sweet though.

(on tap) Lovely aroma from the hops - I got apricots and floral. Very smooth palate - medium body, well carbonated for creamy mouthfeel. Taste is a good balance between sweetish malt and plentiful hops. Hops provide a lot of interesting flavour and a decent amount of bitterness, but strike the right balance as the bitterness is not overpowering whilst the flavour is clear and present. A really good IPA.
An orange beer with a small white head.  The aroma is pine and resin with some musty grain.  The flavor is also resin and pine with some nutty malt and floral hops.
Komplex, örtig, maltig, humlig...svårplacerad doft..men gott doftar den. Mustig, len som sammet och välsmakande. Lätt beska som finish.

Pours a dark golden brown, with a solid white head and moderate lacing. Aroma is straight pine and citrus hops. Taste is all hops too, but so smooth on the way down. One of the best balanced IPAs I’ve ever had.

I haven’t rated this? Medium gold in the pour with a fluffy white head that laces all the way down the glass. Aroma is very piney and grassy hops, fruity with a touch of sweet caramel malt backing it up. Nice balance of flavors that lead to a bitter and crisp finish. Solid IPA.

I like IPAs as much as the next hop head, but I just was not impressed with this one.  The nose was hop full with predominantly citrus variations.  The beer is a copper to orange hue with a small lacy white head.  The taste was more citrus hops.  This is where it fell apart for me.  There just did not seem to be enough malt backbone to balance the hoppiness of the beer.  Which left  the medium bodied beer with a distinct sharpness to the bitter flavors.

6th July 2009
Hazy amber beer. Light fresh palate. Fresh grapefruit with some orange. Reasonable bitterness. Just a great refreshing IPA.
Copper pour with white thick foamy head. Good amount of malt and damp hop. Light to medium body.

Fresh bottle, aromas of fresh fruit, chery fruit rollup, tangy pine, lemons. Taste is dank hops, mult. fruits, cheese hops, angel food cake finish and aftertaste. Awesome well balamced sessionable ipa from the hop experts.

Appearance was clear honey reddiesh caramel with creamy lasting white 3 finger head, loads of lacing. Aromas where sweet honey caramel malts upfront with bountiful of citrusy hops. Taste was sweet malt upfront with a complex hops inthe middle and end, but smooth balanced of hops. Palate was silky smooth with a balanced body and beautiful hoppy finish. I P A beauty...

On tap. Pours light amber with a good head that leaves a good amount of lacing. the smell is very hoppy, some citrus as well and maybe a little bit of bread. the taste is sweet up front with a hoppy taste. the aftertaste is bittier but not too overpowering.
Smells of caramel. Taste is OK. A case of crystal malts dominating the hops. That said, it’s balanced. Not amazing.

Originally reviewed: 4/21/09. Pours a dark orange with a decent inch-sized white head on top. No retention or lacing. Pretty weak. Smells of flowers, oranges, honey, and biscuits. Mouthfeel is nice crisp. Flavor is very well-balanced. Slightly bitter right at the onset, but this gives way to a biscuity malty sweetness. Well done. I’m tasting some tart apples on the finish. This is a decent IPA. It’s different than the big hoppy beers. Refreshing.
Great tasting beer, both on tap and in bottles. Been a favorite of mine for the past couple years

Pretty good for a standard ipa...but standard ipas aren't really my thing. Dehydrates me a bit. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a clear copper color with a small off-white head. Aroma of citrus and floral hops. Taste of sweet caramel malts along with notes of orange, pine and floral hops. Well balanced. Finishes dry. Medium body.
Excellent IPA. Very drinkable and smooth. Strong citrous notes and very hoppy. Fantastic.
Made with 43 different hops and 65 various malts, this redolent ale will likely float your boat, whatever planet .

from Mondial de la Bière 2011, Strasbourg  clear amber beer with a nice persistent beige head; fairly hoppy with notes of cream, caramel and apricots; creamy palate and medium-bodied; fairly bitter, long herbal and creamy hoppy finish with some fruity tones in the background
Smooth finish that turns a bit bitter at the end. Really enjoy the scent and the nose of the beer.
My first Lagunitas brew. Nice floral aroma. Taste was equally good. Plenty of bitterness but overall nice balance. This will definitely become one of my regulars.

Aroma- big ripe oranges, lemons, lemongrass, floral aromas
Appearance- golden orange, crisp and clean, nice carbonation, creamy white head, great lacing
Taste- nice sweet/bitterness upfront, tropical fruits, blood orange, big hop bite on the backend with resonating sweetness
Palate- crisp and clean with medium body and medium-high carbonation
Overall- One of my favorite, if not my favorite, session IPA.  Perfectly blended with insane drinkability.  Fantastic brew.
VERY HOPPY!  BEAUTIFUL GOLDEN/BRONZE COLOR!  Really enjoyed this beer... yummy!
Pours a light orange color with a medium sized white head. Aroma is of caramel malts, pine and floral hops. Taste is sweet caramel, nicely balanced by a citrusy hop flavor and lingering bitterness.

Nice IPA, but nothing really special.  Poured a nice clear golden color with little head or lacing.  Aromas are a bit faint, almost lager like, with hay and cereal smells.  A light sweet taste and a light bitterness.  Light bodied and semi-dry finish.  Overall, its OK, but not great.  I’d drink again for sure but many others to choose from.

Pours a light copper with a floral and malt aroma.  Taste is light and mildly grassy with small fruit notes.  Aftertaste is a little bitter but very smooth for an IPA, I expected more of a bite and was nicely surprised.  A good smooth tasting IPA.

A nice copper colored pour with a thick white head. Really great lacing on my class. Aroma of hops is dominant; citrusy and piney. Flavor with great and refreshing; hops that are citrusy and the pine. A low abv makes this a sessionable IPA>
Mild woody hops aroma with touch of fruit.  Pours golden w thin head.  Taste has nice malt balance, which is something overlooked by 90% of the so called IPA’s on the market.  Good brew.
ambrata buona schiuma piuttosto persistente discretamente agrumata caramello buon amaro
Pours a light copper color with a white head and decent lacing. Aroma is grapefruit, pine, and caramel.. Taste is more malty malty sweetness in front followed by a citrus bitterness. Medium bodied.

Draft. Poured a golden orange with an off-white head, long lasting lacing. Smells of big grapefruit, citrus, weed, grass, biscuit,  and tangerine. It has a very sweet aroma. Taste is sweet upfront, smooth and piney in the middle, and finishes moderately bitter - grassy, grapefruity, weedy, and slightly fruity.  I think this beer smells better than it actually tastes. Body is a bit watery, but overall a solid IPA.

12oz bottle. Pours a light golden color with a big soapy white head. Almost clear. Long lasting foam. Aroma is hoppy, citrusy and grapefruity. Taste is bitter with a sufficient malty presence. Loads of grapefruity hops with some pineapple and grass notes as well. Little caramel notes. Medium body and lively carbonation. Overall, good IPA.
Pours clear orange..almost gold. Smell is floral citrus and spicy malts. Taste is caramel some light citrus and strong spicy hops. Mild bitterness. Crisp IPA. Very solid.

This is my go-to beer for keeping in the fridge. I buy a case at Costco and feel no pain when friends come over and abuse my fridge. Its easy to drink without being boring. I talked everyone at work into a keg and regretted it. The keg had a much heavier hoppy taste than the bottles do. I had to hear the simple pallet co-workers bitch and moan until the keg was done.
One of the hoppiest beers that I had, I think that is there a lot of flavor overall and it carries the citrus flavor overall
Amber pour with white head.  Aroma of light citrus and caramel malt.  Flavor is fairly strong woodsy citrus and mild pine.  Some caramel malt.  Overall, pretty bitter and dry.  Average IPA.
Excellent balance, goes with everything. Here in Tucson the hoppiness is very refreshing.
Clear orange color. Airy off-white head dissipates quickly. Has a good semi-spicy aroma. Nice flavor of spicy hops with some malt. Light-bodied and smooth. It’s pretty crisp and refreshing.

Poured out of a bottle into wine glass:
Head: 1-2 fingers of white bubbly head. Dissipates quickly but leaves nice lacing. 
Color: off-yellow to orange. Easily transparent, not hazy. 
Aroma: Apple, coupled with orange/lemon zest. Quite pleasant. 
Taste/Finish: Initial taste of citrus hops and carbonation giving way to a crisp finish followed by bitter citrus hops aftertaste that stays on the tongue. 
Overall impression: I would say it is a smoother version of your run of the mill IPA. Aroma is fruity and pleasant, aftertaste is not strong but IPA drinkers may look for something a little more flavorful which this lacks.
Clear, such as caramel color. Smell like citrus and flowers. First, taste very dry , but remain good complex flavor.
golden color, aroma of citrus hops, flavor is citrus hops, strong grapefruit, caramel, dry finish, very solid IPA
A very solid IPA.  Clear and golden with a white head.  Floral, citrusy aroma.  Nice hop flavor with grapefruit dominating the citrus part of the palate.  Very refreshing beer.
Bottle: I was pleasantly surprised by this beer.  Very hoppy aroma and flavor, but a smooth easy drinking beer.

pours light amber with a good head that leaves a good amount of lacing. the smell is very hoppy, some citrus as well and maybe a little bit of bread. the taste is sweet up front with a hoppy taste. the aftertaste is bittier but not too overpowering.

Pours a slight clear amber, not much of a head or lacing. Smells fruity, a bunch of citrus along with a strong hop presence. Taste follows the nose well. Plenty of hop bite with a good balance of sweetness. No malt in here. Finishes clean with a good amount of carbonation. A solid, easy drinking IPA.
Bottle. Quite nice lots of hops with a great finish. As the bottle says "it’s doggone good"
